original: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las nyan thos kyi de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las nyan thos kyi de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter, the chapter on the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô entry into suchness, from the Commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way, called ‚ÄúThe Blaze of Reasoning.‚Äù

original: // / de nas da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u lnga pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u lnga pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to ascertain the suchness of the YogƒÅcƒÅra, I will begin the fifth chapter.

original: rang gi lugs kyi nga rgyal gyis //
analyzed: rang gi lugs kyi nga rgyal gyis //
translated: With pride in our own system,

original: mkhas par rlom gzhan 'di skad smra //
analyzed: mkhas par rlom gzhan 'di skad smra //
translated: others who are conceited about their knowledge say this:

original: de nyid bdud rtsir 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsir 'jug pa yang //
translated: ‚ÄúThe entry into suchness is

original: rnal 'byor spyod par legs par bstan //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod par legs par bstan //
translated: well taught in the YogƒÅcƒÅra.

original: theg pa chen po nyid kyi slob dpon thogs med dang / dbyig gnyen la sogs pa gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan cing /
analyzed: theg pa chen po nyid kyi slob dpon thogs med dang / dbyig gnyen la sogs pa gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan cing /
translated: Other masters of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, such as Asa·πÖga and his brother, were prophesied by the TathƒÅgata.

original: sa rab tu brnyes pa'i 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis yang dag par rtogs pa'i theg pa chen po'i don gyi lugs gzhan du 'dren par byed cing ngo tsha dang khrel med pa @199b don rnam par mi shes pa de bzhin du rnam pa shes shing mkhas par nga
analyzed: sa rab tu brnyes pa'i 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis yang dag par rtogs pa'i theg pa chen po'i don gyi lugs gzhan du 'dren par byed cing ngo tsha dang khrel med pa @199b don rnam par mi shes pa de bzhin du rnam pa shes shing mkhas par nga
translated: Those who are proud of their knowledge and expertise

original: rgyal byed pa dag 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: rgyal byed pa dag 'di skad smra ste /
translated: say this:

original: de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsir 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsir 'jug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nectar of reality is enteredüîΩby those who are skilled in the meaning of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: rab tu 'jug pa de ni bdag cag kho nas legs par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa de ni bdag cag kho nas legs par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: We alone have taught it well;

original: dbu mar smra ba pa rnams kyis ni ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbu mar smra ba pa rnams kyis ni ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: the MƒÅdhyamikas have not.‚Äù

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The characteristics of that [nectar] are as follows:

original: dngos po gnyis po med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis po med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the two things do not exist,

original: gnyis dngos med pa'i yod pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis dngos med pa'i yod pa ni //
translated: the existence of the nonexistence of the two things

original: yod la sogs pa'i blo yi yul //
analyzed: yod la sogs pa'i blo yi yul //
translated: is the object of the cognition of existence, etc.

original: dam pa'i don du 'dod do lo //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du 'dod do lo //
translated: It is asserted to be the ultimate.

original: gnyis ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The two are the apprehended, such as form, etc., and the apprehender, such as eye consciousness, etc.

original: de gnyis kyi med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of those two is the non-existence of entity.

original: med pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid du rtag tu yod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba gnyis su ni med pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid du rtag tu yod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba gnyis su ni med pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because the non-existent thing is always existent as its entity, and because of the non-existence of the duality called grasped and grasper,

original: ji ltar gnyis kyi dngos por med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir ni yod pa'i blo yul yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis kyi dngos por med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir ni yod pa'i blo yul yin la /
translated: it is the object of the cognition of existence, because of the non-existence of the entity of duality.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis kyi ngo bor med pa yin pa de'i phyir na med pa'i blo'i yul yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis kyi ngo bor med pa yin pa de'i phyir na med pa'i blo'i yul yin te /
translated: And because of the non-existence of the entity of duality, it is the object of the cognition of non-existence.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i don dam pa ni bdag cag rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de'i bsam pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩlo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos byed pa /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i don dam pa ni bdag cag rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de'i bsam pa bstan pa yin no // lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos byed pa /
translated: This is the teaching of the intention of the Yogacaras, ‚ÄúWe accept such an ultimate.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhowever‚Äù in the treatise indicates that the author himself does not accept such an ultimate,

original: de lta bu'i don dam pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i dpyad pa dag gis bsgrub par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dam pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i dpyad pa dag gis bsgrub par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such an ultimate is difficult to establish by the subsequent analyses.

original: de dag gi don dam pa de'i grangs kyi tshig ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi don dam pa de'i grangs kyi tshig ni 'di yin te /
translated: The words for the number of those ultimates are as follows:

original: med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa //
translated: The non-existent thing, the non-self,

original: de bzhin nyid dang chos gnas dang // rnam par mi rtog blo'i gzung de //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang chos gnas dang // rnam par mi rtog blo'i gzung de //
translated: Suchness, the abiding of dharmas, the non-conceptual mind‚Äôs object,

original: de shes par ni bya ba yang ;
analyzed: de shes par ni bya ba yang ;
translated: That is to be known.

original: / zhes bya ba la med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par btags pa gnyis med pa nyid kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par btags pa gnyis med pa nyid kyi dngos po'o //
translated: As for ‚Äúthe non-existent thing,‚Äù it is the thing that is the non-existence of the duality imputed as object and subject.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: As for ‚Äúthe non-self,‚Äù it is the non-self of dharmas and of persons.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
translated: As for ‚Äúsuchness,‚Äù it is the non-erroneous.

original: chos gnas zhes bya ba ni rtag par de lta bu'i tshul nyid du gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos gnas zhes bya ba ni rtag par de lta bu'i tshul nyid du gnas pa nyid do //
translated: As for ‚Äúthe abiding of dharmas,‚Äù it is the abiding in just that mode forever.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo'i gzung ba ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros kyi gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo'i gzung ba ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo gros kyi gzung ba yin te /
translated: As for ‚Äúthe non-conceptual mind‚Äôs object,‚Äù it is the object of the non-conceptual mind because it is free from all conceptualization.

original: de nyid don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa'o //
translated: That is the ultimate.

original: de shes par ni bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de shes par ni bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it is to be known.üîΩThe object

original: dmigs pa @200a * //üîΩla ni brten byas nas //
analyzed: dmigs pa @200a * // la ni brten byas nas //
translated: is the basis.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //üîΩmi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye // mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
translated: Non-apprehension arises.üîΩNon-apprehension is the basis.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: Non-apprehension arises.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa /
translated: Here, the so-called foundation consciousness has been operating since beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros ba'i bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros ba'i bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa /
translated: It is the basis for the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaborations since beginningless time.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yongs su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yongs su 'dzin pa /
translated: It holds the object and aspect that are not fully discriminated.

original: rgyun ma chad pa rdzas dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: rgyun ma chad pa rdzas dpag tu med pa /
translated: It is an uninterrupted stream, an immeasurable substance.

original: rigs du ma dang lhan cig skye zhing 'gag pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rigs du ma dang lhan cig skye zhing 'gag pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with arising and ceasing in association with many kinds of types.

original: nus pa'i bye brag mthar thug pa med pa thob pa /
analyzed: nus pa'i bye brag mthar thug pa med pa thob pa /
translated: It has attained the infinite variety of potentials.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul dpag tu med pa snang ba'i cha dang 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bskyed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i yul dpag tu med pa snang ba'i cha dang 'brel ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bskyed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the power to generate the six collections of consciousness that are connected with the aspect of the appearance of limitless objects such as blue.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pas pa'i bdag tu yongs su btags pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pas pa'i bdag tu yongs su btags pa /
translated: It is the imagination of a self that is the mode of existence free from birth and disintegration through afflicted mentality.

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it contains the seeds of merit, demerit, and stable states.

original: khams dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa /
analyzed: khams dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa /
translated: It contains the seeds of all the elements, reincarnating beings, and birth processes.üîΩIt is the continuum of the three transformations of karmic maturation, self-grasping, and cognition.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / ngar sems pa dang / rnam par rig pa gsum yongs su 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de la dngos po skye ba dang ldan pa rnams 'bras bu'i dngos por kun du sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / ngar sems pa dang / rnam par rig pa gsum yongs su 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de la dngos po skye ba dang ldan pa rnams 'bras bu'i dngos por kun du sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the one that connects things that possess birth to resultant things.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin te /
translated: It is also called appropriating consciousness.

original: reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes btang snyoms kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa 'di'i zhe'am /
analyzed: reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes btang snyoms kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa 'di'i zhe'am /
translated: contact, mental attention, feeling, volition, and the aspect of equanimity of perception.

original: 'di na'o zhes 'jig rten pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin pas rnam pa yang dag par mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na'o zhes 'jig rten pa'i mkhas pa rnams kyi yul yang ma yin pas rnam pa yang dag par mi rig pa'o //
translated: Since it is not even the domain of worldly experts who say, ‚ÄúIt is this‚Äù or ‚ÄúIt is there,‚Äù the aspect is not correctly known.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: 'phen pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa dang 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: that which impels and that which becomes the result.

original: de la 'phen pa ni rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phen pa ni rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'phen pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which impels is the impulsion by the power of consciousness.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: That which becomes the result is the establishment of the result of evolution.

original: dper na chu'i yan lag gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyun las chu bo'i klung 'bab pa de bzhin du bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kyang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na chu'i yan lag gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyun las chu bo'i klung 'bab pa de bzhin du bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kyang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as a river flows from the stream of one part of water to another part, so also the stream of the store consciousness, perfumed by the propensities of merit, demerit, and immobility, continues as long as cyclic existence.

original: de la gnas pa'i las kyi bag chags dang / gzung @200b ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / lha dang gcig tu lha dang mi'i lus la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ci rigs pa dag skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i las kyi bag chags dang / gzung @200b ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags dang / lha dang gcig tu lha dang mi'i lus la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ci rigs pa dag skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions of karma that reside in it, the latent impressions of the apprehended and the apprehender, and the consciousnesses of gods and humans, etc., are produced in various ways.

original: len pa'i rnam par shas pa'i rgyun de yang dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pas ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shas pa'i rgyun de yang dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon thams cad spangs pas ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that continuum of appropriating consciousness is stopped when the state of an arhat is attained, because all seeds of the afflictions are eliminated.

original: de ltar de ni re zhig rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyogs su 'gyur ba ste gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar de ni re zhig rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyogs su 'gyur ba ste gcig go //
translated: Thus, it is called the ‚Äúmaturation‚Äù and is the first of the aspects of that.

original: gzhan yang sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor bar byed pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor bar byed pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the storehouse consciousness is called the storehouse consciousness because it causes beings to be attached to a self,

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the view of a self and of being mine.

original: rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag dang / rang gis nas skyes pa'i reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag dang / rang gis nas skyes pa'i reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is always associated with four defilements: delusion about self, view of self, pride in self, and attachment to self; and it is also associated with contact, mental attention, etc., which arise with it.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de de yang dag bcom pa la med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de de yang dag bcom pa la med de /
translated: This defiled mind does not exist in one who has destroyed the outflows,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the defilements have been abandoned.

original: de ltar de ni dang sems dang zhes bya ba dang / de yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar de ni dang sems dang zhes bya ba dang / de yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is associated with the five ever-present [mental activities]‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt is transformed by the maturation of the seeds of action.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'dun pa dang mos pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba thams cad dang bcas pa kun gzhi yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi nus pa 'dun pa dang mos pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba thams cad dang bcas pa kun gzhi yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste //
translated: Moreover, it is called the container consciousness because it is the container of all the seeds and because it is the support of present experience.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no //
translated: It is also called the fundamental consciousness.

original: de las mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji ltar nye bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de las mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji ltar nye bar gyur pa na /
translated: When the conditions of the eye, form, light, space, and mental activity are present,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung ste /
translated: the six collections of consciousness arise.

original: dper na rgya mtsho las chu'i rlabs dag rlung dang chu srin gyis bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho las chu'i rlabs dag rlung dang chu srin gyis bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the waves in the ocean that arise due to the conditions of wind, sea monsters, and so on.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is not the same as those active consciousnesses,

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: but it is also not different from them.

original: rgya mtsho dang chu rlabs bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang chu rlabs bzhin no //
translated: It is like the ocean and its waves.

original: yul la nye bar dmigs pa de dag kyang 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba dag gi gnas skabs na ni med do //
analyzed: yul la nye bar dmigs pa de dag kyang 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / myos pa dang / brgyal ba dag gi gnas skabs na ni med do //
translated: Those that apprehend objects do not exist in the states of nondiscernment, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, the meditative attainment of cessation, sleep, states of intoxication, and fainting.

original: @201a * // de ltar de ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba dang / de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: @201a * // de ltar de ni rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba dang / de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is called ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù and its transformation is the third.

original: gsum pa'o // sems de nyid rnal 'byor pa de la rab tu snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang / yul du snang ba gzung ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur cing snang ba ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'o // sems de nyid rnal 'byor pa de la rab tu snang ba 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang / yul du snang ba gzung ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur cing snang ba ste /
translated: That very mind appears to the yogi as the aspect of the apprehender and as the appearance of the transformation of the aspect of the apprehended that appears as objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pa sems tsam du dmigs pa pa yul mi dmigs pa rab tu skye la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pa sems tsam du dmigs pa pa yul mi dmigs pa rab tu skye la /
translated: The nonobservation of external objects is observed as mind only, and the nonobservation of objects arises.

original: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa dag kyang med pas gzung ba mi dmigs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa dag kyang med pas gzung ba mi dmigs pa la brten nas /
translated: If there is no apprehended object, there is no apprehender. Therefore, based on the nonobservation of the apprehended,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug po dag mi dmigs pa rab tu skye ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug po dag mi dmigs pa rab tu skye ste /
translated: the nonobservation of the six types of consciousness that apprehend it arises.

original: ji srid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi sems kyi chos nyid rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba nyid la mi gnas shing dmigs pa la gnas pa de srid du bzung ba'i sngon mi ldog cing /
analyzed: ji srid du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang gi sems kyi chos nyid rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba nyid la mi gnas shing dmigs pa la gnas pa de srid du bzung ba'i sngon mi ldog cing /
translated: As long as the mind does not abide in the nature of the mind, the ƒÅlaya consciousness, called the consciousness that is the intrinsic reality of the mind, and as long as it abides in the observation of objects, it does not turn back from the apprehended.

original: mtshan mar lta ba'i sa bon ma spangs pa'i phyir gnyis kyi bag chags mi spong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba'i sa bon ma spangs pa'i phyir gnyis kyi bag chags mi spong ngo //
translated: Because the seeds of the view of signs are not abandoned, the latent impressions of the two are not abandoned.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dag sems las phyi rol du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dag sems las phyi rol du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the objects of form, etc., are not perceived as external to the mind,

original: rang gi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa yin te /
translated: then one definitely abides in one's own reality.

original: gnas gyur pas sgrib pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid thob bo //
analyzed: gnas gyur pas sgrib pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid thob bo //
translated: By means of the transformation, one obtains the nonconceptual reality through the removal of all obscurations and the mastery of all dharmas.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ces bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid gsum yongs su mi shes na mi rtogs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ces bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid gsum yongs su mi shes na mi rtogs pas de'i phyir /
translated: The nonconceptual intuition of a tathagata into all things, called mere representation, is not realized without the thorough knowledge of the three natures, hence:

original: brtags pa nye bar mi dmigs shing //
analyzed: brtags pa nye bar mi dmigs shing //
translated: The imagined is not perceived,

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang gzung med pas //üîΩde nyid mthong ba yongs grub pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang gzung med pas // de nyid mthong ba yongs grub pa'i //
translated: and the other-dependent is not apprehended,üîΩand the vision of the reality

original: ngo bo nyid la lta ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la lta ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
translated: of the perfected nature is the view.

original: 'di la kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: 'di la kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus te /
translated: In this regard, the three realities imagined, relative, and perfect are included in the store consciousness.

original: de la nad dang phyi rol gyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis gzugs dang byang chub kyi bar gyi dngos po gang dang gang rnam par brtag par bya ba de ni de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la nad dang phyi rol gyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis gzugs dang byang chub kyi bar gyi dngos po gang dang gang rnam par brtag par bya ba de ni de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever thing, from form to enlightenment, is imagined by whatever conceptualization, whether internal or external, as having a particular nature, does not exist in that way.

original: yod pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas brtags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pas brtags pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is imagined because it is imagined to exist although it does not exist.

original: de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the imagined reality.

original: khams gsum nang skyes nas sems dang sems las byung de yang dag pa ma yin pa @201b kun rtog pa dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni gzhan gyis bskyed cing dbang bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum nang skyes nas sems dang sems las byung de yang dag pa ma yin pa @201b kun rtog pa dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni gzhan gyis bskyed cing dbang bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The relative reality is the internal mind and mental factors that are born in the three realms, which are otherpowered because they are produced by other conditions and because they control the production of their own effects.

original: yang na gzhan skyes pa la dbang byed pas gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan skyes pa la dbang byed pas gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: Or else, it is the other-dependent because it is the domain of the other, i.e. of the imagination of the unreal.

original: kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis de'i gzhi las kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis de'i gzhi las kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The other-dependent is the basis of the imagined and the perfected because the imagined and the perfected are based upon it.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the other-dependent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du kun brtags pa dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is the very other-dependent itself, free from the imagined nature, i.e. the duality of the apprehended and the apprehending.

original: de yang gzhan gyi dbang dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi dbang dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is neither identical with the other-dependent nor is it different from it.

original: gal te tha dad par gyur na ni chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad par gyur na ni chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, then reality would be different.

original: ci ste gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na ni des na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas rnam par byang ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na ni des na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas rnam par byang ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were identical, then, because it would have the nature of defilement, it would not be the cause of purification.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid gsum po dag yod na ji ltar dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid gsum po dag yod na ji ltar dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa zhe na /
translated: If the three natures exist, how can all things be natureless?üîΩThe imagined is natureless in the sense of being inexistent, since it is empty of the characteristic of its own nature.

original: kun brtags pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas nye bar mi dmigs shing gzhan gyi dbang yang de la rang gi bdag nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas nye bar mi dmigs shing gzhan gyi dbang yang de la rang gi bdag nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas
translated: The dependent is natureless in the sense of being unproduced, since it is not produced by itself.

original: gzung du med do //üîΩyongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi don dam pa yang yin la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gzung du med do // yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi don dam pa yang yin la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is ungraspable.üîΩThe perfected is the ultimate of the imagined phenomena and is also natureless.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul gyi don yin pas don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul gyi don yin pas don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: It is natureless in the sense of being the ultimate, since it is the object of the supreme, noble wisdom.

original: de nyid mthong ba don dam par shes pa dag yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de la dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po mnyam pa nyid kyis lta ba yin te /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba don dam par shes pa dag yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de la dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po mnyam pa nyid kyis lta ba yin te / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That seeing of reality is the ultimate, the nature of the perfected, and it is the view, since it is the object of observation and the equality of the object of observation.üîΩIt is the view, since it is the object of observation and the equality of the object of observation.

original: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni rnam par grol ba'i lus yin te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni rnam par grol ba'i lus yin te /
translated: That characteristic of transformation is the body of liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: zag pa thams cad dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad dang bral zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from all defilements and have abandoned the afflictive obstructions.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku yin te /
translated: That itself is the Dharma body of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: las dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from all habitual tendencies of action and apprehended object and apprehending subject and have abandoned the obstructions to omniscience.

original: gal te kha cig 'di skad ces kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten dang @202a * //
analyzed: gal te kha cig 'di skad ces kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten dang @202a * //
translated: If someone were to say, ‚ÄúThe imagined nature is the world‚Äôs

original: thun mong ba'i shes pa'i yul yin la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni so so rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i shes pa'i yul yin la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni so so rang rig pa ste /
translated: The consummate entity is the object of individual self-knowledge.

original: thub pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de shes pa gang gi yul yin zhing de yod par ji ltar shas zhes zer na de'i phyir /
analyzed: thub pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de shes pa gang gi yul yin zhing de yod par ji ltar shas zhes zer na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is the object of the transcendent wisdom of the Sage, then how can the dependent entity be the object of any consciousness and how can it be known to exist?üîΩBecause of the designation and its reason,üîΩbecause the two do not exist elsewhere,

original: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: and because of the observation of the thoroughly afflictive,

original: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: the dependent is accepted as existent.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag yod pa nyid du btags pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag yod pa nyid du btags pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log gi rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the designation of the existence of mind and mental factors is accompanied by the reason of error, it appears.

original: mtshan nyid des gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid des gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
translated: By that characteristic, the dependent is inferred to exist.

original: gzhan du gal te gzhan gyi dbang med par gyur na btags pa dang rgyu mtshan nam kun brtags dang yongs su grub pa gnyis po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te gzhan gyi dbang med par gyur na btags pa dang rgyu mtshan nam kun brtags dang yongs su grub pa gnyis po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, if the dependent nature did not exist, it would follow that the imputed and the thoroughly established would not exist, because

original: de gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: those two depend on the dependent nature.

original: gzhan yang gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med par gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, if the dependent nature did not exist, the thoroughly afflicted would not be observed, but it is observed.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag la brten pa yin la /
translated: Because the thoroughly afflicted is based on the mind and mental factors,

original: de dang bral ba nyid ni thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nyid ni thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and freedom from that is liberation.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore the dependent nature is asserted to exist.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas na mthong ste /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas na mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, since it is the object of a supramundane nonconceptual consciousness, it is seen when the nature of the thoroughly established is manifested.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni de'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni de'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other-dependent is to be realized by the subsequently attained pure mundane gnosis.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin tshul 'di //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin tshul 'di //
translated: This method of the perfection of wisdom

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid thob pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid thob pa yin //
translated: is the attainment of omniscience.

original: skye dang 'gag la sogs pa dang // dgag pa lhur len ma yin no //
analyzed: skye dang 'gag la sogs pa dang // dgag pa lhur len ma yin no //
translated: It is not the denial of origination, cessation, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos 'di dag nyid kyis chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos 'di dag nyid kyis chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed /
translated: This is the very Dharma by which one is purified,

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed yongs su gsal bar byed /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed yongs su gsal bar byed /
translated: by which one is completely fulfilled, by which one is completely illuminated,üîΩby which one is completely analyzed, and yet in this there is no self or anything that belongs to a self.

original: yongs su dpyod par byed kyang 'di la bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med do zhes gsungs pa de ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par 'dzin pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sgo nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su dpyod par byed kyang 'di la bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med do zhes gsungs pa de ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par 'dzin pa dang / de la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sgo nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the transformation of the fundamental consciousness, by way of the absence of the apprehension of self and what belongs to self and the absence of the notional attachment to them.

original: @202b sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes gsungs pa des ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: @202b sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes gsungs pa des ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par bstan to //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThat mind is not mind‚Äù shows the absence of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: sems med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs pa des ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid bstan to //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sems med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs pa des ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid bstan to // de bzhin du gzugs ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The statement, That which is devoid of mind is inconceivable, teaches that there is only representation.

original: byang chub kyi bar du yang mtshan ma'o zhes gsungs pa des ni ming dang brdar btags pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du yang mtshan ma'o zhes gsungs pa des ni ming dang brdar btags pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the statement, Form is a sign, and so on, up to enlightenment is a sign, teaches the imagined nature, which is the nature that is imagined by names and signs.

original: skur ba gdab pa dang / nye bar blang ba dang / gdags pa'i chos dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bstan pas ni gzhan gyi dbang bstan to //
analyzed: skur ba gdab pa dang / nye bar blang ba dang / gdags pa'i chos dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bstan pas ni gzhan gyi dbang bstan to //
translated: The teaching of the dharmas of deprecation, appropriation, and designation, and the teaching of the dharmas of the factors of enlightenment, teach the relative nature.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / dben pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa brjod pas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / dben pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa brjod pas ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: The teaching of suchness, the perfect end, isolation, the fruit, the knowledge of all aspects, and so on, teaches the perfect nature.

original: de ltar kho bo cag gis bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i thabs yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar kho bo cag gis bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i thabs yin gyi /
translated: Thus, this method of the perfection of wisdom as taught by us is the means of attaining omniscience.

original: dbu ma smra ba rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa dag dgag pa lhur len pa ni med pa nyid du lta ba dang mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa'i thabs ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa dag dgag pa lhur len pa ni med pa nyid du lta ba dang mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'thob pa'i thabs ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: But the method of the Madhyamikas, which is to refute such things as arising and cessation, is not the means of attaining omniscience, because it is in accord with the view of nihilism.

original: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis sbyar ba'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis sbyar ba'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: This is the opponent's position as set forth by the Yogacaras.

original: 'dir bshad de bzhin gshegs bka' kun //
analyzed: 'dir bshad de bzhin gshegs bka' kun //
translated: Here we say: All the scriptures of the Tathagata

original: kho bo cag gi tshad ma yin //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi tshad ma yin //
translated: are valid for us.

original: tshad ma yid ches lung yin phyir //
analyzed: tshad ma yid ches lung yin phyir //
translated: Because they are valid, reliable scriptures,

original: bzang po dag ni sgrub par byed //
analyzed: bzang po dag ni sgrub par byed //
translated: they prove what is good.

original: ces bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' thams cad ni kho bo cag gi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' thams cad ni kho bo cag gi tshad ma yin te /
translated: All the scriptures of the Sugata are valid for us,

original: de dag ni de nyid gzigs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de nyid gzigs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are spoken by those who see reality.

original: dge legs kyi bsam pa can nyid dag ni de sgrub par byed cing mi mthun par mi byed do //
analyzed: dge legs kyi bsam pa can nyid dag ni de sgrub par byed cing mi mthun par mi byed do //
translated: Those who have the intention of virtue will accomplish it and not act contrary to it.üîΩOthers, due to other scriptures,

original: lung gzhan dag gis the tshom dang // log pa'i blo can gzhan mi byed //
analyzed: lung gzhan dag gis the tshom dang // log pa'i blo can gzhan mi byed //
translated: will have doubts and wrong ideas.

original: de phyir de dag sgrub gzhug phyir //
analyzed: de phyir de dag sgrub gzhug phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to introduce them to the accomplishment of virtue,

original: rigs pa ldan pa'i tshul btsal bya //
analyzed: rigs pa ldan pa'i tshul btsal bya //
translated: one should seek the rational method.

original: zhes bya ba la lung las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gzhan dag go //üîΩde dag gis the tshom du gyur pa ni de yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lung las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gzhan dag go // de dag gis the tshom du gyur pa ni de yin nam /
translated: Other scriptures are different from the scriptures of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.üîΩThose who have doubts due to those other scriptures are uncertain, thinking, ‚ÄúIs this so?

original: 'on te ma yin snyam du the tshom za bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin snyam du the tshom za bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Or is it not so?‚Äù

original: log pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' 'di las gzhan bdag la rnam par g-yengs shing 'di la mi ltos pas de ni 'di lta bu nyid ma yin no zhes log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' 'di las gzhan bdag la rnam par g-yengs shing 'di la mi ltos pas de ni 'di lta bu nyid ma yin no zhes log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Wrong ideas means that, distracted by other philosophies, they do not rely on this MahƒÅyƒÅna and so they are wrongly engaged, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is not the way it is.‚Äù

original: gang dag la de lta bu'i blo yod pa de dag @203a * //
analyzed: gang dag la de lta bu'i blo yod pa de dag @203a * //
translated: Those who have such ideas

original: ni lung gzhan dag gis the tshom dang log pa'i blo can dag ste /
analyzed: ni lung gzhan dag gis the tshom dang log pa'i blo can dag ste /
translated: are those who have doubts and wrong ideas due to other scriptures.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa byung rgyal du smra ba gzhan dag go //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa byung rgyal du smra ba gzhan dag go //
translated: The other party is a sophist who speaks at random.

original: de dag gis tshad ma de sgrub par mi byed pas de'i phyir de dag sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis tshad ma de sgrub par mi byed pas de'i phyir de dag sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir /
translated: Since he does not establish that valid cognition, in order to establish it for him,

original: smra ba po rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon med pa gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa'i gnas su ma gyur pa'i mtha'i rigs pa'i lam btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba po rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshul phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon med pa gzhan gyis smras pa'i nyes pa'i gnas su ma gyur pa'i mtha'i rigs pa'i lam btsal bar bya'o //
translated: the proponent should seek the path of reasoning that is faultless with respect to the position, reason, and example, and that is not open to the objections raised by the other party.

original: khyed kyis brtags pa'i gsung rab dang / skur pa 'debs pa ji skad smras pa dag gis ni rigs pa mi bzod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyis brtags pa'i gsung rab dang / skur pa 'debs pa ji skad smras pa dag gis ni rigs pa mi bzod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the scriptures you have imagined and the nihilism you have described are not tenable,üîΩtherefore,

original: gnyis med pa yi dngos po ni ;
analyzed: gnyis med pa yi dngos po ni ;
translated: the nondual entity

original: / rigs pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir //üîΩnam mkha'i me tog med dngos sam //
analyzed: / rigs pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir // nam mkha'i me tog med dngos sam //
translated: is not tenable because of contradiction.üîΩYou should not imagine

original: de dngos yin par brtag mi bya //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dngos yin par brtag mi bya // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: that the nonexistent entity is like a sky flower.

original: gal te re zhig gnyis med pa dngos po yin na ni ji ltar med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te re zhig gnyis med pa dngos po yin na ni ji ltar med pa yin /
translated: If, on the one hand, the nondual entity exists, then how can it be nonexistent?

original: ci ste med pa yin na ni 'o na de lta ni dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste med pa yin na ni 'o na de lta ni dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But if it is nonexistent, then it is not a thing.

original: de'i phyir gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that a thing is not two.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts your own words.

original: gal te gnyis med pa'i tshul kho nar rtag tu nges par gnas pa'i phyir med pa nyid dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis med pa'i tshul kho nar rtag tu nges par gnas pa'i phyir med pa nyid dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a nonexistent thing is a thing because it is always and only nondual,

original: de lta na nam mkha'i me tog med pa yang dngos po yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na nam mkha'i me tog med pa yang dngos po yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that a nonexistent sky-flower is a thing.

original: gal te nam mkha'i me rtog med pa dngos po yin par mi 'dod na ni gnyis med pa de yang dngos po yin par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i me rtog med pa dngos po yin par mi 'dod na ni gnyis med pa de yang dngos po yin par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: If you do not accept that a nonexistent sky-flower is a thing, then you should not consider that nonduality is a thing.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi tshul ni /üîΩrnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi tshul ni / rnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //
translated: If you think that our system is as follows:üîΩWhatever thing is imagined

original: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags pa //
translated: By whatever conception,

original: de ni kun brtags kho na ste //
analyzed: de ni kun brtags kho na ste //
translated: That is only imagined,

original: ngo bo nyid ni yod ma yin ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yod ma yin ;
translated: And does not exist inherently.

original: / gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos nyid ni //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos nyid ni //
translated: The reality of the dependent

original: rnam rtog rkyen las 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: rnam rtog rkyen las 'byung ba yin //
translated: Conceptualization arises from conditions.

original: de la rtag tu snga ma shos //
analyzed: de la rtag tu snga ma shos //
translated: It is always the prior state.

original: bral ba nyid gang yongs grub yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bral ba nyid gang yongs grub yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Freedom from that is the consummate.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de la rtag tu snga ma shos zhes bya ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de la rtag tu snga ma shos zhes bya ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtags pa'i dngos po dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te
translated: Thus, the consummate nature is the freedom from the imputed nature, which is the imagined nature, and the apprehended and apprehender imputed to the dependent nature.üîΩThe nonexistence that is dependent on the imagined and dependent natures is the thing that is dependent on the consummate nature.

original: / kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang la ltos nas med pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa la ltos nas dngos po yin pas de ltar na med pa dang dngos po zhes bya ba gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir tha dad pa @203b nyid ma yin
analyzed: / kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang la ltos nas med pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa la ltos nas dngos po yin pas de ltar na med pa dang dngos po zhes bya ba gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir tha dad pa @203b nyid ma yin
translated: Thus, since nonexistence and thing are inseparable, they are not different.

original: pas de'i phyir 'gal ba med do snyam du pha rol po dag sems pa la brtags nas de dgag pa'i lan yang gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pas de'i phyir 'gal ba med do snyam du pha rol po dag sems pa la brtags nas de dgag pa'i lan yang gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, thinking that there is no contradiction, the opponent imagines that and responds to that with an answer that refutes it.

original: gal te yang dag brtag med phyir //
analyzed: gal te yang dag brtag med phyir //
translated: If it is analyzed, it does not exist.üîΩ

original: de la dbye ba med snyam na //üîΩmtshan gzhi mtshan nyid rnam gzhag la //
analyzed: de la dbye ba med snyam na // mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid rnam gzhag la //
translated: If you think that the perfect is not differentiated because it is not to be examined,üîΩthat is not a reply,

original: de ni mtshungs phyir lan ma yin //
analyzed: de ni mtshungs phyir lan ma yin //
translated: because the example is similar to the case of the establishment of the characterized and the characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la dbyer med du zin kyang gang gi tshe mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa byed pa na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de nyid ces bya ba de'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dag med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la dbyer med du zin kyang gang gi tshe mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa byed pa na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de nyid ces bya ba de'i mtshan nyid
translated: Even though the perfect is undifferentiated because the imagined and the dependent do not exist, when the establishment of the characterized and the characteristic is made, the characteristic of that which is called the basis of the characteristic

original: ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba de'i tshe na /
translated: is a nondual entity.

original: gal te re zhig gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin na ni ji ltar med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te re zhig gnyis med pa'i dngos po yin na ni ji ltar med pa yin /
translated: If it is a nondual entity, how can it be nonexistent?

original: ci ste med pa yin na ni 'o na de lta na dngos po ma yin no zhes 'gal bar sngar bstan pa de mtshungs pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i lan de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste med pa yin na ni 'o na de lta na dngos po ma yin no zhes 'gal bar sngar bstan pa de mtshungs pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i lan de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: But if it is nonexistent, then it is not an entity. Since that is a contradiction, as previously explained, that reply of the opponent is not good.

original: gzhan yang / gal te de'i dngos ma btang gang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te de'i dngos ma btang gang //
translated: Moreover: If it does not relinquish its own entity,

original: de ni de dngos yin 'dod na //
analyzed: de ni de dngos yin 'dod na //
translated: then it is asserted that it is that entity.

original: de ltar dngos nyid mi gtong ba //
analyzed: de ltar dngos nyid mi gtong ba //
translated: Thus, since it does not relinquish its own entity,

original: de phyir de ni dngos ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir de ni dngos ma yin //
translated: therefore it is not an entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gnyis med pa'i dngos po nyid yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa de nyid dngos po zhes bya'i ngo bo nyid gnyis pa ni med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces gnyis med pa'i dngos po nyid yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa de nyid dngos po zhes bya'i ngo bo nyid gnyis pa ni med do zhes zer na /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúThat which does not relinquish its own nondual entity is called an entity. There is no second nature,‚Äù

original: de la 'di skad ces de ltar ngo bo nyid mi gtong na de'i phyir dngos po de ni med pa kho na yin pas de la dngos por brtag par mi bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces de ltar ngo bo nyid mi gtong na de'i phyir dngos po de ni med pa kho na yin pas de la dngos por brtag par mi bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then one should say to him, ‚ÄúThus, since it does not relinquish its own entity, therefore that entity is utterly nonexistent. Therefore it should not be conceived to be an entity.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / des na de nyid gzigs rnams kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / des na de nyid gzigs rnams kyi //
translated: Therefore: The knowledge of those who see reality

original: mkhyen pa dngos med dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhyen pa dngos med dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: would perceive a nonexistent entity.

original: de yang chos bdag med min te //
analyzed: de yang chos bdag med min te //
translated: Moreover, that is not the selflessness of phenomena

original: med pa'i blo yi rgyu phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i blo yi rgyu phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition of nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni dngos po yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis las rnam par grol ba yin par bzhed na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni dngos po yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis las rnam par grol ba yin par bzhed na /
translated: According to the tenets of the Mahayana, the Buddha's gnosis is accepted as being free from the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: khyed 'dod pa ltar na de dngos po med pa la dmigs pa yin par 'gyur bas lung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: khyed 'dod pa ltar na de dngos po med pa la dmigs pa yin par 'gyur bas lung dang 'gal lo //
translated: But according to you, it would be an observation of nonthings, and so it would contradict the scriptures.

original: gal te mi 'gal te gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'gal te gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not contradict the scriptures, why?

original: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid yin la /
translated: The thing that is the selflessness of imputed things is selflessness.

original: de la dmigs pa nyid yin par khyed kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid yin par khyed kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And you also accept that it is the object of observation.

original: chos bdag med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin par 'dod na de yang med pa nyid kho nas med pa'i @204a * //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin par 'dod na de yang med pa nyid kho nas med pa'i @204a * //
translated: If you accept that the selflessness of phenomena is free from all signs, then it is only nonexistent,

original: blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: and because it is the object of a nonmental cognition, it is not suitable to be the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bdag gi sgra ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba'i phyir dang / bdag med pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sgra ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba'i phyir dang / bdag med pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used because of the assertion of intrinsic reality, and because selflessness is the unreality of both reality and unreality.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag rnam par rtog pa ni 'ching ba yin par gsungs pas de dang bral na grol bar sems shing /üîΩgal te dngos med dmigs pa'i blo //
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag rnam par rtog pa ni 'ching ba yin par gsungs pas de dang bral na grol bar sems shing / gal te dngos med dmigs pa'i blo //
translated: Here, the opponent thinks that since it is said that conceptualization is bondage, one is liberated when free from that.üîΩIf you assert that the mind that observes unreality

original: rnam par mi rtog yin 'dod na //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog yin 'dod na //
translated: is nonconceptual,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blos ci zhig la rtog par byed na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blos ci zhig la rtog par byed na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: this is saying that since all phenomena are of one taste in being the unreality of intrinsic reality, what is conceptualized by the mind that observes unreality?

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: Since it is nonconceptual, it is just as it is.

original: slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: The master responds:

original: des na gzugs blo mi rtog pa'ang //
analyzed: des na gzugs blo mi rtog pa'ang //
translated: Therefore form is not the nonconceptual mind.

original: dam pa yin pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: dam pa yin pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi blo don ji lta ba nyid yin par 'gyur na ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi blo don ji lta ba nyid yin par 'gyur na ni ;
translated: If the cognition that is non-conceptual were to be the way things are,

original: de lta na 'jig rten pa'i blo gzugs la sogs pa rkyen las byung ba rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'jig rten pa'i blo gzugs la sogs pa rkyen las byung ba rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the worldly cognition of form and so on, which arises from conditions, would be free from conceptual thought and memory, and it would also be the way things are.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i blo gang yin pa ni yang dag par na don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i blo gang yin pa ni yang dag par na don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that is free from the conceptual thought of apprehender and apprehended is not accepted as being the way things are.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of form and so on, even though it is non-conceptual, is not valid cognition.üîΩBecause it appears as the apprehended, it is like the cognition of the appearance of two moons and so on.‚Äù

original: gzung bar snang ba'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba'i blo bzhin no zhe na 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: gzung bar snang ba'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba'i blo bzhin no zhe na 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te gzung bar snang 'dod pas //
analyzed: gal te gzung bar snang 'dod pas //
translated: If you assert that it is the appearance of the apprehended,

original: gzugs blo yang dag ma yin na //
analyzed: gzugs blo yang dag ma yin na //
translated: If the cognition of form is not real,

original: des na gtan tshigs 'khrul 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs 'khrul 'gyur zhing //
translated: then the reason is erroneous,

original: dam bcas pa yang nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: dam bcas pa yang nyams par 'gyur //
translated: and the thesis is also undermined.

original: zhes bya ba la 'khrul zhes bya ba ni 'gal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'khrul zhes bya ba ni 'gal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúerroneous‚Äù means contradictory.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi blo ni gzung bar snang bar snang ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yang dag pa ma yin pa snang ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis yang dag pa bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi blo ni gzung bar snang bar snang ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yang dag pa ma yin pa snang ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis yang dag pa bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo
translated: Thus, the cognition of form is inferred to appear as the appearance of the object, and the inference of the non-reality of the appearance is refuted by the reality.

original: nyid log par bsgrub pas 'gal lo //
analyzed: nyid log par bsgrub pas 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory because the nature of the subject is established as false.

original: 'dir dam bcas pa ni gzugs kyi blo yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dam bcas pa ni gzugs kyi blo yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the thesis is that the cognition of form is not real.

original: 'di la gzugs kyi blo gang yin pa de ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi blo gang yin pa de ji ltar na yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: How could that cognition of form be unreal?

original: @204b mngon sum dang / lung dang / 'jig rten la grags pas gzugs kyi blo yang dag pa nyid yin par yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo //üîΩde nyid mthong ba yongs grub pa'i //
analyzed: @204b mngon sum dang / lung dang / 'jig rten la grags pas gzugs kyi blo yang dag pa nyid yin par yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo // de nyid mthong ba yongs grub pa'i //
translated: Direct perception, scriptural statements, and what is renowned in the world refute the idea that the cognition of form is real.üîΩThe view of the nature

original: ngo bo nyid la lta ba yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la lta ba yin //
translated: That is seen by the perfected

original: zhes ji skad smras pa de la yang skyon 'di yod do /
analyzed: zhes ji skad smras pa de la yang skyon 'di yod do /
translated: This has the same fault as the previous statement.

original: ngo bo nyid la dmigs yin na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la dmigs yin na //
translated: If it is the nature that is observed,üîΩThe Teacher‚Äôs enlightenment would be conceptual,

original: ston pa'i byang chub rtog can dang // dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba dang // rnam par mi rtog blor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ston pa'i byang chub rtog can dang // dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba dang // rnam par mi rtog blor mi 'gyur //
translated: It would be an object, and it would not be a nonconceptual mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dmigs pa sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de lta bu cung zhig yod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i dmigs pa sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de lta bu cung zhig yod cing /
translated: The TathƒÅgata said that the object of the individual self-cognizing and perfected nature is not the nature that is the literal meaning.

original: ngo bo nyid de la dmigs pa yin na ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes rtog pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de la dmigs pa yin na ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes rtog pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the intrinsic reality that is the object, then the TathƒÅgata, the Teacher, the pristine wisdom of enlightenment would be conceptual.

original: byang chub ni rtog pa mi mnga' bar bzhed do //
analyzed: byang chub ni rtog pa mi mnga' bar bzhed do //
translated: But enlightenment is accepted as being free of conceptualization.

original: dmigs pa de la dmigs par byed pa yin na dmigs pa can du yang 'gyur bas dmigs pa med pa nyid du yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa de la dmigs par byed pa yin na dmigs pa can du yang 'gyur bas dmigs pa med pa nyid du yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it is the object of that which has an object, then it would have an object. Thus, it would not be established as being without an object.

original: byang chub ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du bzhed do //
analyzed: byang chub ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du bzhed do //
translated: But enlightenment is accepted as being without an object.üîΩIf one conceptualizes that very thing as being without intrinsic reality, then it would not be a nonconceptual mind.

original: de nyid la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par rtog par byed na rnam par mi rtog pa'i blor yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par rtog par byed na rnam par mi rtog pa'i blor yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the sentence should be connected.

original: 'di lta ste khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste /
translated: This is what it says: ‚ÄúThis threefold world is mind only.

original: phyi rol gyi don med do zhes dam bcas pa gang yin pa de la yang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med do zhes dam bcas pa gang yin pa de la yang /
translated: There are no external objects.‚ÄùüîΩIf the mind is apprehended as being only mind,

original: sems tsam du ni dmigs pa dang // gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin na //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni dmigs pa dang // gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin na //
translated: then form and so on are not apprehended.

original: khas blangs pa dang grags pa yis //
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang grags pa yis //
translated: This is accepted and is well known.

original: dam bcas pa la gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la gnod par 'gyur //
translated: It contradicts what is accepted.

original: zhes bya ba la khas blangs pas gnod par 'gyur ba ni mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la khas blangs pas gnod par 'gyur ba ni mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: It contradicts what is accepted because it contradicts the scriptures, which state: ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.‚Äù

original: grags pas gnod par 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten na gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye bar grags pas gnod par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: grags pas gnod par 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten na gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye bar grags pas gnod par 'gyur ba'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: It contradicts what is well known because it contradicts the well-known fact that eye consciousnesses and so on do not arise in the absence of objects such as forms.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar mthong ste /
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúWe see that consciousnesses arise in the absence of objects such as forms.

original: de lta bur snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dper na rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur snang ba 'byung ba'i phyir dper na rmi lam na gzugs la sogs pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, just as the consciousnesses of forms and so on arise in dreams, consciousnesses arise in the absence of objects such as forms, because appearances such as forms arise.‚Äù

original: de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute that, the root text says:

original: de ltar snang ba skye ba'i phyir //üîΩrmi lam gzugs sogs blo bzhin du //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba skye ba'i phyir // rmi lam gzugs sogs blo bzhin du //
translated: Because appearances such as forms arise,üîΩit is just like the consciousness of forms and so on in dreams.

original: gzugs la sogs @205a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs @205a * //
translated: In dreams, the consciousness of forms and so on

original: pa don med par //
analyzed: pa don med par //
translated: arises in the absence of objects such as forms.

original: rnam par shes zhes byar mi rung //
analyzed: rnam par shes zhes byar mi rung //
translated: It is not tenable to call it consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa de bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir pha rol po dag gis smras pa'i rjes su dpag pa de bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference that the opponent states is not good.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not good?

original: gang phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gang phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i //
translated: Because, in dreams and so on,

original: rnam shes chos la dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam shes chos la dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: consciousness has a nonexistent object.

original: de phyir dpe yang med pas dang ; / yul la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir dpe yang med pas dang ; / yul la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, there is no example, and there is the fault of the negation of objects.

original: zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig gis rmi lam na mthong ba nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong ba yin gyi ma mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig gis rmi lam na mthong ba nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong ba yin gyi ma mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye that is endowed with consciousness, which is imbued with the latent impressions of the apprehended object and apprehending subject since beginningless time, sees forms and so on in dreams, not not seeing.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The consciousnesses of dreams and so on have objects,

original: sngon mthong ba la sogs pa mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba la sogs pa mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they express what was seen and so on, like memory and so on.

original: dmus long gi mig gi mthug tan nyams pa la yang tshe rabs gzhan na mthong ba'i bag chags kyi shugs kyis rmi lam na kha dog dang dbyibs tha dad pa'i gzugs du ma dag snang bar 'gyur bas de'i shes pa de la yang dmigs pa med pa ma
analyzed: dmus long gi mig gi mthug tan nyams pa la yang tshe rabs gzhan na mthong ba'i bag chags kyi shugs kyis rmi lam na kha dog dang dbyibs tha dad pa'i gzugs du ma dag snang bar 'gyur bas de'i shes pa de la yang dmigs pa med pa ma
translated: Even a congenitally blind person whose eye faculty is impaired sees many different forms, colors, and shapes in dreams due to the force of latent propensities for seeing in other lives. Therefore, the consciousness of that person is not without an object.

original: yin te / 'di ltar bzang skyong dmus long des rmi lam na shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig gis gzugs de dag mthong ste /
analyzed: yin te / 'di ltar bzang skyong dmus long des rmi lam na shes pa dang ldan pa'i mig gis gzugs de dag mthong ste /
translated: Thus, BhadrapƒÅla, that congenitally blind person sees those forms with an eye that possesses consciousness in a dream,

original: sha'i mig gis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: but not with the fleshly eye.

original: shes pa'i mig gis ni chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas khyed cag gi sgrub pa la dpe med pa'i skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i mig gis ni chos la dmigs pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas khyed cag gi sgrub pa la dpe med pa'i skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the eye of consciousness has an object of observation, consciousness in dreams and so on also has an object of observation. Therefore, your proof has the fault of having no example.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi dngos po sel bar byed pa'i phyir yul la skur pa 'debs pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi dngos po sel bar byed pa'i phyir yul la skur pa 'debs pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: You also denigrate objects, because you eliminate the existence of objects such as form.

original: khyed 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang bar skye ste /
