analyzed: khyed 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang bar skye ste /
translated: You say: Consciousness arises as the appearance of duality.

original: rang du snang ba dang rnam par shes pa yul du snang ba'i phyi rol gyi yul gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa de rnam par shes pa rang du snang ba'i yul nyid yin no zhes zer na de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rang du snang ba dang rnam par shes pa yul du snang ba'i phyi rol gyi yul gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa de rnam par shes pa rang du snang ba'i yul nyid yin no zhes zer na de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: It appears as self and as the external object that is the appearance of the object of consciousness. That transformation into the aspect of the external object is the object of the appearance of consciousness as self.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te yul du snang ba nyid //
analyzed: gal te yul du snang ba nyid //
translated: If you assert that the appearance as an object

original: sems kyi dmigs pa yin 'dod na ;
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa yin 'dod na ;
translated: is the object of observation of mind,

original: / yul du snang ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: / yul du snang ba ma gtogs par //
translated: apart from the appearance as an object,

original: sems kyi bdag nyid gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: sems kyi bdag nyid gzhan ci yod //
translated: what other nature of mind exists?

original: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du snang bar skyes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par mthong gi yul du snang ba ma gtogs par du snang pa gzhan ma mthong @205b ngo ;
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du snang bar skyes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par mthong gi yul du snang ba ma gtogs par du snang pa gzhan ma mthong @205b ngo ;
translated: In this way, we see that the arising of the appearance as an object such as form is the nature of consciousness. Apart from the appearance as an object, we do not see any other appearance.

original: / gal te yul du snang ba nyid las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis pa zhig yod na de gang yin ston cig / gal te de bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa la rang du snang ba dang /
analyzed: / gal te yul du snang ba nyid las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis pa zhig yod na de gang yin ston cig / gal te de bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad ces rnam par shes pa la rang du snang ba dang /
translated: If there is a second nature of consciousness other than the appearance as objects, show what it is.

original: yul du snang ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yul du snang ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid gnyis yod de /
translated: If, in order to demonstrate that, it is said that there are two natures of consciousness, one that appears as itself and one that appears as objects,

original: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan lta bur skyes pa'i phyir shel gyi nor bu bzhin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan lta bur skyes pa'i phyir shel gyi nor bu bzhin te /
translated: then, because it abides in its own nature and because it arises as if it were another, it is like a crystal gem.

original: dper na shel gyi nor bu'i ngo bo nyid las ni rang gsal la /
analyzed: dper na shel gyi nor bu'i ngo bo nyid las ni rang gsal la /
translated: For example, the nature of a crystal gem is clear in itself,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar gzhag pa'i khyad par las ni sngon po la sogs par snang bar mtshon du rung ngo //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar gzhag pa'i khyad par las ni sngon po la sogs par snang bar mtshon du rung ngo //
translated: but it is suitable to be characterized as appearing as blue and so on due to the particular condition of blue and so on being placed before it.

original: de bzhin du sems rang rang du snang ba'i yul gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa las yul du snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems rang rang du snang ba'i yul gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa las yul du snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the appearance as objects arises from the transformation of the object that appears as itself.

original: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe nye bar gzhag pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: de lta na bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe nye bar gzhag pa mi mthun te /
translated: In that case, the example and the probandum are not similar.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan ltar skyes phyir de gnyis snang //
analyzed: gzhan ltar skyes phyir de gnyis snang //
translated: Because they appear as different,üîΩlike a crystal ball.

original: shel dpa' dra bar mi 'dod de //
analyzed: shel dpa' dra bar mi 'dod de //
translated: It is not asserted that a crystal ball is blue,

original: nye par gzhag pas der skye ba //
analyzed: nye par gzhag pas der skye ba //
translated: because it arises in dependence on something else.

original: shel gyi skad cig min phyir ro //
analyzed: shel gyi skad cig min phyir ro //
translated: Because the crystal is not momentary.

original: zhes bya ba ni shel gyi nor bu sngon po la sogs pa nye bar gzhag pa'i khyad par gyis rang gi ngo bor gsal ba nyid yongs su btang bas sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shel gyi nor bu sngon po la sogs pa nye bar gzhag pa'i khyad par gyis rang gi ngo bor gsal ba nyid yongs su btang bas sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su 'gyur ba ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that a crystal ball, etc., when placed near something else, gives up its own nature of clarity and completely changes into the nature of blue, etc.

original: shel gsal ba'i skad cig ma snga ma gang yin pa de ni 'gags par gyur pas sngon po la sogs par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shel gsal ba'i skad cig ma snga ma gang yin pa de ni 'gags par gyur pas sngon po la sogs par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But the previous moment of clear crystal ceases, and therefore it does not become blue, etc.

original: de 'gags gzhan ni skyes pa la //
analyzed: de 'gags gzhan ni skyes pa la //
translated: When it ceases, another arises,

original: de yi blo ni 'khrul par 'dod //
analyzed: de yi blo ni 'khrul par 'dod //
translated: and the cognition is mistaken.

original: ces bya ba ni shel gsal ba'i skad cig ma de 'gags pas na nye bar gzhag pa'i byad par gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid skyes pa la shel yin par dmigs pa'i blo ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni shel gsal ba'i skad cig ma de 'gags pas na nye bar gzhag pa'i byad par gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid skyes pa la shel yin par dmigs pa'i blo ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: The moment of clear crystal is ceased, and therefore the mind that perceives the crystal is mistaken, since the nature of blue, etc. is produced in the place of the crystal.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis ni med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis ni med de /
translated: There is no second nature.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /üîΩshel nye bar gzhag pa dang bral ba na snga ma'i ngo bo nyid kho nar snang ba ltar shes pa'i rnam par shes bya'i rnam pa dang bral ba shel gyi rnam pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bral ba lta bu ni nam yang gzung du med pa'i phyir
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na / shel nye bar gzhag pa dang bral ba na snga ma'i ngo bo nyid kho nar snang ba ltar shes pa'i rnam par shes bya'i rnam pa dang bral ba shel gyi rnam pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bral ba lta bu ni nam yang gzung du med pa'i phyir
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause, when the crystal is separated from the place, it appears just as it was before. Likewise, the consciousness is never apprehended without the aspect of the object of consciousness, like the aspect of the crystal separated from the place.

original: ro // rnam par shes pa rang du snang ba'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba med kyang de yul gyi rnam pas nye bar kha bsgyur ba'i dmigs par snang ba'i yul du snang ba nyid yin par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ro // rnam par shes pa rang du snang ba'i bdag nyid nyams su myong ba med kyang de yul gyi rnam pas nye bar kha bsgyur ba'i dmigs par snang ba'i yul du snang ba nyid yin par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though the consciousness is not experienced as having the nature of self-appearance, it is not reasonable that it appears as the object of perception, which is transformed by the aspect of the object.

original: dper na shel gyi nor bu nye bar gzhag pa'i tshon dang phrad pa na de lta bur snang bar mtshon du rung yang shel gyi nor bu yang nye bar gzhag pa'i @206a * //
analyzed: dper na shel gyi nor bu nye bar gzhag pa'i tshon dang phrad pa na de lta bur snang bar mtshon du rung yang shel gyi nor bu yang nye bar gzhag pa'i @206a * //
translated: For example, it is suitable to illustrate that when a crystal gem is placed near something, it appears to be that way. But the crystal gem is not the color that appears.

original: ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur la nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang shel gyi nor bu'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /üîΩshel gyi nor bu tshon yin pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur la nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang shel gyi nor bu'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te / shel gyi nor bu tshon yin pa'am /
translated: For example, when a crystal gem is placed near something, it appears to be that way, but the crystal gem does not become the entity of what is placed near it, nor does what is placed near it become the entity of the crystal gem.

original: tshon kyang shel gyi nor bu nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshon kyang shel gyi nor bu nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were so, it would follow that the crystal gem would be the color or the color would be the crystal gem.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rkyen ji ltar nye bar gyur pa'i yul du snang bar skye yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rkyen ji ltar nye bar gyur pa'i yul du snang bar skye yang /
translated: In the same way, consciousness arises as the appearance of an object in accordance with the conditions that are present,

original: rnam par shes pa yang rnam par thams cad du gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang rnam par thams cad du gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: but consciousness does not become the entity of form and so on in every way,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor does the entity of form and so on become the entity of consciousness.

original: sa la sogs pa'i sems dang bcas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i sems dang bcas pa nyid dam /
translated: If it were so, it would follow that earth and so on would have consciousness or

original: sems kyang sa la sogs pa bzhin du sems med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyang sa la sogs pa bzhin du sems med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And it follows that mind is devoid of mind, like earth and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de shel bzhin du gnyis su snang ba nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de shel bzhin du gnyis su snang ba nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that consciousness itself is the appearance of the duality of object and apprehender, like a crystal.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: yul du snang ba der rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyan nus pa dang ldan par byed cing lan 'ga' ni de'i rnam pa'i nus par gnas so //
analyzed: yul du snang ba der rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyan nus pa dang ldan par byed cing lan 'ga' ni de'i rnam pa'i nus par gnas so //
translated: In order to generate an effect that is concordant with it, the appearance of an object gradually empowers consciousness to possess the capacity. Sometimes the capacity of that appearance is present.

original: lan 'ga' ni nus pa yongs su smin pa las rnam par shes pa yul du snang ba'i rnam par skye'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni nus pa yongs su smin pa las rnam par shes pa yul du snang ba'i rnam par skye'o //
translated: Sometimes consciousness arises as the appearance of an object from the ripening of that capacity.

original: rnam par shes pa ni nus pa dang yul du snang ba de gnyis las gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nus pa dang yul du snang ba de gnyis las gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du brjod par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that consciousness is the same as or different from those two, the capacity and the appearance of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid pa dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid pa dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid gnyis su snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that consciousness itself and the entity of the object appear as two,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains here:

original: gnyis su snang med nus pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis su snang med nus pa ni //
translated: If it is not possible for two to appear,

original: tha dad min phyir yul snang bzhin //
analyzed: tha dad min phyir yul snang bzhin //
translated: then it is like the appearance of an object.

original: zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin la /
translated: The position is that consciousness itself does not appear as two.

original: nus pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin /
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin /
translated: The reason is because it is not possible for two to appear.

original: yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin te /üîΩrang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yin zhes bya bar yang de skye ba na yul du snang ba kho na'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe yin te / rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yin zhes bya bar yang de skye ba na yul du snang ba kho na'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: The example is like the appearance of an object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i phyir dang / yul du snang ba 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i phyir dang / yul du snang ba 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it arises, consciousness arises only in the appearance of an object because the aspect of the object appears as different and because the appearance of the object is nonerroneous.

original: de 'gag pa na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i nus pa yul du snang ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu dang ldan pa @206b bzhag gnas 'gag cing de yongs su smin par gyur pa las yang yul du snang ba'i rnam parüîΩshes pa nyed skye bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de 'gag pa na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i nus pa yul du snang ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu dang ldan pa @206b bzhag gnas 'gag cing de yongs su smin par gyur pa las yang yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyed skye bar zad kyi /
translated: From the maturation of that capacity, consciousness appearing as objects arises.

original: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i nus pa gang gis de bskyed bar 'gyur ba bzhag pa ni 'ga' yang med pas yul du snang ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la rang du snang ba nyid brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i nus pa gang gis de bskyed bar 'gyur ba bzhag pa ni 'ga' yang med pas yul du snang ba nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la rang du snang ba nyid brtags pas ci bya /
translated: Since there is nothing that generates consciousness appearing as objects, what is the point of imputing consciousness appearing as objects?

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba yin te /
translated: But if you think that consciousness itself appears as two,

original: ltan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs brnyan bzhin te /
analyzed: ltan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs brnyan bzhin te /
translated: then it is like a reflection and the form that casts the reflection, because they arise in a similar way at the same time.

original: gang la lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul yod pa de ni lhan cig tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang la lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul yod pa de ni lhan cig tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: That which has the mode of arising together arises together.

original: cig car 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cig car 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúarising simultaneously.‚Äù

original: gang lhan cig 'byung pa dang 'dra ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni 'dra bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang lhan cig 'byung pa dang 'dra ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni 'dra bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: That which has the same mode of being as co-arising is similar arising.

original: lhan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is co-arising in a similar way.

original: dper na gzugs dang lhan cig tu gzugs brnyan 'dra bar 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang lhan cig tu gzugs brnyan 'dra bar 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, a reflection arises in a similar way to a form.

original: de la gzugs lta bu ni rang du snang ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la gzugs lta bu ni rang du snang ba nyid yin la /
translated: In that case, the form is the appearance of itself,

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu ni yul du snang ba nyid yin par sems na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu ni yul du snang ba nyid yin par sems na /
translated: and the reflection is the appearance of an object.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩsems ni rang dang gzhan snang ba //üîΩlhan cig 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / sems ni rang dang gzhan snang ba // lhan cig 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe mind is not asserted to beüîΩsimilarly co-arising

original: gzugs brnyan bzhin du mi 'dod de //üîΩde phyir gnyis su snang ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bzhin du mi 'dod de // de phyir gnyis su snang ma yin //
translated: because it appears as itself and another,üîΩlike a reflection.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba nyid yin du zin kyang gnyis su snang ba nyid du mi 'grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu 'dra bar 'byung ba nyid yin du zin kyang gnyis su snang ba nyid du mi 'grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: Even though it is similar co-arising, it is not established as the appearance of two things.

original: gzugs brnyan ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i blo yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / de'i blo yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reflection is not a real thing, and the cognition of it is mistaken.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: rnam par shes pa ni gnyis su snang ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gnyis su snang ba kho na yin te /
translated: Consciousness is only the appearance of duality,

original: tshad ma dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a valid cognition and a result.

original: de la tshad ma ni 'dis rjes su dpog pa'i phyir tshad ma ste /
analyzed: de la tshad ma ni 'dis rjes su dpog pa'i phyir tshad ma ste /
translated: Among them, a valid cognition is a valid cognition because it infers this,

original: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: that is, the consciousness that appears as itself.

original: 'bras bu ni de'i yul so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de'i yul so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: A result is the discernment of its object,

original: yul du snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: yul du snang ba nyid do //
translated: that is, the appearance as the object.

original: yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag 'thad par dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig la ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag 'thad par dka'o zhe na /
translated: It is difficult for a mere consciousness that appears as an object to be both a valid cognition and a result.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te tshad ma 'bras yod phyir //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te tshad ma 'bras yod phyir //
translated: Here, we say:üîΩIf you assert that the appearance of duality

original: gnyis su snang bar 'dod ce na //
analyzed: gnyis su snang bar 'dod ce na //
translated: is because the valid cognition has a result,

original: gzhan du'ang de dag 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang de dag 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: then because they are established elsewhere,

original: brtag pa de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: brtag pa de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: that assertion is not accepted.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba nyid ma yin par gzhan du yang tshad ma dang 'bras bu de dag 'grub pa'i phyir brtag pa de yang mi 'dod do //üîΩde ji ltar na @207a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba nyid ma yin par gzhan du yang tshad ma dang 'bras bu de dag 'grub pa'i phyir brtag pa de yang mi 'dod do // de ji ltar na @207a * //
translated: Since valid knowledge and its effect are established in a way that is not non-dual, we do not accept that analysis.

original: gzhan du tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag 'grub par 'gyur zhen /üîΩde'i phyir / yul du snang ba 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan du tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag 'grub par 'gyur zhen / de'i phyir / yul du snang ba 'dzin pa yi //
translated: How is it that valid knowledge and its effect are established in a way that is not non-dual?üîΩTherefore it is said:üîΩThe consciousness that apprehends

original: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pas //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bzhin pas //
translated: The appearance as an object is arisen.üîΩIt is the valid knowledge that measures

original: gzhal bya gang yin 'jal byed pa //üîΩdes na de ni tshad mar 'dod //
analyzed: gzhal bya gang yin 'jal byed pa // des na de ni tshad mar 'dod //
translated: Whatever is to be measured.

original: ces bya ba smras te /üîΩ'di la yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'dzin par skye bzhin pa nyid kyis yul rnam par rtog par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te / 'di la yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'dzin par skye bzhin pa nyid kyis yul rnam par rtog par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is asserted to be valid knowledge.üîΩIn this regard, the consciousness that is called ‚Äúthe appearance as an object‚Äù is arisen in the aspect of apprehending.

original: shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma yin par 'dod do /
analyzed: shes pa skye bzhin pa nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma yin par 'dod do /
translated: Since it conceives of an object, whatever is arisen consciousness is asserted to be valid knowledge.

original: de skyes pa na mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de skyes pa na mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: When it has arisen, it sees.

original: de grub pa ni 'bras bur 'dod //
analyzed: de grub pa ni 'bras bur 'dod //
translated: Therefore its establishment is asserted to be the effect.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa de skyes pa na yul mthong ba'i phyir shes pa des mngon par grub pa ni 'bras bu yin pas yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid la tshad ma dang 'bras bu gnyis yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa de skyes pa na yul mthong ba'i phyir shes pa des mngon par grub pa ni 'bras bu yin pas yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid la tshad ma dang 'bras bu gnyis yod par 'dod de /
translated: Since the object is seen when that consciousness arises, the establishment of the object by that consciousness is the result.

original: dper na shing la sta res gzhas pa dang btab pa'i rkyen gyis gnyis su gcod par byed pa nyid dang / de dum bu gnyis su chad par gyur pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing la sta res gzhas pa dang btab pa'i rkyen gyis gnyis su gcod par byed pa nyid dang / de dum bu gnyis su chad par gyur pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the axe that cuts the tree and the conditions that strike it, which are the conditions that cause the tree to be cut into two parts, and the tree that is cut into two parts.

original: bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The nature of the object is not taught.

original: de bzhin rtog pa gang thob pa //
analyzed: de bzhin rtog pa gang thob pa //
translated: Similarly, the attainment of conceptionüîΩis the result of valid knowledge.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi shes pa dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid tsam la dmigs pa rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi shes pa dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid tsam la dmigs pa rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas /
translated: The nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.üîΩThe nature of the object is not taught.

original: gzugs la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: The nature of the object is not taught.

original: de bzhin du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du rang rig pa'i rnam pas rtogs par byed pa gang gi phyir de'i phyir yul nyid du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gcig pu kho na la tshad ma dang 'bras bu gnyig yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs
analyzed: de bzhin du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na bzhin du rang rig pa'i rnam pas rtogs par byed pa gang gi phyir de'i phyir yul nyid du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gcig pu kho na la tshad ma dang 'bras bu gnyig yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs
translated: Likewise, it is realized by the aspect of reflexive awareness, which has the nature of nonexistence. Therefore, because the valid cognition and the result are both present in the single consciousness that appears as the object, the reason is not established.

original: kyi don ma grub pas rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang bar rtogs pa ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: kyi don ma grub pas rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang bar rtogs pa ni dgos pa med do //
translated: Since the meaning of the reason is not established, it is pointless to realize that consciousness itself appears as dual.

original: yang pha rol po dag gi bsam pa gzhan bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang pha rol po dag gi bsam pa gzhan bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Again, in order to eliminate the thoughts of others, it is said:

original: gal te smra 'dod bsgrub bya ba //
analyzed: gal te smra 'dod bsgrub bya ba //
translated: If you assert that the object of expression

original: phyi don sems kyi dngos nyid de //
analyzed: phyi don sems kyi dngos nyid de //
translated: Is an external object that is the entity of the mind,

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
translated: It is the object of consciousness,

original: dper na de ma thag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de ma thag bzhin no //
translated: Like the immediately preceding one.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la phyi rol gyi don ni chos can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la phyi rol gyi don ni chos can no //
translated: Here, the subject is external objects.

original: de sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par sgrub pa ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: de sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par sgrub pa ni de'i chos so //
translated: The property to be proven is that they are the entity of the mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin phyir //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause they are the object of consciousness.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don du phyir zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is for the purpose of stating the reason.

original: dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste //
analyzed: dper na de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste //
translated: The example is like the immediately preceding condition.

original: @207b sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs pa de ma thag tu 'gags pa rnams ni de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //üîΩgal te de yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @207b sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs pa de ma thag tu 'gags pa rnams ni de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o // gal te de yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The immediately preceding minds and mental factors that have ceased are the condition for the arising of other minds and mental factors, and therefore they are called the immediately preceding condition.

original: des na sems byung so so yis //
analyzed: des na sems byung so so yis //
translated: If external objects are also the nature of mind because they are the objects of consciousness, then just as they are, minds and mental factors are also the nature of external objects because they are the objects of consciousness.

original: gtan tshigs 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the reason is mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba ni des ci re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des ci re zhig rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: What is the point of this?üîΩIf external objects are the object of consciousness, then like the immediately preceding condition, external objects would also be the nature of mind.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba so so dag sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma ngesüîΩpa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba so so dag sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul yang sems kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Or, if external objects are not the nature of mind because they are the object of consciousness, like the individual mental factors such as feeling, then the reason is not established.

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du de ni lung gis 'grub ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du de ni lung gis 'grub ste /
translated: But if you think that is established by scripture,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: then consider this.

original: khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs par sems na /
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs par sems na /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe three realms are mind only‚Äù is not reasonable.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩde ni rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Why?

original: lung gi don yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi don yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the scriptures is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo las sems tsam gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: mdo las sems tsam gsungs pa ni //
translated: The s≈´tras state that the three realms are mind only

original: byed po za po dgag phyir ro //
analyzed: byed po za po dgag phyir ro //
translated: in order to refute the agent and the experiencer.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can dag gis rnam par shes pa las gzhan gyi byed pa po dang za ba po yod par brtags pa sel bar mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems tsam zhes bstan pa mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs can dag gis rnam par shes pa las gzhan gyi byed pa po dang za ba po yod par brtags pa sel bar mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems tsam zhes bstan pa mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas taught mind only in order to eliminate the non Buddhist‚Äôs imagined creator and experiencer other than consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi yul bsal ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul bsal ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: They did not teach it in order to eliminate external objects.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa bcu pa'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mdo sde las /
translated: The Dashabhumika Sutra says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa la rnam par blta ba 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa la rnam par blta ba 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: On the sixth bodhisattva ground, the bodhisattva who sees the forward and reverse progressions of dependent origination thinks this:

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa las sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa byed pa po dang / tshe rab po dang bral pa 'di 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi shing ljon pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du de ltar nges pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis pa las sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa byed pa po dang / tshe rab po dang bral pa 'di 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi shing ljon pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du de ltar nges pas /
translated: The tree of suffering is established.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ltar /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ltar /
translated: O sons of the Conqueror, it is thus:

original: khams gsum pa 'di ni @208a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di ni @208a * //
translated: this triple world

original: sems tsam ste /
analyzed: sems tsam ste /
translated: is mind only.

original: sems kyis mngon bar 'dus byas pa dang / sems kyis bris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyis mngon bar 'dus byas pa dang / sems kyis bris pa yin gyi /
translated: It is created by the mind, and written by the mind.üîΩThere is no agent or experiencer other than the mind.

original: sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po dang / za ba po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pas phyi rol gyi yul med pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po dang / za ba po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pas phyi rol gyi yul med pa nyid du mi 'grub bo // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Thus, it is not established that external objects do not exist.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang gsungs te /üîΩbyams pa byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi bye brag gdags pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang gsungs te / byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi bye brag gdags pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Here, the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Maitreya, a bodhisattva should understand the designation of the variety of forms in three ways.üîΩWhat are the three?

original: 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: This is the imagined form.

original: 'di ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: This is the discriminated form.

original: 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so zhes bya bas so //
translated: This is the form of reality.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined form?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad la brten nas gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad la brten nas gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Form is imagined to be the nature of form on the basis of name, concept, verbalization, and social convention.

original: de ni rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de ni rdzas su med do //
translated: It does not exist substantially.

original: de la rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the discriminated form?

original: rnam par rtog pa la brten nas gang la ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad kyi gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la brten nas gang la ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa dang / tha snyad kyi gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs par mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
translated: It is the verbal expression ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on, on the basis of discrimination, name, concept, verbalization, and social convention.

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod pa nyid la brten nas rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod pa nyid la brten nas rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
translated: It exists substantially on the basis of the substantial existence of discrimination.

original: rang dbang du 'jug pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang du 'jug pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist independently.

original: de la chos nyid kyi gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyi gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the form of reality?

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de la rtag tu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / chos bdag med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de la rtag tu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / chos bdag med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The imagined form is always devoid of entityness in the imputed form, the selflessness of phenomena, the limit of reality, and so on.

original: de la rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de la rdzas su yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not substantially existent.

original: rdzas su med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas su med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent as a substance.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / gal te rnam pa brtags don stong pas //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so zhe na / bshad pa / gal te rnam pa brtags don stong pas //
translated: Because the object of imputation is empty and consciousness exists.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa sgrub byed na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sgrub byed na //
translated: If you prove consciousnessüîΩBy the emptiness of the imputed object,

original: brtags pa ma yin don yod phyir //
analyzed: brtags pa ma yin don yod phyir //
translated: Then because the non-imputed object exists,

original: yul med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that objects do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la rnam par brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid yin yang de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba'i chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi don yod pa'i phyir sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la rnam par brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid yin yang de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba'i chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi don yod pa'i phyir sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos
translated: This is the emptiness of the object imputed to consciousness.üîΩHowever, since the reality that is the object of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs individually introspective self-awareness is a form, it is not a thing that is literally true.

original: po @208b gang yin pa de yod pas brtags pa ma yin pa'i don yod pa'i phyir yul yod pa kho na yin par rnam par shes pa thams cad du yul gyis stong pa yin par mi rigs so /
analyzed: po @208b gang yin pa de yod pas brtags pa ma yin pa'i don yod pa'i phyir yul yod pa kho na yin par rnam par shes pa thams cad du yul gyis stong pa yin par mi rigs so /
translated: Since it is not an imputed object, it exists. Therefore it is not tenable that all consciousnesses are empty of objects.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way

original: bam pa bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam pa bco brgyad pa /
translated: Eighteenth part

original: gzhan yang / rmi lam la yang brtags min pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rmi lam la yang brtags min pa'i //
translated: Moreover, even in dreams,

original: ngo bo nyid blos ma nges 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid blos ma nges 'gyur //
translated: the mind does not ascertain a non-imputed nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam ste /
translated: The three realms are mind only.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: They are empty of objects such as form.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la 'di ltar /üîΩrmi lam la yang brtags pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo'i cha yod pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la 'di ltar / rmi lam la yang brtags pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo'i cha yod pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi
translated: It is like the consciousnesses of dreams and so forth.üîΩIn response to that, it is like this.

original: skyes bu la sogs pa'i don gyis stong par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa'i don gyis stong par 'gyur ram /
translated: Since a part of the mind that is not an imputed entity exists even in a dream, then is it that ‚Äúit is like the consciousnesses of dreams and so forth‚Äù because dream consciousness is empty of the entity of a dream consciousness that is imputed by a philosophical mind?

original: 'on te rang gi cha la dmigs pa brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyis mi stong par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi cha la dmigs pa brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyis mi stong par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: Or is it that the reason is indeterminate because it is not empty of an entity that is not imputed, an object that is a part of itself?

original: dmigs pa med pa mi 'dod de //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa mi 'dod de //
translated: We do not assert that there is no object of observation,

original: dpe ni rab tu ma grub phyir //
analyzed: dpe ni rab tu ma grub phyir //
translated: because the example is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dpe rmi lam blangs pa der yang brtags pa'i don sel bar byed kyi brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyi cha sel bar mi byed pa des kyang sems tsam nyid du mi 'grub pa'i
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dpe rmi lam blangs pa der yang brtags pa'i don sel bar byed kyi brtags pa ma yin pa'i don gyi cha sel bar mi byed pa des kyang sems tsam nyid du mi 'grub pa'i
translated: This is the example of the dream that was cited in the verse, ‚ÄúBecause it is empty of the object that is imagined.‚Äù But even in that example, the object that is imagined is eliminated, and the part of the object that is not imagined is not eliminated. Therefore, it is not established that mind only is the meaning of the scriptures.

original: phyir / dmigs pa med par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: phyir / dmigs pa med par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that there is no object of perception.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs gcig dang mi ldan par rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs gcig dang mi ldan par rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the example is not established as lacking one part of the probandum.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi don la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi don la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The object of perception in a dream is the form that is the intrinsic nature of consciousness. Therefore, it is not the case that there is no object of perception.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan la dbab par na de dpe nyid du mi rung ngo zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan la dbab par na de dpe nyid du mi rung ngo zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: In this way, because a dream is not real, it is not suitable to be an example in a formal proof. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: ci ste blo yul rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: ci ste blo yul rnam pa gnyis //
translated: If the object of cognition is twofold,

original: gcig dang 'dus pa yin snyam na //
analyzed: gcig dang 'dus pa yin snyam na //
translated: either one or a collection,

original: rigs pas yongs su brtags pa na //
analyzed: rigs pas yongs su brtags pa na //
translated: then when it is examined with reasoning,

original: de ni gnyi gar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni gnyi gar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable in either case.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ci ste phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dag blo'i yul rnam par gnyis su 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ci ste phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba dag blo'i yul rnam par gnyis su 'dod de /
translated: The opponent says: Why do those who advocate the existence of external objects assert the object-field of cognition to be twofold?

original: rdul phra rab gcig pu 'ba' zhig yul du 'dod dam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig pu 'ba' zhig yul du 'dod dam /
translated: Do they assert that the object-field is a single atom?

original: 'on te rdul phra rab 'dus pa yul du 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab 'dus pa yul du 'dod do snyam na /
translated: Or do they assert that the object-field is an aggregation of atoms?

original: gnyig yang rigs pas yongs su brtags pa na @209a * //
analyzed: gnyig yang rigs pas yongs su brtags pa na @209a * //
translated: When both are examined by reasoning,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir de ni gnyi gar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir de ni gnyi gar mi rigs te /
translated: it is not reasonable in either case, because of contradiction.

original: bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not good.

original: rigs pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that reasoning?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de la gzugs rdul gcig pu ni //
analyzed: de la gzugs rdul gcig pu ni //
translated: Therein, a single atom of form

original: gzugs blo'i spyod yul ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs blo'i spyod yul ma yin te //
translated: is not the object-field of the cognition of form,

original: de snang nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de snang nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: because it would not appear,

original: dbang gzugs spyod yul ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: dbang gzugs spyod yul ma yin bzhin //
translated: like the sense faculty and form.

original: zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phra ba nyid kyi mthar thug pa ni rdul phra rab bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phra ba nyid kyi mthar thug pa ni rdul phra rab bo //
translated: The ultimate limit of the subtlety of form is the atom.

original: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Single means alone.

original: gzugs kyi rdul gcig pu ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdul gcig pu ni zhes bya ba ni chos can yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa single particle of form‚Äù is the subject.

original: de gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te /
analyzed: de gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis not the object of the cognition of form‚Äù is the predicate.

original: chos can dang chos bsdus pa ni phyogs yin no //üîΩde snang nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: chos can dang chos bsdus pa ni phyogs yin no // de snang nyid du mi 'gyur phyir //
translated: The combination of the subject and the predicate is the proposition.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /üîΩde snang nyid du zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dngos po nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te / de snang nyid du zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dngos po nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it does not appear‚Äù is the reason.

original: de snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni de blo la //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni de blo la //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not appear‚Äù means that it does not appear as an object.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit does not appear‚Äù means that it does not appear to the cognition.

original: snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing//üîΩyul gyi dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing// yul gyi dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It does not appear as an object.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩdbang gzugs spyod yul ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba smos so // dbang gzugs spyod yul ma yin bzhin //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the meaning of the reason‚Äù is stated.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as the sense faculties are not the objects of one another‚Äù is the example.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga rnams te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe sense faculties‚Äù refers to the five sense faculties.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yul kha dog gzugs dang ba nyid du yod pa yin yang de snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yul kha dog gzugs dang ba nyid du yod pa yin yang de snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Although the nature of those is the clear form of the object‚Äôs color, it does not appear as such.

original: dper na de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na de gzugs kyi blo'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang gzugs kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as that is not the object of the eye consciousness apprehending form, so too the subtle particle is not the object of the eye consciousness apprehending form.

original: phra rab gzugs ni du ma ste //
analyzed: phra rab gzugs ni du ma ste //
translated: Many subtle particles are form,

original: sems kyi spyod yul yin mi 'dod //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul yin mi 'dod //
translated: but it is not asserted to be the object of the mind.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin phyir //
translated: Because it does not substantially exist,

original: dper na zla ba gnyis bzhin no//
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis bzhin no//
translated: it is like, for example, a second moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs du ma de dag 'dus pa de yang sems kyi spyod yul yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs du ma de dag 'dus pa de yang sems kyi spyod yul yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Many subtle particles are form, but that aggregation of many subtle particles is not asserted to be the object of the mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not substantially exist.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'ba' zhig pa ni rdzas su 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyi gzugs 'ba' zhig pa ni rdzas su 'dod la /
translated: For in this system, only the subtle particle is asserted to be substantially existent.

original: de dag 'dus pa ni dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de snang bar 'gyur du zin kyang sems kyi spyod yul yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa ni dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de snang bar 'gyur du zin kyang sems kyi spyod yul yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Since they are not substantially existent like an army, a forest, and so on, even if they were to appear, it is illogical that they are objects of mind.

original: dper na rab rib can gyi mig skyon gyis nyams pas zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin par mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyi mig skyon gyis nyams pas zla ba gnyis la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin par mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the eyes of one with diseased vision, impaired by a fault, seeing two moons and so on, which are not real.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de la gal te pha rol po //
analyzed: de la gal te pha rol po //
translated: If you prove to the opponentüîΩthat uncompounded form is not

original: 'phags @209b pa med pa'i gzugs sems kyi //üîΩspyod yul min par sgrub byed na //
analyzed: 'phags @209b pa med pa'i gzugs sems kyi // spyod yul min par sgrub byed na //
translated: an object of mind,

original: der ni grub pa nyid sgrub 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni grub pa nyid sgrub 'gyur //
translated: you are proving what is already established.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag bsags pa ma yin pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab gcig pu sems kyi spyod yul nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed na phyogs snga ma der grub pa nyid la sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag bsags pa ma yin pa'i gzugs rdul phra rab gcig pu sems kyi spyod yul nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed na phyogs snga ma der grub pa nyid la sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: If you prove to the opponent that uncompounded form, which is not an aggregation, a single subtle particle, is not an object of mind, then you are proving what is already established for the opponent.

original: kho bo cag kyang de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we also assert that.üîΩIf you prove to the opponent

original: ci ste bsags pa'i gzugs la ni //
analyzed: ci ste bsags pa'i gzugs la ni //
translated: that compounded form is notüîΩan object of mind,üîΩyou are proving what is already established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub nyid 'gyur te //üîΩgzugs gzhan dag gi bsags pa ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub nyid 'gyur te // gzugs gzhan dag gi bsags pa ni //
translated: The reason is not established.üîΩBecause the cognition perceiving it

original: der snang blo ni skye phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang blo ni skye phyir ro //
translated: arises in the aspect of the aggregation of other forms.

original: zhes bya ba ni ci ste rdul phra rab kyi rigs mthun pa bsags pa'i gzugs phyogs su byas nas de la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci ste rdul phra rab kyi rigs mthun pa bsags pa'i gzugs phyogs su byas nas de la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na ni /
translated: If you posit the form that is the aggregation of similar types of subtle particles as the subject and state the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not substantially exist,‚Äù

original: de lta na gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba lam grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba lam grub pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa'i gzugs gzhan dag gis de la bsags shing kun nas sbyar ba na de yul gyi dngos por khas blangs shing der snang ba'i blo rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa'i gzugs gzhan dag gis de la bsags shing kun nas sbyar ba na de yul gyi dngos por khas blangs shing der snang ba'i blo rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when other forms of similar types of subtle particles are aggregated and combined, it is accepted as the object and the cognition perceiving it arises in the aspect of the aggregation of subtle particles.

original: kho bo cag ni rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa'i bsags pa bum pa la sogs pa nyid dang phra rab kyang kun rdzob pa'i rdzas su 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa'i bsags pa bum pa la sogs pa nyid dang phra rab kyang kun rdzob pa'i rdzas su 'dod de /
translated: We assert that the aggregation of similar types of subtle particles, such as a vase, and even subtle particles are conventional substances.

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab ni rdzas brgyad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab ni rdzas brgyad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: Thus, because subtle particles are the nature of the aggregation of eight substances,

original: de yang rdzas nyid yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: de yang rdzas nyid yin par 'dod la /
translated: they are asserted to be substances.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyang rdzas nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyang rdzas nyid yin te /
translated: Similarly, the nature of the aggregation of pots and so on is also a substance,

original: 'ba' zhig pa ni rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ni rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not an aggregation is not established as a substance.

original: de ni dmigs nyid yin 'dod de //
analyzed: de ni dmigs nyid yin 'dod de //
translated: You assert that it is an observed object

original: der snang blo yi rgyur 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: der snang blo yi rgyur 'gyur phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of a mind appearing as that.

original: 'dod chags bzhin te de yi phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin te de yi phyir //
translated: It is like attachment.

original: khyod dam bcas la rjes dpag gnod //
analyzed: khyod dam bcas la rjes dpag gnod //
translated: Therefore your thesis is undermined by inference.

original: ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa bsags pa'i gzugs de ni dmigs pa nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa bsags pa'i gzugs de ni dmigs pa nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: This is because the form that is the aggregation of homogeneous subtle particles is asserted to be an observed object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar rdul phra rab bsags pa de ni bsags pa'i gzugs der snang ba'i blo'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar rdul phra rab bsags pa de ni bsags pa'i gzugs der snang ba'i blo'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause that aggregation of subtle particles is the cause of the mind that appears as that aggregated form.

original: gang dang gang der snang ba'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de dang de ni bsags pa la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang der snang ba'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de dang de ni bsags pa la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: That which is the cause of the mind that appears as that is observed as an aggregation.

original: dper na 'dod chags yul la chags pa'i mtshan nyid de ni bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa bsags pa nyid la dmigs par 'dod pa bzhin te /üîΩde'i phyir khyod kyis bsags @210a * //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags yul la chags pa'i mtshan nyid de ni bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa bsags pa nyid la dmigs par 'dod pa bzhin te / de'i phyir khyod kyis bsags @210a * //
translated: For example, it is like the case of the characteristic of attachment to an object of attachment, which is asserted to be observed in the mere aggregation of the form of a woman, and so on.

original: pa'i gzugs ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa de la rjes su dpag pa 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i gzugs ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa de la rjes su dpag pa 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, your thesis that ‚Äúaggregated form is not an observed object‚Äù is undermined by this inference.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i gnas dang / dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i gnas dang / dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: It also contradicts the scriptures that state, ‚ÄúThe five collections of consciousness have an aggregated basis and object.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: blo ni dmigs pa med pa kho nar skye ste /
analyzed: blo ni dmigs pa med pa kho nar skye ste /
translated: The mind arises without an observed object,

original: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir yid kyi blo bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las skyes pa'i phyir yid kyi blo bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it arises from the seed of consciousness that appears as itself, like the mental cognition.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te rang blo dmigs med de //
analyzed: gal te rang blo dmigs med de //
translated: If the mind does not observe itself,üîΩit is like the mental cognition,üîΩnot like a reflection,

original: rang gi sa bon las skye'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las skye'i phyir //
translated: because it arises from its own seed.üîΩIf the mind does not observe itself,üîΩit is like the mental cognition,

original: yid blo bzhin 'dod btags min phyir //
analyzed: yid blo bzhin 'dod btags min phyir //
translated: not like a reflection,

original: khyod kyi dmigs bcas nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi dmigs bcas nyid du 'gyur //
translated: because it arises from its own seed.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la'ang btags pa ma yin pa'i rang gi don du snang ba'i cha yod pa'i phyir khyod kyi blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la'ang btags pa ma yin pa'i rang gi don du snang ba'i cha yod pa'i phyir khyod kyi blo dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dmigs pa med pa rjes dpog pas //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rjes dpog pas //
translated: If it is inferred that it does not exist,

original: de ni blo nyid ma yin 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni blo nyid ma yin 'gyur //
translated: it would not be a mind.

original: 'dus pa dam ni ma bcas pas ;
analyzed: 'dus pa dam ni ma bcas pas ;
translated: Since it is not a compact,

original: / de 'gog pa ni gnod pa med //
analyzed: / de 'gog pa ni gnod pa med //
translated: its refutation is not faulty.üîΩ  This is because if something is called a ‚Äúmind‚Äù because it realizes an object, then if it is asserted that it is a mind because it infers that the object does not exist, it would not be a mind.

original: ces bya ba ni dmigs pa rtogs par byed pas blo zhes bya ba yin na dmigs pa med pa nyid rjes su dpog pas blor 'dod pa de blo ma yin pa nyid du gyur pas blo de ni blo nyid ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dmigs pa rtogs par byed pas blo zhes bya ba yin na dmigs pa med pa nyid rjes su dpog pas blor 'dod pa de blo ma yin pa nyid du gyur pas blo de ni blo nyid ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi
translated: Therefore, since that mind is not a mind, the subject

original: rang gi ngo bo log par bsgrubs pas dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo log par bsgrubs pas dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: is refuted.

original: khyod kyis 'dus pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang kho bos kyang 'dus pa dmigs pa yin par dam bcas te /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dus pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang kho bos kyang 'dus pa dmigs pa yin par dam bcas te /
translated: You have said that the collection is not an object, but we have also asserted that the collection is an object.

original: 'o na ji ltar dam bcas she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dam bcas she na /
translated: How have we asserted this?

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni dmigs pa yin par dam bcas pas khyod kyis 'dus pa dmigs pa ma yin par de 'gog pa ni kho bo la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni dmigs pa yin par dam bcas pas khyod kyis 'dus pa dmigs pa ma yin par de 'gog pa ni kho bo la gnod pa med do //
translated: We have asserted that the collection of subtle atoms is an object. Therefore, your refutation of the collection as an object does not harm our position.

original: bsags pa dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bsags pa dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the collection and the aggregation?

original: rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa dag gzhi gcig la brten pa ni tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rigs mthun pa dag gzhi gcig la brten pa ni tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A collection is a group of homogeneous subtle atoms that are based on the same locus.

original: glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa dang / skyed pa dang / seng ldeng la sogs pa'i rdzas rigs mi mthun pa gzhi tha dad pa 'dus pa la dmag dang nags tshal la sogs par gdags pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa dang / skyed pa dang / seng ldeng la sogs pa'i rdzas rigs mi mthun pa gzhi tha dad pa 'dus pa la dmag dang nags tshal la sogs par gdags pa ni 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: An aggregation is a collection of heterogeneous substances, such as elephants, horses, and so on, or trees, shrubs, and so on, that are based on different loci.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'o na kho bo cag gi dmigs pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: 'o na kho bo cag gi dmigs pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: we have already firmly established this position with the followingüîΩlines:

original: phyi rol don ni med par yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni med par yang //
translated: Even though external objects do not exist,

original: nus pa dang ni @210b yul gyi dngos //
analyzed: nus pa dang ni @210b yul gyi dngos //
translated: the potency and the object

original: gnyis po phan tshun rgyur 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gnyis po phan tshun rgyur 'gyur bas //
translated: are mutually causal,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug / ces bya bas phyogs 'di brtan por bzhag zin to zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug / ces bya bas phyogs 'di brtan por bzhag zin to zhe na /
translated: and thus they operate from beginningless time.

original: bshad pa / tshig le'ur byas pa de'i rtsa ba bzhi pa /
analyzed: bshad pa / tshig le'ur byas pa de'i rtsa ba bzhi pa /
translated: We respond: The fourth line of that verse

original: ji ltar de ni ldog par 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni ldog par 'dod //
translated: states, ‚ÄúHow could it be reversed?‚Äù

original: ces bya ba 'dis rjes nas brgal zhing brtag par bya ste ;
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis rjes nas brgal zhing brtag par bya ste ;
translated: This is a subsequent consequence that should be examined.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa la ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i dag pa tshol ba'i rnal 'byor pas yul ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs par gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skye ba rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa la ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i dag pa tshol ba'i rnal 'byor pas yul ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs par gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skye ba rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If external objects exist, then it would be logical that the yogi who seeks the purity of the consciousness that appears as an object would realize that the object lacks any essence, and thus the nonconceptual supramundane wisdom that reverses the apprehension of the object and the apprehender would arise.

original: khyed yul med pa la ni dang po nas kyang phyi rol gyi don med la /üîΩphyis kyang med pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de phyis rgyu gang gis ldog cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yang med do //
analyzed: khyed yul med pa la ni dang po nas kyang phyi rol gyi don med la / phyis kyang med pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de phyis rgyu gang gis ldog cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yang med do //
translated: For you, who are without a basis, there is no external object from the start,üîΩand later on, there is no way to stop or destroy it, and no way to generate the supramundane nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yul med par smra ba la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skye ba'i thabs med pas nus pa dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa de ji ltar ldog pa'i rigs pa brjod par bya dgos so
analyzed: yul med par smra ba la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skye ba'i thabs med pas nus pa dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa de ji ltar ldog pa'i rigs pa brjod par bya dgos so
translated: For those who propound the nonexistence of objects, there is no way to generate the supramundane path. Therefore, you must explain the logic by which the consciousness that has the nature of object and apprehender, which has been operating since beginningless time, can be stopped.

original: // gal te khyod 'di snyam du /
analyzed: // gal te khyod 'di snyam du /
translated: If you think,

original: mi rtog blo ni spang min te //
analyzed: mi rtog blo ni spang min te //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nonconceptual mind is not to be abandoned,

original: 'phags phyir rnam par mi rtog phyir //
analyzed: 'phags phyir rnam par mi rtog phyir //
translated: because it is noble and nonconceptual,‚Äù

original: zhes bya bar sems na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs su zin kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo ni spang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sems na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs su zin kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo ni spang ba ma yin te /
translated: If you think that even though the two conceptual thoughts of object and apprehender are abandoned as the cause of entry into cyclic existence, nonconceptual cognition is not abandoned,

original: 'phags pa'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: and that it is just that which arises because it is ƒÅrya and nonconceptual,

original: ldog par mi 'gyur bar sems na'o //
analyzed: ldog par mi 'gyur bar sems na'o //
translated: then you think that it does not cease.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,

original: de skye thar pa ga la yod //
analyzed: de skye thar pa ga la yod //
translated: how could there be liberation for you?

original: de yi sa bon ma bcom phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i sa bon 'jug pas ni 'khor bar 'dod la /
analyzed: de yi sa bon ma bcom phyir // zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i sa bon 'jug pas ni 'khor bar 'dod la /
translated: Because its seed is not destroyed.üîΩThus, the seed of consciousness is asserted to be cyclic existence, and its destruction is asserted to be liberation.

original: de bcom pas ni thar par 'dod pa yin na ji srid du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de bcom pas ni thar par 'dod pa yin na ji srid du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: As long as conceptual or

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba yod pa de srid du thar pa ga la yod /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba yod pa de srid du thar pa ga la yod /
translated: nonconceptual cognition arises, how could there be liberation?

original: de'i phyir sems tsam du smra ba khyod la thar pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems tsam du smra ba khyod la thar pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for you, Proponents of Mind Only, liberation is untenable.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa skye ba ni 'ching ba yin la /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa skye ba ni 'ching ba yin la /
translated: But if you think that the arising of a conceptual consciousness is bondage,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba ni thar pa yin @211a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba ni thar pa yin @211a * //
translated: and the arising of a nonconceptual consciousness is liberation,

original: par sems te /
analyzed: par sems te /
translated: thenüîΩwhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / gnyis kyi 'du shes 'jug pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gnyis kyi 'du shes 'jug pa na //
translated: When the perception of duality ceases,

original: sna tshogs snang ba rab tu skye //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba rab tu skye //
translated: the appearance of manifold things does not arise.üîΩBecause the appearance of manifold things

original: de yi sna tshogs snang gang dang // de rang sa bon las skye'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yi sna tshogs snang gang dang // de rang sa bon las skye'i phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: arises from its own seeds.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa na /
translated: When the consciousness that engages the duality of object and subject arises,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba rab tu skye ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba rab tu skye ste /
translated: the appearance of manifold things such as form arises.

original: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that appearance of manifold things?

original: rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam par yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yul gyi rnam par yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the transformation of consciousness into the aspect of an object.

original: de dang rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa de yang rang gi sa bon yul du snang ba'i rnam pa de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rang du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa de yang rang gi sa bon yul du snang ba'i rnam pa de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the consciousness that appears as that object is born from the seed that is the aspect that appears as the object.üîΩThe latent state of those consciousnesses is due to the potential,

original: zha ba de la nus phul dang // rang bdag nyid dang gzhan las so //
analyzed: zha ba de la nus phul dang // rang bdag nyid dang gzhan las so //
translated: its own nature, and another.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag 'gag cing bag la zha ba na yang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa de la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag 'gag cing bag la zha ba na yang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa de la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: When those engaging consciousnesses cease and become latent, they enter that root consciousness.

original: gang gi nus pa phul ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin no //
