analyzed: gang gi nus pa phul ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: They exist as the nature of the potential that is deposited there.

original: rang gi cha la dmigs pa rang gi bdag nyid dang / yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan 'gag pa las kyang de la zha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar sems na /
analyzed: rang gi cha la dmigs pa rang gi bdag nyid dang / yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan 'gag pa las kyang de la zha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar sems na /
translated: If you think that they become latent due to observing their own part and due to the cessation of another consciousness that appears as an object,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: de ni 'jig rten yid ches par bya ba tsam la bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten yid ches par bya ba tsam la bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true only in terms of what is believed by the world.

original: skyon 'di yod de /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i ming gis ni //
analyzed: skyon 'di yod de / rnam par shes pa'i ming gis ni //
translated: But there is this fault:üîΩThe consciousnesses are imputed

original: de la bdag tu btags par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la bdag tu btags par 'gyur //
translated: as a self by the name consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dag kyang yul sna tshogs 'byin pa'i bdag gcig pu la thams cad kyis nus pa rab tu bsags par sems pas khyod kyis kyang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam gyi rgyu thabs kyis de nyid la bdag tuüîΩbtags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dag kyang yul sna tshogs 'byin pa'i bdag gcig pu la thams cad kyis nus pa rab tu bsags par sems pas khyod kyis kyang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam gyi rgyu thabs kyis de nyid la bdag tu btags par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the proponents of self also think that the single self that produces the various objects is the accumulation of the power of all. Therefore, you also impute that very self to the mere cause of the name ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: des na bdag med pa nyid du smra ba yang nyams so //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa nyid du smra ba yang nyams so //
translated: Thus, the proponents of selflessness are also undermined.

original: khyed kyis rnam par grol bar btags pa yang 'khor ba las khyad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyed kyis rnam par grol bar btags pa yang 'khor ba las khyad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, your imputed liberation would be no different from sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la sems tsam du smra ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor ba dang thar pa'i sems tshul la sems pa na /
analyzed: 'di la sems tsam du smra ba'i rnal 'byor pa 'khor ba dang thar pa'i sems tshul la sems pa na /
translated: In this regard, when the yogis who propound mind only reflect on the mind of sa·πÉsƒÅra and liberation,üîΩthey realize that the mind is like an illusion,üîΩthat it is finite, not peaceful, selfless,üîΩnondual, inexhaustible, repeated,

original: gnyis yod sgyu ma lta bu dang // zad can ma zhi bdag med dang // gnyis med mi zad yang yang dang // 'chi med go 'phang mchog rtogs nas //
analyzed: gnyis yod sgyu ma lta bu dang // zad can ma zhi bdag med dang // gnyis med mi zad yang yang dang // 'chi med go 'phang mchog rtogs nas //
translated: and the supreme state of immortality.

original: de la 'dra bar med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la 'dra bar med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since there is nothing like it,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam ldog pas //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam ldog pas //
translated: conceptualization is reversed.

original: mi rtog blos ni dmigs byed pa'i //
analyzed: mi rtog blos ni dmigs byed pa'i //
translated: The liberation of one who has an object

original: grol ba @211b khyad par med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grol ba @211b khyad par med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: would not differ from that of a nonconceptualist.

original: gnyis yod ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis yod ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por gnas pa ste /
translated: The two exist means that the two kinds of entities, the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, exist.

original: de ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / zad pa can dang / ma zhi ba dang / bdag med par rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / zad pa can dang / ma zhi ba dang / bdag med par rtogs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are understood to be like an illusion, perishable, not peaceful, and selfless.

original: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like an illusion means that they are produced by unreal imagination.

original: zad can zhes bya ba ni de la zad pa yod pas zad can no //
analyzed: zad can zhes bya ba ni de la zad pa yod pas zad can no //
translated: Perishable means that they perish.

original: ma zhi zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i bya bas 'phangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i bya bas 'phangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not peaceful means that they are projected by the activity of birth, death, and so on.

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs byed pa dag gis yongs su btags pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir dang / rang yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs byed pa dag gis yongs su btags pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir dang / rang yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Selfless means that they are selfless because they are not the self imagined by other philosophers, and because they are also devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gnyis med ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams sems las phyi rol las mi snang ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams sems las phyi rol las mi snang ba de'i tshe na /
translated: Non-duality means that when the objects of form, etc. do not appear as external to the mind,

original: rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa'i sems ni gnyis med ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la nges par gnas pa'i sems ni gnyis med ces bya ste /
translated: then the mind which is definitely established in the reality of its own mind is called non-dual.

original: de ni mi zad pa dang ; yang dag pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / go 'phang mchog yin par rtogs nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni mi zad pa dang ; yang dag pa dang / 'chi ba med pa dang / go 'phang mchog yin par rtogs nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected with ‚Äúhaving realized it to be imperishable, real, immortal, and the supreme state.‚Äù

original: mi zad ces bya ba ni de la zad pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad ces bya ba ni de la zad pa yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Imperishable means that it is not subject to destruction.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni mi slu ba'o //
translated: Real means that it is not deceptive.

original: 'chi med ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi med ces bya ba ni skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Immortal means that it is free from birth, death, etc.

original: go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i gnas so //
translated: The supreme state means the ultimate abode.

original: rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni gnyis yod pa dang / gnyis med pa dag tshul de ltar rtogs nas so //
analyzed: rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni gnyis yod pa dang / gnyis med pa dag tshul de ltar rtogs nas so //
translated: Having realized means that having realized duality and non-duality in that way,

original: de la 'dra bar med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la 'dra bar med pa'i phyir //
translated: because there is no similarity to that,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ji ltar 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na med pa bzhin du thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ji ltar 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na med pa bzhin du thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, in that nonduality, the apprehended and the apprehender do not exist, just as they do not exist in the state of liberation, in the same way that they do not exist in the state of cyclic existence.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam ldog pas //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam ldog pas //
translated: By the cessation of conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba ni de la gnyis po 'dra bar med par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa rnam par ldog pas so //üîΩmi ldog blos ni dmigs byas pa'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la gnyis po 'dra bar med par rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa rnam par ldog pas so // mi ldog blos ni dmigs byas pa'i //
translated: This is because, in that nonduality, conceptualization ceases by the realization of nonduality.üîΩBy the nondiscriminating intuition that has as its object the reality that is perceived by the nondiscriminating intuition.

original: zhes bya ba mngon sum gyi shes pas sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i blos kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mngon sum gyi shes pas sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i blos kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
translated: This refers to the yogin who has as his object the reality that is perceived by the nondiscriminating intuition, the reality that is not the literal reality.üîΩThere would be the fault that

original: de la / grol ba khyad par med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la / grol ba khyad par med par 'gyur //
translated: liberation would be without distinction.

original: zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur te /üîΩde la skye ba dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid sngon dang @212a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur te /üîΩde la skye ba dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid sngon dang @212a * //
translated: This is the fault.üîΩThere would be the fault that liberation would be without distinction, because the nondiscriminating intuition would be the same in all states, whether in cyclic existence or in liberation.

original: 'dra bar yod pa'i phyir sngon gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa las thar pa khyad par med pas bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar yod pa'i phyir sngon gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa las thar pa khyad par med pas bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the existence of similarity, there would be no difference between the liberation of the former conceptual cognition and bondage, and thus there would be no difference between bondage and liberation.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yang na sems tsam bsgrub pa'i phyir //üîΩsems las byung rnams sems las ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yang na sems tsam bsgrub pa'i phyir // sems las byung rnams sems las ni //
translated: In order to establish mind-only,üîΩyou must accept that mental factors

original: tha dad med par khas blang bya //
analyzed: tha dad med par khas blang bya //
translated: are not different from the mind.

original: yang na rnam rig tsam mi 'grub //
analyzed: yang na rnam rig tsam mi 'grub //
translated: Otherwise, mere cognition is not established.

original: ces bya ba ni yang na khyed sems tsam nyid du 'dod pas sems tsam nyid sgrub pa'i phyir sems las byung ba dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad rnams kyang sems las tha dad pa med par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang na khyed sems tsam nyid du 'dod pas sems tsam nyid sgrub pa'i phyir sems las byung ba dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad rnams kyang sems las tha dad pa med par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: In order to establish mind-only, you must accept that the various mental factors that apprehend objects are not different from the mind.

original: yang na sems las byung ba rnams sems las tha dad par rtog na ni sems las byung ba rnams mang ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: yang na sems las byung ba rnams sems las tha dad par rtog na ni sems las byung ba rnams mang ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Otherwise, if you conceive mental factors to be different from the mind, mere cognition is not established because mental factors are numerous.

original: yang na tshor sogs 'dus pa la //
analyzed: yang na tshor sogs 'dus pa la //
translated: Or else, in the collection of feeling and so on,

original: sems su gdags par 'dod par gyis //
analyzed: sems su gdags par 'dod par gyis //
translated: You should accept that the mind is designated in dependence upon the collection of the primary elements.

original: des na gzhan gyi rjes smra dang // rang gi gzhung yang btang bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni yang na khyed kyis tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'dus pa mdung khyim lta bu dang / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rjes smra dang // rang gi gzhung yang btang bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni yang na khyed kyis tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'dus pa mdung khyim lta bu dang / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu dang /
translated: Therefore, you would be a follower of the other schools and you would abandon your own scriptures.üîΩYou should accept that the mind is designated in dependence upon the collection of such things as feeling, perception, and intention, which are like a stack of bundles, or like the collection of earth, water, fire, and air,

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa lta bu la sems su gdags par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa lta bu la sems su gdags par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: or like a pot that possesses form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: gal te de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: des na khyed gzhan dbu ma smra ba'i rjes su smra pa dang / rang gi gzhung yang btang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na khyed gzhan dbu ma smra ba'i rjes su smra pa dang / rang gi gzhung yang btang bar 'gyur te /
translated: then you would be a follower of the other schools, the MƒÅdhyamikas, and you would abandon your own scriptures.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu kho na las rkyen ji lta ba las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'byung ba dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur pa yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu kho na las rkyen ji lta ba las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'byung ba dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur pa yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fivefold collection of consciousness arises from the foundation consciousness alone, and because the transformation of mental factors is accepted.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'di la tshor ba la sogs pa 'dus pa nyid la sems su brtags na sems rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur zhing des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gi gzhi ci yang med par 'gyur bas tshor ba la sogs pa tha dad pa dag la ni re re las de rdzas su yod pa nyid yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad pa dag gi gnas nyid du rigs
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'di la tshor ba la sogs pa 'dus pa nyid la sems su brtags na sems rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur zhing des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gi gzhi ci yang med par 'gyur bas tshor ba la sogs pa tha dad pa dag la ni re re las de rdzas su yod pa nyid yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad pa dag gi gnas nyid du rigs
translated: If you think that the mind is imputed to the collection of feeling and so on, then the substantial existence of the mind would be undermined and the basis of affliction and purification would be utterly nonexistent. Therefore it is logical that the mind substantially exists in each of the different feelings and so on, because it is the basis of affliction and purification.

original: te / ji skad du /
analyzed: te / ji skad du /
translated: As the Abhidharmakosa states,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams @212b sa bon kun gyi gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus ldan khams @212b sa bon kun gyi gnas gyur pa //
translated: Endowed with beginningless seeds, it is the foundation consciousness.

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: attain the state of nirvana.üîΩIn response to that,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: we say:

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang las //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang las //
translated: From the afflictions and from purification,

original: gal te sems ni rdzas 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te sems ni rdzas 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that mind is a substance,

original: tshor sogs de bzhin skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshor sogs de bzhin skye ba'i phyir //
translated: because feeling and so on arise in the same way,

original: de grub pas na gnod pa med //üîΩces bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs ba'i yid la byed pa dang bcas pa dag sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid na bcings pa yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: de grub pas na gnod pa med // ces bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs ba'i yid la byed pa dang bcas pa dag sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid na bcings pa yin par 'dod la /
translated: it is established and there is no fault.üîΩThus the afflicted and the secondary afflictions that occur together with the mind are asserted to be bondage.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral na shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa sems dang lhan cig nyid du grol bar 'dod pas sems nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan dang / gzhan dag la sems las byung ba dag tu gdags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral na shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa sems dang lhan cig nyid du grol bar 'dod pas sems nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan dang / gzhan dag la sems las byung ba dag tu gdags pa yin gyi /
translated: When free of the afflictions, the wisdom that occurs together with the mind is asserted to be liberation. Therefore the states of the mind itself are designated as mental factors.

original: gang gis sems 'ba' zhig pa yin na rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba phan tshun tha dad par gnas pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gis sems 'ba' zhig pa yin na rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba phan tshun tha dad par gnas pa ni med do //
translated: If it were only mind, then mind and mental factors would not exist as different substantial entities.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa dag nyid bcings pa'i rnam pa dang / thar pa'i rnam par de bzhin skye ba'i phyir tshogs pa las 'byung bas sems dang sems las byung ba dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de rab tu grub pas na khyed sems rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtogs pa des kho bo cag la gnodüîΩpa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa dag nyid bcings pa'i rnam pa dang / thar pa'i rnam par de bzhin skye ba'i phyir tshogs pa las 'byung bas sems dang sems las byung ba dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa de rab tu grub pas na khyed sems rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtogs pa des kho bo cag la gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since feeling and so on arise in the aspect of bondage and the aspect of liberation, they are established as the nature of the collection of mind and mental factors. Thus your understanding of mind as a substantial existent does not contradict us.

original: gal te de ltar sems 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: If mind is not a substantial existent because it is the nature of a collection,

original: ji ltar de las srid pa'i rgyun dang thar pa 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de las srid pa'i rgyun dang thar pa 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the continuum of existence and the attainment of liberation arise from it?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩautpala rtsa ba nus mang las //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / autpala rtsa ba nus mang las //
translated: To explain this, the root text says:üîΩJust as lotus roots, stems, and so on

original: lo ma la sogs rgyun 'byung ltar //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs rgyun 'byung ltar //
translated: arise from the many powers of the seed.

original: de bzhin sems rdzas med pa las //
analyzed: de bzhin sems rdzas med pa las //
translated: Likewise, from the mind, which is not a substance,

original: rgyun rnams sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun rnams sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The various streams arise.

original: autpala rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni autpala'i rtsa ba la ste /
analyzed: autpala rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni autpala'i rtsa ba la ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúthe root of the blue lotus‚Äù means the root of the blue lotus.

original: de la tsa ba'i 'brel pa gzhan med par yang nus pa mang po dang ldan pa las mtsho ci tsam du rgya che ba dag lo ma dang me tog la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis kun du khyab pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ltar de bzhin du sems rdzas su
analyzed: de la tsa ba'i 'brel pa gzhan med par yang nus pa mang po dang ldan pa las mtsho ci tsam du rgya che ba dag lo ma dang me tog la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis kun du khyab pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ltar de bzhin du sems rdzas su
translated: Even without any other connection, from the root endowed with many potencies, a lake arises, and it is completely filled with the streams of leaves, flowers, and so on.

original: med pa las kyang sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi bye brag khams dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rnam pa tha dad pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa las kyang sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi bye brag khams dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rnam pa tha dad pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, from the mind, which is not a substance, the various streams of the sa·πÉsƒÅra of sentient beings arise, with their different aspects of the various realms and destinies.

original: rgyun gyi bye brag de dag kyang //
analyzed: rgyun gyi bye brag de dag kyang //
translated: And those different streams

original: gnyen pos skye bar mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gnyen pos skye bar mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: Do not arise from an antidote,

original: @213a * // byed rgyu yod na skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: @213a * // byed rgyu yod na skye bar 'gyur //
translated: But arise when there is a cause.

original: zhes bya ba la gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gnyen po zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnticipating‚Äù refers to the eightfold noble path.

original: de skyes pa na rgyun rnams skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de skyes pa na rgyun rnams skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: When it arises, the continuum does not arise.

original: byed rgyu zag pa zhes bya ba dag yod na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu zag pa zhes bya ba dag yod na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the causal condition of the defilements exists, it arises.üîΩMoreover, you say:

original: yang na / lnga po'i rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
analyzed: yang na / lnga po'i rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
translated: From the root consciousness, the five arise,

original: rgyun bzhin du ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyun bzhin du ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Like the flow of a river.

original: zhes khyod kyis gang smras pa de la rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa med par yang sems 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yod pas ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis gang smras pa de la rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa med par yang sems 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yod pas ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that, even without a root consciousness, the mind that is the nature of the collection of elements does not arise when the condition of the opposing factor, the antidote, exists.

original: byed rgyu gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na ni skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the causal conditions of form, light, space, attention, and so on exist, it arises.

original: 'di las sna tshogs skyes la sogs //
analyzed: 'di las sna tshogs skyes la sogs //
translated: From this, the various things arise.

original: btags pa mi 'dod rdzas med phyir //
analyzed: btags pa mi 'dod rdzas med phyir //
translated: We do not accept that they are imputed because they do not exist substantially.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa 'di las rnam par smin pa dang / ngar sems pa dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag gi sna tshogs skye ba la sogs par btags pa ltar ni kho bo cag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa 'di las rnam par smin pa dang / ngar sems pa dang / rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag gi sna tshogs skye ba la sogs par btags pa ltar ni kho bo cag mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, we do not accept that these three‚Äîmaturation, self-awareness, and consciousness‚Äîare the various designations of the transformation of your consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mind does not substantially exist.

original: 'di ltar sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las de dag tu gdags par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las de dag tu gdags par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, we do not assert that they are designated from the specific states of mind.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de la dmigs pas mi 'grol te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la dmigs pas mi 'grol te //
translated: It is not liberation because it is not observed.

original: blo 'gag med pa'ang ma yin pas //üîΩde phyir kun rdzob don dam du'ang //
analyzed: blo 'gag med pa'ang ma yin pas // de phyir kun rdzob don dam du'ang //
translated: It is not the unceasing mind.üîΩTherefore, it is not like the proponents of a real self

original: bdag tu smra dang 'dra mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag tu smra dang 'dra mi 'gyur //
translated: in terms of the conventional or the ultimate.

original: zhes pa la de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems snang ba tsam nyid du rtogs pas so //üîΩmi 'grol te zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rgyun las so //
analyzed: zhes pa la de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems snang ba tsam nyid du rtogs pas so // mi 'grol te zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rgyun las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not observed‚Äù means that it is not observed as the mere appearance of one‚Äôs mind.

original: blo 'gag med pa'ang ma yin pas //
analyzed: blo 'gag med pa'ang ma yin pas //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not liberation‚Äù means that it is not liberation from the continuum of existence.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not the unceasing mind.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: blo 'gag par 'gyur ba'ang yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: blo 'gag par 'gyur ba'ang yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The mind is stopped, but it is not the case that it does not exist.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir kho bo cag sems rdzas su yod pa ma yin zhing 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin par smra ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam par yang bdag tu smra ba dang 'dra ba nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir kho bo cag sems rdzas su yod pa ma yin zhing 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin par smra ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam par yang bdag tu smra ba dang 'dra ba nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the mind is understood to be the non-establishment of the nature of entities, and because it is not conceptualized as the foundation consciousness.üîΩTherefore, we who advocate that the mind does not substantially exist and is the nature of a collection do not become like the proponents of a self in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de las bzlog pas khyed sems tsam du smra ba dag la ni skyon de dag 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas khyed sems tsam du smra ba dag la ni skyon de dag 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But the opposite is the case for you who advocate mind only.üîΩYou say:

original: khyed kyis / dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas //
analyzed: khyed kyis / dmigs pa la ni brten byas nas //
translated: Dependent on the object,

original: @213b mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: @213b mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: Non-apprehension arises.

original: mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la brten byas nas //
translated: Dependent on non-apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: Non-apprehension arises.

original: zhes gang smras pa de la yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa goms par byas pa nyid gzhan du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa goms par byas pa nyid gzhan du mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that the cultivation of nonapprehension is something other than that.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzugs la sogs pa stong pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa stong pa ste //
translated: Form and so on are empty,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes phyir //
translated: because they are not inherently arisen,

original: rdzas su med phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas su med phyir 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: because they do not substantially exist,üîΩbecause they disintegrate,

original: sgyu ma bzhin goms chags med 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin goms chags med 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: like illusions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba las byung ba yod pa kho na yin pa rnams ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rgyu dang rkyen du snang ba las byung ba yod pa kho na yin pa rnams ni stong pa ste /
translated: Form and so on, external objects that arise from causes and conditions, are empty because they do not exist in the collection of causes and conditions and they are not inherently arisen.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang / yun ring du mi gnas pas 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pas rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang / yun ring du mi gnas pas 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the nature of a collection, they do not substantially exist and because they do not remain for a long time, they disintegrate.

original: dper na sgyu ma bzhin du dmigs su med par goms par byas pas chags pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma bzhin du dmigs su med par goms par byas pas chags pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Like illusions, they are cultivated as unapprehended, and thus they are not objects of attachment.

original: phyi rol gyi yul rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that external objects do not exist in any way.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang ni //
translated: Even though form and so on exist,

original: yang dag ji bzhin rtogs gyur pa //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin rtogs gyur pa //
translated: when one realizes

original: de yod ma yin de yi tshe //
analyzed: de yod ma yin de yi tshe //
translated: that they do not exist in reality,

original: log 'dzin ci phyir mi ldog 'gyur //
analyzed: log 'dzin ci phyir mi ldog 'gyur //
translated: why would one not turn away from grasping them as real?

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na sngar sgyu ma byung ba las skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par btags pa la phyis 'di ni sgyu ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na sngar sgyu ma byung ba las skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par btags pa la phyis 'di ni sgyu ma byas pa yin te /
translated: For example, previously, when a magician‚Äôs illusions occur, one imputes the existence of the essence of the person. Later, when one realizes that ‚ÄúThis is created by magic;

original: 'di la ngo bo nyid ci yang med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'di la ngo bo nyid ci yang med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i tshe na /
translated: there is no essence at all here,‚Äù

original: skyes bu'i blo ldog par rigs kyi ri bong gi rva sngon dang phyis kyang gtan med pa la ni de lta bur 'gyur ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i blo ldog par rigs kyi ri bong gi rva sngon dang phyis kyang gtan med pa la ni de lta bur 'gyur ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that the mind turns away from the person. But it is unreasonable that it would be like this with respect to the horns of a rabbit, which are utterly nonexistent before and after.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang kun rdzob kyi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no snyam du btags pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang kun rdzob kyi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no snyam du btags pa la /
translated: Similarly, even though form and so on exist, when one realizes through conventional cognition that ‚Äúthese forms and so on are imputed to exist by nature,‚Äù

original: phyi ma yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par gyur pas ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par shes pa de'i tshe log par 'dzin pa ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi ma yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par gyur pas ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par shes pa de'i tshe log par 'dzin pa ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the subsequent correct realization that the nature of the latter is not an entity exists, why would the apprehension of the opposite not be reversed?

original: ldog pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin pas khyed kyis so so'i skye bo de nyid shes pa ma skyes pa dag la dang po kho nar gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul med par btags pas don ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldog pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin pas khyed kyis so so'i skye bo de nyid shes pa ma skyes pa dag la dang po kho nar gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul med par btags pas don ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Since it definitely would be reversed, what would be accomplished by your teaching that very ordinary being who has not generated the knowledge of reality that form and so on are external objects that do not exist from the beginning?

original: de bzhin du /üîΩgnyis su rnam par rtog pa dag / sems dang sems byung @214a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gnyis su rnam par rtog pa dag / sems dang sems byung @214a * //
translated: Similarly,üîΩThe conception of duality

original: spyod yul na //
analyzed: spyod yul na //
translated: Is the sphere of activity of mind and mental factors.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dgag byas kyang //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dgag byas kyang //
translated: Although form and so on are refuted,

original: 'jug par mi 'gyur mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'jug par mi 'gyur mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that they do not engage them.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa gang dag yin pa de dag khyed sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul yin par 'dod cing gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams dang 'brel ba yin par mi 'dod na
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa gang dag yin pa de dag khyed sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul yin par 'dod cing gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams dang 'brel ba yin par mi 'dod na
translated: You assert that the two conceptions of object and apprehender are the objects of mind and mental factors, but you do not assert that they are related to external objects such as form.

original: / de la khyed kyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa byas kyang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa de dag 'jug par mi 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: / de la khyed kyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa byas kyang gnyis su rnam par rtog pa de dag 'jug par mi 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: Even though you completely refute external objects such as form, it is illogical that these two conceptions do not engage their objects.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'jug par 'gyur ba kho nar rigs te /
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ba kho nar rigs te /
translated: It is logical that they do engage their objects,

original: sngon dang phyis kyang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams la mi ltos par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis kyang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams la mi ltos par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from those that previously and later do not rely on external objects such as form.

original: gal te 'di skad ces gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams dang ma 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po dag spang ba kho na'i phyir kho bo cag gis rnam grangs gzhan gyis phyi rol gyi yul rnams rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin parüîΩrnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams dang ma 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis po dag spang ba kho na'i phyir kho bo cag gis rnam grangs gzhan gyis phyi rol gyi yul rnams rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúWe posit that external objects such as form are aspects of consciousness in another way, in order to eliminate the two misconceptions that external objects do not exist and that consciousness does not exist.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa na rang dang gzhan du snang ba'i cha bsal bas yul de dang de la 'dzin pa dag 'gag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa na rang dang gzhan du snang ba'i cha bsal bas yul de dang de la 'dzin pa dag 'gag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And later, when nonconceptual wisdom arises, the appearance of self and other is eliminated, and the conceptions of those objects cease.‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te de ni dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te de ni dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: To explain this, the text says:üîΩIf you assert that you accept another proof

original: sgrub gzhan yongs su 'dzin 'dod na //
analyzed: sgrub gzhan yongs su 'dzin 'dod na //
translated: In order to refute that,

original: 'dam rdzab 'khru bar byed pa bas //
analyzed: 'dam rdzab 'khru bar byed pa bas //
translated: It is like trying to wash mud off with mud;

original: ma reg par ni bsrings na bzang //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gal te khyed snying nas phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ma reg par ni bsrings na bzang // zhes bya ba ni gal te khyed snying nas phyi rol gyi yul med par 'dod na ni /
translated: It is better to leave it as it is.

original: de rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par btags pas kyang ci bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par btags pas kyang ci bya ste /
translated: If you assert that external objects do not exist, what is the point of positing that they are aspects of consciousness?

original: gal te de rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par rnam par bzhag nas phyis de dgag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par sgrub pa gzhan yongs su 'dzin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te de rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par rnam par bzhag nas phyis de dgag pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid yin par sgrub pa gzhan yongs su 'dzin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you posit that the aspect is a part of consciousness and then later you accept another proof that the aspect is a part of consciousness in order to refute the aspect,

original: des na / 'dam rdzab 'khru bar byed pa bas //
analyzed: des na / 'dam rdzab 'khru bar byed pa bas //
translated: then the following example would be similar to your own position:üîΩIt is better to keep your distanceüîΩfrom a muddy swamp

original: ma reg par ni bsrings pa bzang //
analyzed: ma reg par ni bsrings pa bzang //
translated: without getting wet.

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di don mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di don mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: This is the meaning of the example.

original: mi smyon pa blun po 'ga' zhig gis lam gtsang ma bor te /üîΩmi gtsang ba'i 'dam rdzab kyi klung du zhugs pa na gzhan dag gis de la dris pa /
analyzed: mi smyon pa blun po 'ga' zhig gis lam gtsang ma bor te / mi gtsang ba'i 'dam rdzab kyi klung du zhugs pa na gzhan dag gis de la dris pa /
translated: Some foolish, insane person abandons a clean roadüîΩand enters a swampy, muddy river.

original: ci'i phyir khyod lam bor te 'dam rdzab tu zhugs /üîΩdes smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod lam bor te 'dam rdzab tu zhugs / des smras pa /
translated: Others ask him, ‚ÄúWhy did you abandon the road and enter the swamp?‚Äù

original: yang bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang bkru bar bya'o //
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúI will wash here.‚Äù

original: gzhan @214b gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan @214b gyis smras pa /
translated: Others say,

original: glen pa gal te gdon mi za bar bkru bar bya dgos na snga nas 'dam rdzab kyis ma reg pa thag bsrings na ches bzang ngo zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glen pa gal te gdon mi za bar bkru bar bya dgos na snga nas 'dam rdzab kyis ma reg pa thag bsrings na ches bzang ngo zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFool, if you must wash, it would be better to keep your distance from the swamp and not get wet.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang khyed kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra zhing 'di skad ces kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid na mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra zhing 'di skad ces kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid na mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, you say that the imagined nature is identity-unreality, and you say that the imagined nature is identity-unreality because it is imagined, just as the imagined reality of a snake is in a rope.

original: kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir thag pa la sbrul gyi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa bzhin zhes gang smras pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir thag pa la sbrul gyi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa bzhin zhes gang smras pa de dag la yang /
translated: But in regard to that,

original: kun brtags yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: kun brtags yod pa ma yin te //
translated: The imagined does not exist,

original: brtags phyir sbrul dang 'drar mi 'dod //
analyzed: brtags phyir sbrul dang 'drar mi 'dod //
translated: Because it is imagined, it is not considered to be like a snake.

original: thag pa'i dngos por ma nges phyir //
analyzed: thag pa'i dngos por ma nges phyir //
translated: Because it is not ascertained as the reality of the rope,

original: yang na grags pa gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na grags pa gnod par 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, what is well known would be undermined.

original: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ci re zhig sprul bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ci re zhig sprul bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: This is the critique. Because it is imagined, is it the case that the imagined nature is identity-unreality, like a magical creation?

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir thag pa'i dngos po bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir thag pa'i dngos po bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because it is the object of a conceptual consciousness, like the entity of a rope, it is not definite that the imagined nature is a characteristic that exists.

original: gal te thag par yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thag par yang rang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it does not exist as its own nature even in a rope,

original: de lta na grags pas gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na grags pas gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be undermined by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na chu dang thag pa dang rgyu dang lag pa dang mi'i rtsol bas bkal ba'i thag pa yod pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na chu dang thag pa dang rgyu dang lag pa dang mi'i rtsol bas bkal ba'i thag pa yod pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the world, a rope that is coiled by water, a rope, a cause, a hand, and human effort is commonly acknowledged to exist.

original: don de nyid bsnan te sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bsnan te sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that very point, he says:

original: de ni 'khrul min gang gi phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul min gang gi phyir //
translated: It is not an error because

original: du ma'i cha de mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i cha de mthong phyir ro //
translated: it is seen to have many parts.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni pha rol po dag gis brtags pa ltar gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni pha rol po dag gis brtags pa ltar gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The imagined nature is not an error that is one, as imagined by others.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thag pa la sprul du mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de la du ma'i cha yod pa de mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thag pa la sprul du mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de la du ma'i cha yod pa de mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The example of a rope seen as a snake has many parts, and it is seen that way.

original: sngon 'khrul bas thag pa la 'di ni sprul yin no snyam du nges pa la legs par brtags na 'di ni thag pa yin gyis /
analyzed: sngon 'khrul bas thag pa la 'di ni sprul yin no snyam du nges pa la legs par brtags na 'di ni thag pa yin gyis /
translated: When one is previously confused and thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a snake,‚Äù if one examines it well, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a rope; it is not a snake.‚Äù

original: sbrul ma yin no snyam du thag pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa nyid la dmigs pa'i blo skyes pa na des sprul gyi cha btang ste /
analyzed: sbrul ma yin no snyam du thag pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa nyid la dmigs pa'i blo skyes pa na des sprul gyi cha btang ste /
translated: When the mind that observes the rope‚Äôs own nature arises, it abandons the aspect of the snake.

original: thag pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i cha mthong ba'i phyir dpe la 'khrul pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid kyi cha gnyi ga yod pas gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thag pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i cha mthong ba'i phyir dpe la 'khrul pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin nyid kyi cha gnyi ga yod pas gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the rope‚Äôs own nature is seen, both the aspect of error and the aspect of reality exist in the example. Therefore it is not just error.

original: des mtshon pa'i don kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang @215a * //
analyzed: des mtshon pa'i don kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang @215a * //
translated: The meaning illustrated by that example, the imagined nature,

original: gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig tu 'khrul pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: is not just error.

original: khyod ni kun brtags pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du 'khrul ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod ni kun brtags pa'i don rnam pa thams cad du 'khrul ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you assert that the imagined object is completely mistaken.

original: skyon chen po 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon chen po 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: This is a great fault.

original: khyod ni dngos la skur 'debs 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod ni dngos la skur 'debs 'gyur //
translated: You would be deprecating real things.

original: rnam pa kun du yul 'gog phyir ;üîΩ/ gal te sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po so so rang gis rig par bya ba de lta bu cung zhig yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du yul 'gog phyir ; / gal te sgra ji bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po so so rang gis rig par bya ba de lta bu cung zhig yod do zhe na /
translated: Because you deny objects in every way.

original: de lta na yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal te /
translated: If you say that there is some object that is not a literal reality, but is to be known by individual self-awareness, then even in that case, you would contradict the presentation of conventional reality.

original: mdo sde las kun rdzob kyi chos med par don dam rtogs par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mdo sde las kun rdzob kyi chos med par don dam rtogs par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because a sutra declares, ‚ÄúWithout conventional reality, the ultimate cannot be realized.‚Äù

original: / ci ste 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi yul med pa yin yang ming dang brda las don gyi mtshan ma la rtog pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar sems na /
analyzed: / ci ste 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi yul med pa yin yang ming dang brda las don gyi mtshan ma la rtog pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar sems na /
translated: If you think that even though there are no external objects, the signs of objects arise from the conception of names and signs,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: de med par yang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: de med par yang kun nyon mongs //
translated: Even without them, there is affliction.

original: ming la don 'jug las 'byung min //
analyzed: ming la don 'jug las 'byung min //
translated: The name does not arise from the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro yang //
analyzed: smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro yang //
translated: Because even animals, who do not know how to speak,

original: nyon mongs skye ba mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs skye ba mthong phyir ro //
translated: are seen to generate the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig dang ming dang brda smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro ri dags dang bya la sogs pa dag la yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa shas chen po skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig dang ming dang brda smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro ri dags dang bya la sogs pa dag la yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa shas chen po skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ;
translated: Even animals, such as deer and birds, who do not know how to speak, who do not know letters, definitions, names, and conventional expressions, are seen to generate the great afflictions, such as desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: gang dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul dag yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul dag yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that external objects, such as form, which are the basis for the generation of the afflictions, do exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgzugs la dmigs pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni yul yang dag par yod do snyam du rnam par brtags nas /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gzugs la dmigs pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni yul yang dag par yod do snyam du rnam par brtags nas /
translated: Here, the opponent says:üîΩThe cognition that perceives form arises in dependence on the name.

original: gzugs zhes mngon par brjod pa la ltos pa dang bcas bar skye'i /
analyzed: gzugs zhes mngon par brjod pa la ltos pa dang bcas bar skye'i /
translated: It arises in dependence on the expression ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: mngon par brjod pa med par mi skye bas /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa med par mi skye bas /
translated: Because it does not arise without verbalization.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong la /
translated: Therefore, the entityness of form and so on is empty.

original: mngon par brjod pa tsam la ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa tsam la ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: But form and so on are said to be mere verbalizations.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bos stong /üîΩgzugs zhes brjod la ltos bcas par //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bos stong / gzugs zhes brjod la ltos bcas par //
translated: Form is empty of the entityness of form.

original: gzugs blo skye bar 'gyur phyir zhes //
analyzed: gzugs blo skye bar 'gyur phyir zhes //
translated: The cognition of form arises in dependence on the verbalization ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: brtags par bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags par bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to assert that form is imputed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro dag la yang zas la sogs pa'i blo skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang / gzugs ni @215b stong nyid mi rigs te //
analyzed: smra mi shes pa'i dud 'gro dag la yang zas la sogs pa'i blo skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang / gzugs ni @215b stong nyid mi rigs te //
translated: Because we see that even animals, who do not know how to speak, have the cognition of food and so on.üîΩMoreover:üîΩIt is illogical that form is emptiness.

original: gzugs min bdag nyid rnam bcas pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs min bdag nyid rnam bcas pa'i //
translated: Because the entity of form exists,

original: dngos por snang blo spyod yul gyi //üîΩgzugs kyi bdag nyid de yod phyir //
analyzed: dngos por snang blo spyod yul gyi // gzugs kyi bdag nyid de yod phyir //
translated: which is the domain of the cognitionüîΩthat perceives the entity of form.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam la gzugs zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam la gzugs zhes bya zhing /
translated: This is a mere verbalization that is called ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid ces bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that form is emptiness in every way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa'i dngos por snang ba'i blo'i spyod yul gyi gzugs kyi bdag nyid de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa'i dngos por snang ba'i blo'i spyod yul gyi gzugs kyi bdag nyid de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of form that is the object of the cognition that appears as a thing that is the exclusion of a non-form nature exists.

original: de la gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs las gzhan pa ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúnon-form‚Äù means other than form.

original: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag go //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg pa dag go //
translated: It is sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs ma yin pa de dag gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs ma yin pa de dag gi bdag nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of a non-form‚Äù means the nature of those that are not form.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i yul zin pa dang zin pa ma yin pa dag la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i yul zin pa dang zin pa ma yin pa dag la sogs pa dag go //
translated: They are the objects of the ear and so on, both those that are contacted and those that are not.

original: rnam par bcad pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid de dag las rnam par bcad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid de dag las rnam par bcad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExclusion‚Äù means the exclusion of those that are not form from that non-form nature.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is a different characteristic.

original: de'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat thing‚Äù is the object of the eye.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of color and shape.

original: der snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: der snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAppearance‚Äù means appearing in that way.

original: blo'i zhes bya ba ni der snang ba'i blo de'i'o //
analyzed: blo'i zhes bya ba ni der snang ba'i blo de'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the mind‚Äù means of the mind that appears as that.

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs te /üîΩspyod pa zhes bya ba dbang po de /
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs te / spyod pa zhes bya ba dbang po de /
translated: ‚ÄúObject‚Äù means form.üîΩ‚ÄúDomain‚Äù means the sense faculty.

original: yul zhes bya ba gzugs de la spyod cing 'jug pas spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba gzugs de la spyod cing 'jug pas spyod yul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúObject‚Äù means form, because the sense faculty engages and operates with regard to that form.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyi blo la snang ba brjod du med pa de kun rdzob tu yod de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid mngon sum gyi blo la snang ba brjod du med pa de kun rdzob tu yod de /
translated: The appearance in the mind that perceives the nature of form in that way is inexpressible, but it exists conventionally.

original: de yod pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon par brjod pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon par brjod pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Because it exists, how could it be that it is merely nominal?

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be reasonable to say that form is empty in every respect?

original: gal te dngos po'i spyi ni mngon par brjod pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i spyi ni mngon par brjod pa'i yul yin la /
translated: If the universal of an entity is the domain of nominal expressions,

original: de yang mngon par brjod pa de nyid kyis stong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mngon par brjod pa de nyid kyis stong ngo zhe na /
translated: and that is empty of just those nominal expressions,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then in response to that, it is explained:

original: mngon par brjod bya spyi yin na //
analyzed: mngon par brjod bya spyi yin na //
translated: If the universal is the object of nominal expressions,

original: spyi ni ci yang yod min pas //
analyzed: spyi ni ci yang yod min pas //
translated: since the universal does not exist at all,

original: des na mngon brjod bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: des na mngon brjod bdag nyid kyis //
translated: the nominal expression is empty of itself.

original: stong pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Emptiness would not be tenable.

original: zhes bya ba la khyed cag mngon par brjod par bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la khyed cag mngon par brjod par bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: In this regard, you assert that the object of expression is a universal,

original: spyi ni dper na ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang sel ba ni ba lang gi spyi yin no zhes bya ba lta bur 'dod na /
analyzed: spyi ni dper na ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang sel ba ni ba lang gi spyi yin no zhes bya ba lta bur 'dod na /
translated: and that a universal is, for example, the cow that is excluded from other things, such as horses that are not cows.

original: gzhan sel ba'i spyi ni ci yang yod pa ma yin pas de ni dngos por gyur pa ma yin no //üîΩdngos @216a * //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i spyi ni ci yang yod pa ma yin pas de ni dngos por gyur pa ma yin no // dngos @216a * //
translated: But since a universal that is an exclusion of other does not exist at all, it is not a thing.

original: po med na ci zhig mngon par brjod par bya /
analyzed: po med na ci zhig mngon par brjod par bya /
translated: If it is not a thing, what is the object of expression?

original: mngon par brjod par bya ba med na mngon par brjod par bya ba med pas des na mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba de 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod par bya ba med na mngon par brjod par bya ba med pas des na mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid ces bya ba de 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no object of expression, then the expression ‚Äúemptiness of the self of expression‚Äù would not be tenable.

original: 'o na spyi gang zhig mngon par brjod par bya ba nyid yin par rigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na spyi gang zhig mngon par brjod par bya ba nyid yin par rigs she na /
translated: Well, then, what kind of universal is suitable to be the object of expression?

original: de'i phyir / brjod bya spyi ldan dngos po ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir / brjod bya spyi ldan dngos po ste //
translated: Therefore it says: A thing possesses a universal that is the object of expression,

original: der snang blo yi rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: der snang blo yi rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition that appears as that.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yod pas //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yod pas //
translated: because it exists as the identity of that.

original: brjod med nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: brjod med nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is inexpressible.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: mngon par brjod par bya ba'i spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: mngon par brjod par bya ba'i spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: An entity that possesses a universal that is the referent of verbalization

original: gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par la ma ltos par gzugs nyid kyi spyi yod pa de ni spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par la ma ltos par gzugs nyid kyi spyi yod pa de ni spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: is an entity that possesses a universal, because it exists as the identity of that form that possesses a universal,

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang / ring po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang / ring po la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as blue, etc., and long, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: der snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition that appears as that.

original: de ni spyi dang ldan pa'i gzugs de'i bdag nyid du yod pas mngon par brjod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ji ltar brjod du med pa nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: de ni spyi dang ldan pa'i gzugs de'i bdag nyid du yod pas mngon par brjod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ji ltar brjod du med pa nyid du rigs te /
translated: Because it exists as the identity of that form that possesses a universal, it is the referent of verbalization. Therefore, how could it be reasonable that it is inexpressible?

original: brjod du med pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is inexpressible.

original: gal te spyi zhes bya ba de gzhan sel ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi zhes bya ba de gzhan sel ba ma yin na /
translated: If that which is called a universal is not an other-exclusion,

original: 'o na spyi zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na spyi zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is this so-called universal?

original: de'i phyir / rigs mi mthun pas stong nyid de //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rigs mi mthun pas stong nyid de //
translated: Therefore: It is the emptiness of that which is not of the same type.

original: blo mthun 'jug pa'i rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: blo mthun 'jug pa'i rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition of sameness.

original: rigs mthun pa la mthun pas na //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la mthun pas na //
translated: Since it is the same in the case of things of the same class,

original: spyi zhes bya bar nges pa yin //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya bar nges pa yin //
translated: it is ascertained to be the universal.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni dper na rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ni ba lang gi spyi yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni dper na rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ni ba lang gi spyi yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The universal is, for example, the cow-universal, which is the emptiness of the non-homogeneity of horses, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni ba lang du blo mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ba lang du blo mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition of sameness in regard to cows.

original: de yang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /üîΩrigs mthun pa lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa dang / rva dang ldan pa 'dus pa'am tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir / rigs mthun pa lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa dang / rva dang ldan pa 'dus pa'am tha dad pa'am /
translated: And that is the intrinsic reality of things,

original: sngon po dang / ser po la sogs par bcad pas tha dad pa la yang spyi mthun pa'i rnam pa mthun pas na /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po la sogs par bcad pas tha dad pa la yang spyi mthun pa'i rnam pa mthun pas na /
translated: whether they are collected or not, whether they are homogeneous, whether they have a dewlap, a tail, a hump, hooves, or horns, or whether they are differentiated by the exclusion of blue, yellow, etc.üîΩSince it is the same in the case of things of the same class,

original: dbu ma smra ba dag gis spyi zhes bya ba yin par nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba dag gis spyi zhes bya ba yin par nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: it is ascertained to be the universal by the Madhyamikas.

original: gal te ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid la /
analyzed: gal te ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid la /
translated: If the nature of a cow were empty of the nature of a non-cow,

original: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i chos su btags na ni /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i chos su btags na ni /
translated: then the mere collection of the properties of a dewlap and so on would be designated as a cow.

original: des na lkog shal la sogs pa ma bzung bar yang ba lang du bzung ba yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na lkog shal la sogs pa ma bzung bar yang ba lang du bzung ba yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, even without apprehending a dewlap and so on, a cow would be apprehended,

original: dper na @216b gzugs la sogs pa ma bzung ba yod par 'gyur ba lta bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na @216b gzugs la sogs pa ma bzung ba yod par 'gyur ba lta bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: just as it would follow that form and so on would exist without being apprehended.

original: dbu ma pa la rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa stong pa nyid kyi ba lang gi ngo bo nyid la spyir 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: dbu ma pa la rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa stong pa nyid kyi ba lang gi ngo bo nyid la spyir 'dod pa la ni /
translated: For the MƒÅdhyamika, who asserts that a horse and so on is empty of a different nature, the nature of a cow,

original: gzhi ma bzung na gzung med de //
analyzed: gzhi ma bzung na gzung med de //
translated: if the basis is not apprehended, it is not apprehended.

original: de bzung gzung du yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzung gzung du yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because if it is apprehended, it is apprehended.

original: grangs bzhin brten na dngos de ni //
analyzed: grangs bzhin brten na dngos de ni //
translated: If it is supported in accordance with the number, that entity

original: brtag bya brjod par 'dod gzhan min //
analyzed: brtag bya brjod par 'dod gzhan min //
translated: is not a different object of expression that is to be imagined.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is what it would become.

original: rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don ni rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid kyi ba lang gi ngo bo nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don ni rta la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid kyi ba lang gi ngo bo nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod do //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúemptiness of what is dissimilar‚Äù is as follows: the nature of an ox, which is empty of what is dissimilar to it, such as a horse, does exist, for it possesses a dewlap and so on.

original: de ni lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i gzhi ma bzung na gzung du med de /
analyzed: de ni lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i gzhi ma bzung na gzung du med de /
translated: If one does not apprehend the basis that is the collection of the dewlap and so on, one does not apprehend it.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it apprehended?

original: gzhi bzung na gzung du yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhi bzung na gzung du yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is apprehended when its basis is apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhi de bzung na ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de yang gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi de bzung na ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi de yang gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when its basis is apprehended, the universal of ox and so on is also apprehended.

original: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: For example, what is it like?

original: grangs bzhin te /
analyzed: grangs bzhin te /
translated: It is like number.

original: dper na grangs gcig nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / mang po nyid ces bya ba dag bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de bzung na /
analyzed: dper na grangs gcig nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / mang po nyid ces bya ba dag bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de bzung na /
translated: For example, when one apprehends the thing such as a pot, the so-called number one, number two, and so on are also apprehended.

original: bum pa gcig dang / bum pa gnyis dang / bum pa mang po zhes gzung du yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bum pa gcig dang / bum pa gnyis dang / bum pa mang po zhes gzung du yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: When one apprehends one pot, two pots, and so on, they are also apprehended.

original: gcig la sogs pa'i grangs dag dngos po las tha dad pa yang ma yin la dngos po ma bzung bar yang gzung du med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'i grangs dag dngos po las tha dad pa yang ma yin la dngos po ma bzung bar yang gzung du med pa de bzhin du /
translated: The number one and so on are not different from things, and they are not apprehended without apprehending things.

original: 'dir yang lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa dang 'dus pa bzung na ba lang nyid kyang gzung du yod pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa dang 'dus pa bzung na ba lang nyid kyang gzung du yod pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if you apprehend the collection of the dewlap and so on, or the collection of the parts of the dewlap and so on, then you also apprehend the ox.

original: des na spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: des na spyi zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni blo'i yul yin pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the entity called the universal is the object of the mind, it is also the object of investigation.

original: blos nges par bzung ba'i dngos po la tshig 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid brjod par bya ba yang yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: blos nges par bzung ba'i dngos po la tshig 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid brjod par bya ba yang yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: Since words are used for things that are ascertained by the mind, it is also asserted that it is the object of expression.

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba de lkog shal la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba de lkog shal la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the so-called universal is not different from the dewlap and so on.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it?

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid las tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid las tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: It is not different from the intrinsic reality of things.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dbyer med phyir na gcig pa dang // rdzas med phyir na du mar 'jug / de nyams na yang mi nyams phyir //
analyzed: dbyer med phyir na gcig pa dang // rdzas med phyir na du mar 'jug / de nyams na yang mi nyams phyir //
translated: Even when one substance is destroyed, the other does not perish.

original: gzhan la'ang de 'dod ma yin min //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang de 'dod ma yin min //
translated: But it is not accepted that the same is true of other universals.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid de ni rnam pa rnams kyi spyi yin pas dbyer med pa'i phyir na gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid de ni rnam pa rnams kyi spyi yin pas dbyer med pa'i phyir na gcig pa yin no //
translated: This is the emptiness of the dissimilar class. Because it is the universal of the aspects, it is one, because it is inseparable.

original: rdzas thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pas @217a * //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pas @217a * //
translated: Because it is included in all substances,

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir na du mar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir na du mar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: it is manifold, because it is not substantial.

original: dus gsum du 'jug pa'i rdzas thams cad la rnam par gnas pas rdzas de nyams na mi nyams pa'i phyir des na rdzas gcig nyams pa na rdzas gzhan yang de'i blo de 'jug bar 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum du 'jug pa'i rdzas thams cad la rnam par gnas pas rdzas de nyams na mi nyams pa'i phyir des na rdzas gcig nyams pa na rdzas gzhan yang de'i blo de 'jug bar 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even when one substance is destroyed, the other does not perish, because it abides in all substances that occur in the three times. Therefore, when one substance is destroyed, it is not accepted that the other is destroyed, because the cognition of that occurs in other substances.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: gzhan la yang de'i blo de 'jug par 'dod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de'i blo de 'jug par 'dod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is accepted that the cognition of that occurs in other substances.

original: de gcig pu nyid yin na ji lta bzhin du ma dag la spyi nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de gcig pu nyid yin na ji lta bzhin du ma dag la spyi nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is just that, how can it be a universal in impure things?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / sngon min autpala ma yin pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sngon min autpala ma yin pa //
translated: It is not non-blue, not non-lotus.

original: med pa'i dngos pos ma bsal bas //üîΩgzhi mthun ldan pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos pos ma bsal bas // gzhi mthun ldan pa nyid yin te //
translated: It is not excluded by the absence of a thing.üîΩIt is a common locus because

original: gnyi ga don gcig 'jug phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnyi ga don gcig 'jug phyir ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: both are engaged in the same object.

original: sngon min zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon min zhes bya ba ni dkar po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Non-blue refers to white, etc.

original: autpala ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni padma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: autpala ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni padma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Not non-lotus refers to lotus, etc.

original: sngon po ma yin pa dkar po la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos sngon po nyid yod pa ma yin la /
