analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa dkar po la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos sngon po nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Blue does not exist by the absence of a thing that is not non-blue, such as white, etc.

original: autpala ma yin pa padma la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni autpala nyid yod par gzung ngo //
analyzed: autpala ma yin pa padma la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni autpala nyid yod par gzung ngo //
translated: Lotus is apprehended as existing by the absence of a thing that is not non-lotus, such as lotus, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs ma yin pa sgra la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs ma yin pa sgra la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, here also, form does not exist by the absence of a thing that is not form, such as sound, etc.

original: ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni ba lang nyid yin par bzung ste /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa med pa'i dngos pos ni ba lang nyid yin par bzung ste /
translated: The entity that is not a non-ox, such as a horse, is not apprehended as an ox.

original: dper na sngon pos kyang autpala ma bsal la autpala las kyang sngon po ma bsal te /
analyzed: dper na sngon pos kyang autpala ma bsal la autpala las kyang sngon po ma bsal te /
translated: For example, blue does not exclude an utpala flower, and an utpala flower does not exclude blue.

original: de gnyis yon tan dang yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid du rdzas gcig la gcig gis ma bsal bar brten pas gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis yon tan dang yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid du rdzas gcig la gcig gis ma bsal bar brten pas gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: Since those two are not excluded in the same substance, which is the nature of a quality, they possess a common locus.

original: gang la gzhi mthun pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / thun mong ba yod pa de ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gzhi mthun pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / thun mong ba yod pa de ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which possesses a common locus, nondifference, and a shared property is said to possess a common locus.

original: de'i dngos po ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Its entity is the possession of a common locus.

original: 'di ltar sngon po ni sprin dang mig sman la sogs pa yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po ni sprin dang mig sman la sogs pa yang yod la /
translated: Thus blue exists in clouds, eye medicine, and so on.

original: autpala ni dmar po la sogs pa yang yod pas de gnyis ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: autpala ni dmar po la sogs pa yang yod pas de gnyis ni gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: An utpala flower exists in red and so on. Therefore those two do not possess a common locus.

original: 'di la ni sngon po dang autpala zhes bya ba gnyis rdzas kyi don gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir des na gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni sngon po dang autpala zhes bya ba gnyis rdzas kyi don gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir des na gzhi mthun pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this case, ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù are both applied to the same thing, which is the referent of the word ‚Äúsubstance.‚Äù Therefore, they are similar in having a common locus.

original: de bzhin du gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi yin no zhes bya bar bsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi yin no zhes bya bar bsams te /
translated: Similarly, the exclusion of the nature of non-form is the universal of form, etc.

original: dngos po snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po snang ba'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition that appears as an entity.

original: de'i phyir de ltar @217b rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ni spyi yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar @217b rigs mi mthun pas stong pa nyid ni spyi yin par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the emptiness of dissimilar types is established as a universal.

original: gzhan sel ba ni spyi nyid yin par mi 'thad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni spyi nyid yin par mi 'thad pa kho na ste /
translated: The exclusion of other is not tenable as a universal.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzhan sel gzhan gyi spyi ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan sel gzhan gyi spyi ma yin //
translated: The exclusion of other is not the universal of other,

original: chos gzhan yin phyir khyad par bzhin //
analyzed: chos gzhan yin phyir khyad par bzhin //
translated: because it is a different phenomenon, like a specific property.

original: lkog shal la sogs blo dbye med //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs blo dbye med //
translated: The cognition of a dewlap, etc. is not differentiated,

original: med la khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: med la khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated in the absence of a universal.

original: zhes bya ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis sel bar byed cing tha dad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis sel bar byed cing tha dad par byed pa ste /
translated: In this case, ‚Äúexclusion of other‚Äù is that which excludes and differentiates other things.

original: rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid sel ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid sel ba bzhin no //
translated: like the cow itself, which excludes the horse, etc.

original: de ni gzhan gyi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi spyi ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the universal of the other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: chos gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a different entity.

original: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: For example, how is it?

original: khyad par bzhin te /
analyzed: khyad par bzhin te /
translated: Like a distinction.üîΩFor example, a different distinction, such as the dewlap of a cow, excludes a different distinction, such as the mane of a horse, but those are not its universal.

original: dper na ba lang gi rva la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis rta'i rngog ma la sogs pa'i khyad par sel bar byed kyang de dag de'i spyi ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid selüîΩbar byed kyang /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi rva la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis rta'i rngog ma la sogs pa'i khyad par sel bar byed kyang de dag de'i spyi ma yin pa de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa rta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid sel bar byed kyang /
translated: In the same way, other non-cows, such as horses, etc., exclude cowhood,

original: de dag ba lang gi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ba lang gi spyi ma yin no //
translated: but those are not the universal of cow.

original: gzhan sel ba de lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa la sogs pa dag la blo tha dad par dbye ba med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba de lkog shal dang / mjug ma dang / nog dang / rmig pa la sogs pa dag la blo tha dad par dbye ba med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: That exclusion of other would also be undifferentiated in the dewlap, tail, hump, hoof, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan sel ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas med pa la ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas med pa la ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exclusion of other is essenceless, and there is no difference in the nonexistent.

original: med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist at all.

original: dngos ma bzung bar der 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: dngos ma bzung bar der 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because it apprehends that without apprehending a thing,

original: brtag bya brjod min yin mi 'dod //
analyzed: brtag bya brjod min yin mi 'dod //
translated: we do not assert that it is inexpressible and imperceptible.

original: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid spyi gang yin pa de dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par brjod cing dngos po med par mi brjod na ni des na blo des brtag par bya ba nyid dang / tshig gis brjod par bya ba nyid yin par rigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar gal te gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid spyi gang yin pa de dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par brjod cing dngos po med par mi brjod na ni des na blo des brtag par bya ba nyid dang / tshig gis brjod par bya ba nyid yin par rigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If you say that a universal that is the nature of an other-exclusion is the intrinsic reality of a thing and not a non-thing, then it would be logical that it is perceptible by that mind and expressible by words.

original: khyed cag dngos po ma bzung bar yang gzhan sel ba'i de 'dzin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba de dngos po las gzhan sel bar rtogs pas /
analyzed: khyed cag dngos po ma bzung bar yang gzhan sel ba'i de 'dzin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba de dngos po las gzhan sel bar rtogs pas /
translated: But you assert that it is apprehended by the mind that apprehends an other-exclusion without apprehending a thing, and you realize that other-exclusion is different from a thing.

original: brtag par bya ba dang brjod par bya ba yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba dang brjod par bya ba yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore we do not assert that it is perceptible and expressible.

original: de dag yin par sgrub par dka'o //
analyzed: de dag yin par sgrub par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to establish that they are.

original: 'dir kha cig 'di skad ces gzhan sel ba de'i sgo nas dngos po brtag par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig 'di skad ces gzhan sel ba de'i sgo nas dngos po brtag par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In this regard, someone might say, ‚ÄúIn that case, it would be the object of investigation and expression by means of the exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: de yi sgo nas gzhan brjod na //
analyzed: de yi sgo nas gzhan brjod na //
translated: If it is expressed by means of that,

original: de ni brjod bya nyid sogs nyams //
analyzed: de ni brjod bya nyid sogs nyams //
translated: then it would be undermined as the object of expression and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba de'i sgo nas spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po cig car 'dzin na @218a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba de'i sgo nas spyi dang ldan pa'i dngos po cig car 'dzin na @218a * //
translated: If a thing that possesses a universal is apprehended simultaneously by means of the exclusion of other,

original: dngos po nyid brtag par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po nyid brtag par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then it would be the object of investigation and expression.

original: gzhan sel ba'i spyi de ni brjod par bya ba nyid dang / brtag par bya ba nyid ma yin par nyams pas khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i dam bcas pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i spyi de ni brjod par bya ba nyid dang / brtag par bya ba nyid ma yin par nyams pas khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa'i dam bcas pa ma grub bo //
translated: But since the universal that is the exclusion of other would be undermined as the object of expression and the object of investigation, your thesis that it is an inference is not established.

original: gzhan yang / de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo na //üîΩdes na brjod med nyid mi rigs //üîΩde phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de ni gzhan gyi ngo bo na // des na brjod med nyid mi rigs // de phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa yi //
translated: Moreover, it would be the nature of other.üîΩTherefore it is illogical that it is inexpressible.üîΩTherefore the statements

original: tshul gyi smra ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: tshul gyi smra ba mi rigs so //
translated: of the YogƒÅcƒÅra system are illogical.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba de dngos po las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na gang dngos po las gzhan pa de la ni de bzhin du blo yang tha dad pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba de dngos po las gzhan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na gang dngos po las gzhan pa de la ni de bzhin du blo yang tha dad pa la /
translated: If the exclusion of other were a different entity from the thing, then the cognition of that thing would be different from the cognition of the other,

original: mngon bar brjod pa yang tha dad par 'gyur bas des na gzhan sel ba de brjod du med pa nyid yin par mi rigs so //üîΩde ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i tshul gyis smras pa'i gzhan sel ba spyi yin par 'dod pa la sogs pa dag ma grub pas de dag gi grub pa'i mthas brtags pa de dag ni rigs
analyzed: mngon bar brjod pa yang tha dad par 'gyur bas des na gzhan sel ba de brjod du med pa nyid yin par mi rigs so // de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i tshul gyis smras pa'i gzhan sel ba spyi yin par 'dod pa la sogs pa dag ma grub pas de dag gi grub pa'i mthas brtags pa de dag ni rigs
translated: and the verbal expressions of those two would also be different. Therefore it is illogical that the exclusion of other is inexpressible.

original: pa dang ldan pa ma yin pas mi rigs so /üîΩ// / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa ma yin pas mi rigs so / // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: Thus, because of the thorough examination by the reasonings taught above, the assertions of the YogƒÅcƒÅra school that the exclusion of other is a universal and so on are not established. Therefore the imputations of their tenets are not reasonable because they are not endowed with reasoning.

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, A Commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩkho bo cag gi tshul ni mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / kho bo cag gi tshul ni mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOur system is not unreasonable because it is not in contradiction with reasoning.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩkho bo cag ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / kho bo cag ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: How is that?

original: ming du mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: ming du mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: We maintain that things are essenceless because they are empty of the identity of names.

original: mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid de nyid ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid de nyid ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: That identity of names is itself unarisen.

original: skye ba med pa de kho na'i phyir ma 'gags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa de kho na'i phyir ma 'gags pa yang yin no //
translated: And because of the absence of arising, it is also unceased.

original: mngon bar brjod pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gang gis mngon bar brjod pa'i rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon bar brjod pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gang gis mngon bar brjod pa'i rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that thing which has the identity of names does not exist in the way it is expressed.

original: brda tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is merely a conventional symbol.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de mngon bar brjod pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur du zin na me zhes brjod pa kha tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po de mngon bar brjod pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur du zin na me zhes brjod pa kha tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if that thing were to become the domain of expression, then the expression ‚Äúfire‚Äù would be faulty, since it would burn the mouth.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩkun brtags dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de bzhin du / kun brtags dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: And similarly,üîΩThe imagined is not a thing.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa yin //
translated: The dependent is a thing.

original: zhes bya bas gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because you accept that dependent nature exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things do not intrinsically exist,

original: mngon brjod bdag nyid stong phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon brjod bdag nyid stong phyir ro //
translated: because they are empty of the nature of expressions.

original: de nyid kyis de skye med phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de skye med phyir //
translated: Because of that, they are not produced,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags @218b nyid ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags @218b nyid ;
translated: and thus they are unborn and unceasing.

original: / gang phyir mngon brjod ldan dngos ni //
analyzed: / gang phyir mngon brjod ldan dngos ni //
translated: Because things that possess expressions

original: ji ltar brjod pa de ltar med //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa de ltar med //
translated: do not exist as they are expressed,

original: de phyir chos rnams dngos med nyid //
analyzed: de phyir chos rnams dngos med nyid //
translated: therefore all things are said to be unreal.üîΩAnd so on, and so forth, you have said much,

original: ces bya la sogs mang smras dang // gzhan dbang yod pa nyid smras pa //
analyzed: ces bya la sogs mang smras dang // gzhan dbang yod pa nyid smras pa //
translated: and you have said that dependent nature exists.

original: kun rdzob tu ni grub ba sgrub //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni grub ba sgrub //
translated: You have established what is already established.

original: gal te don dam dpe med cing //
analyzed: gal te don dam dpe med cing //
translated: If you say that the ultimate is not an example,

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then your reason will be contradictory.üîΩIf you establish all of those in the relative, then you are establishing what is already established,

original: kho bo cag kyang de dag thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden ba'i tshul du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de dag thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden ba'i tshul du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we also assert that all of those exist in the manner of the relative truth.

original: gal te de don dam par sgrub na ni don dam par gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du sgrub pa la dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te de don dam par sgrub na ni don dam par gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid du sgrub pa la dpe med de /
translated: If you prove that ultimately, then there is no example for proving that the relative exists ultimately.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is empty of essential nature.

original: de bzhin nyid du mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du mngon bar brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: And the reason ‚Äúbecause of being empty of the nature of verbal expression‚Äù is contradictory,

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid du rjes su dpog bas brjod du med pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo log par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa nyid du rjes su dpog bas brjod du med pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo log par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inferred that it is empty of the nature of verbal expression, and because it is the refutation of the essencelessness of things by the existence of inexpressible things, and because it establishes the falsity of the nature of the subject.

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that our relative reality is the realitylessness of production,

original: yod par gyur pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin te /
analyzed: yod par gyur pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin te /
translated: because it is not produced from what exists, like an illusion,

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: Moreover, if you think that the meaning of the reason is not contradictory because it is empty of entityness,

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te gzhan dbang ngo bo nyid //üîΩskye ba ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te gzhan dbang ngo bo nyid // skye ba ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: here we say:üîΩIf the dependent natureüîΩarises from itself,

original: yod par gyur las ma skyes na //
analyzed: yod par gyur las ma skyes na //
translated: then since it does not arise from what is existent,

original: skye 'gag la sogs 'gal sgrub yin //
analyzed: skye 'gag la sogs 'gal sgrub yin //
translated: you affirm what is contradictory, arising and ceasing.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin te ;
translated: If you say that, then you are proving what we ourselves assert,

original: kho bo cag kyang rgyu dang rkyen ris mthun pa'i bdag nyid las skyes pa rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid las ma skyes pas ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang rgyu dang rkyen ris mthun pa'i bdag nyid las skyes pa rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid las ma skyes pas ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we also assert that that which arises from causes and conditions of a concordant type does not arise from itself and is therefore empty of entityness and does not have arising, ceasing, and so on.

original: tshul 'di ni lung dang yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni lung dang yang mi 'gal te /
translated: This method is also not contradictory to scripture.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩrkyen rnams las ni gang skyes pa //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / rkyen rnams las ni gang skyes pa //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe Muni said that whatever arises from conditions

original: de skye med par thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: de skye med par thub pas gsungs //
translated: does not arise.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: rigs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what reasoning?

original: don dam du na dngos nyid las //
analyzed: don dam du na dngos nyid las //
translated: In reality, it is in order to refute

original: de yi skye ba dgag phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yi skye ba dgag phyir ro // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the arising of that from itself.

original: gang rkyen rnams las skyes pa de ni don dam par skye ba med pa nyid yin par thub pas gsungs te /
analyzed: gang rkyen rnams las skyes pa de ni don dam par skye ba med pa nyid yin par thub pas gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the Muni has said that whatever arises from conditions does not arise in reality,

original: @219a * // rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa'i dngos po dag la de'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @219a * // rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa'i dngos po dag la de'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature is not perceived in the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: de ltar yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di skad du /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: That which arises from conditions does not arise.

original: de la skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: It does not have the nature of arising.

original: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa des stong gsungs //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa des stong gsungs //
translated: That which depends on conditions is taught to be empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One who knows emptiness is diligent.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / chos rnams yang dag nyid min phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos rnams yang dag nyid min phyir //
translated: because things are not real,

original: de dag kun rdzob blo dang 'dra //üîΩsna tshogs rang spyi'i spyod yul du //
analyzed: de dag kun rdzob blo dang 'dra // sna tshogs rang spyi'i spyod yul du //
translated: they are like the mind of the concealer.üîΩThere is no contradiction in their being

original: 'gyur ba la ni 'gal ba med //
analyzed: 'gyur ba la ni 'gal ba med //
translated: the objects of various individual and universal characteristics.

original: ces bya ba ni gang kho na'i phyir chos rnams yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa de kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang kho na'i phyir chos rnams yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa de kho na'i phyir /
translated: This is because, for the very reason that things are not reality,

original: de dag kun rdzob tu blo dang sgra sna tshogs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul sngon po la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / bum pa dang / snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba la 'gal ba med do ;
analyzed: de dag kun rdzob tu blo dang sgra sna tshogs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul sngon po la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / bum pa dang / snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur ba la 'gal ba med do ;
translated: there is no contradiction in their being the domain of various cognitions and terms, the domain of specific characteristics, and the domain of general characteristics, such as blue, form, and so on, and such things as pots and cloth.

original: / gal te dngos po rnams yang dag pa nyid yin par gyur na ni des na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho bor gyur pas blo sna tshogs dang / sgra sna tshogs kyi yul du mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: / gal te dngos po rnams yang dag pa nyid yin par gyur na ni des na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho bor gyur pas blo sna tshogs dang / sgra sna tshogs kyi yul du mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin no //
translated: If things were reality, then they would be one nature like space, and they would not be the domain of various cognitions and various terms.

original: de la gzhung lugs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung yang yod de /
analyzed: de la gzhung lugs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung yang yod de /
translated: There are also scriptures accepted in both systems.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Whatever names are used

original: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: Whatever is the name of any dharma,

original: de la de ni yod min pa //
analyzed: de la de ni yod min pa //
translated: that does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i brjod pa'i ming dang / yi ge sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid dag gis so //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis // zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i brjod pa'i ming dang / yi ge sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid dag gis so //
translated: that does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.

original: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: Whatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon bar brjod par bya ba dag gi tshig gi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon bar brjod par bya ba dag gi tshig gi brjod pa'o //
translated: Whatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,

original: de la da ni yod min pa //
analyzed: de la da ni yod min pa //
translated: that does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos de la ming du mngon par brjod pa de yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos de la ming du mngon par brjod pa de yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.

original: chos rnams ni yi ge med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams ni yi ge med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the reality of dharmas.üîΩWhatever is the name of any dharma,üîΩthat does not exist in that dharma.üîΩThat is the reality of dharmas.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi skad dang / nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs dag gis dngos po gcig kho na la rnam pa du mar mngon par brjod pa dper na chu la pa ni ya dang / aa pa dang / sa ni la dang / ni ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu brjod pa @219b de la gal te de sgra gcig gis mngon bar brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni de la sgra gzhan dag 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi skad dang / nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs dag gis dngos po gcig kho na la rnam pa du mar mngon par brjod pa dper na chu la pa ni ya dang / aa pa dang / sa ni la dang / ni ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag tu brjod pa @219b de la gal te de sgra gcig gis mngon bar brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni de la sgra gzhan dag 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, a single thing is expressed in many ways by means of various languages and etymologies. For example, water is called ‚Äúpaniya‚Äù in Sanskrit, ‚Äúap‚Äù in Pali, ‚Äúsini‚Äù in Sinhalese, ‚Äúnira‚Äù in Dravidian, and so on. If it were the case that it is the nature of a single word to express it, then other words would not apply to it,

original: sgra de dag gis mngon bar brjod par yang mi nus pa zhig na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra de dag gis mngon bar brjod par yang mi nus pa zhig na de lta ma yin no //
translated: and those words would be unable to express it. But that is not the case.

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon bar brjod du med pa de ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon bar brjod du med pa de ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: That inexpressibility is the ultimate reality of phenomena.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir ming du 'dogs pa dang / brda dag byed de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir ming du 'dogs pa dang / brda dag byed de /
translated: Conventionally, names are designated and conventional symbols are used in order to recognize it.

original: de dag gis kyang dngos po de'i khyad par las 'di ni ba lang yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang dngos po de'i khyad par las 'di ni ba lang yin gyi /
translated: They also know that this is a cow from the specific features of that thing.

original: rta dang mi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par yongs su shes par byed do //üîΩngo bo nyid de ni blo'i yul yin te /
analyzed: rta dang mi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par yongs su shes par byed do // ngo bo nyid de ni blo'i yul yin te /
translated: And they also understand it by the particular features of the thing, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a cow, not a horse or a man.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: That intrinsic reality is the object of the mind,

original: lkugs pa dang / 'on pa la sogs pa yi ge dang brda mi shes pa de dag gis kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ngo shes pa dang ba lang la sogs pas kyang dri dang mig gis rang dang gzhan gyi be'u la sogs pa ngo shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkugs pa dang / 'on pa la sogs pa yi ge dang brda mi shes pa de dag gis kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ngo shes pa dang ba lang la sogs pas kyang dri dang mig gis rang dang gzhan gyi be'u la sogs pa ngo shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even those who do not know language and signs, such as the mute and the deaf, recognize things such as pots, and even cows and so on recognize their own young and others‚Äô young by smell and sight.

original: de lta bas na don ni rnam pa thams cad du ming gis stong pa nyid yin pas des dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mngon par rjod par mi byed pa ni yu bu cag gnyi ga la yang 'dra'o //üîΩci ste rkyen byung ngo bo yis //
analyzed: de lta bas na don ni rnam pa thams cad du ming gis stong pa nyid yin pas des dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mngon par rjod par mi byed pa ni yu bu cag gnyi ga la yang 'dra'o // ci ste rkyen byung ngo bo yis //
translated: Therefore, since the object is completely empty of name, it is the same for both of us that it does not express the intrinsic reality of things.üîΩBut if you assert that things arise

original: gzhan gyi dbang las skye 'dod na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang las skye 'dod na //
translated: from the dependent through intrinsic reality,

original: sgyu bzhin yang dag nyid min pas //
analyzed: sgyu bzhin yang dag nyid min pas //
translated: since that is not real, like an illusion,

original: 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ci ste gzhan gyi dbang gi rkyen 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bos ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin // zhes bya ba ni ci ste gzhan gyi dbang gi rkyen 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bos ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: It establishes our assertion.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba yin pas don dam pa ni ma yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba yin pas don dam pa ni ma yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the dependent nature arises from the assembly of conditions, it is not ultimate because it arises from the dependent.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, we say:

original: 'o na de ltar de gzhan gyi dbang las skye bar 'dod na sgyu ma bzhin yang dag pa nyid ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid ga la yod de /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar de gzhan gyi dbang las skye bar 'dod na sgyu ma bzhin yang dag pa nyid ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid ga la yod de /
translated: If you assert that it arises from the dependent, since it is not real like an illusion, how could it have intrinsic reality?

original: de ltar na khyed kho bo cag gi 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khyed kho bo cag gi 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: In that case, you establish our assertion.

original: de ltar sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des na /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des na /
translated: Since you establish that,

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang gzung med pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang gzung med pa //
translated: The dependent is not apprehended.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that it is not intrinsically produced.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar / don dam du ni skyes pa la //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di ltar / don dam du ni skyes pa la //
translated: How is that?üîΩThus, in the ultimate,

original: log par snang ba mi rigs phyir //
analyzed: log par snang ba mi rigs phyir //
translated: It is illogical for the arisen to appear as unreal.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis gzhan gyi dbang ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis gzhan gyi dbang ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is because you say that the dependent nature is not apprehended because it is devoid of the nature of object and subject.

original: gzung du med par smras pa de yang gal te ngo bo nyid kyis skyes par gyur na ni log bar snang bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung du med par smras pa de yang gal te ngo bo nyid kyis skyes par gyur na ni log bar snang bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: If it were to arise by its own intrinsic reality, then it would be illogical for it to appear as false.

original: gang gi phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes @220a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes @220a * //
translated: Because it does not arise by its own intrinsic reality,

original: pa de kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa de kho na'i phyir te /
translated: it is just because of that.

original: de log par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would appear as false.

original: gzhan yang / gal te ji ltar snang ba ltar //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te ji ltar snang ba ltar //
translated: Moreover, if it existed in the way it appears,

original: der snang bdag nyid yod gyur na //
analyzed: der snang bdag nyid yod gyur na //
translated: then it would appear as it is.

original: ji ltar snang ba de yod phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de yod phyir //
translated: Because it exists as it appears,

original: chos rnams ji ltar sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: chos rnams ji ltar sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: phenomena would be like illusions.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po 'di dag rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid las ji ltar dbang po'i yul nyid du snang ba ltar der snang ba'i bdag nyid yod par gyur na ji ltar snang ba der yod pa'i phyir chos rnams ji ltarüîΩsgyu ma lta bu nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po 'di dag rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid las ji ltar dbang po'i yul nyid du snang ba ltar der snang ba'i bdag nyid yod par gyur na ji ltar snang ba der yod pa'i phyir chos rnams ji ltar sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they exist as they appear, how could they be like illusions?

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du snang yang de'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du snang yang de'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med de /
translated: Thus, although an illusion appears as the identity of a man, etc., its nature is not perceived.

original: sgyu ma ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni skyes bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an illusion is empty of the identity of a man, etc.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par rtogs pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //üîΩde nyid kyis de skye med phyir //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par rtogs pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no // de nyid kyis de skye med phyir //
translated: Thus, the understanding of the existence of the dependent nature is not reasonable.üîΩBecause of that, it is said:üîΩSince it is not produced, it is unborn;

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags nyid //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags nyid //
translated: Since it does not cease, it is unceasing.

original: ces gang smras pa de yang 'di ltar ches rigs par snang ste /
analyzed: ces gang smras pa de yang 'di ltar ches rigs par snang ste /
translated: This is the most reasonable explanation of the above verse.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags dang // dngos med ngo bo nyid pa'ang //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags dang // dngos med ngo bo nyid pa'ang //
translated: and also devoid of entityness.üîΩThey do not arise from existence,

original: yod pa nyid las ma skyes dang // rdzas su yod pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: yod pa nyid las ma skyes dang // rdzas su yod pa ma yin phyir //
translated: because they do not exist substantially.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'di dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'di dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa'i bdag nyid las skye ba yin gyi /
translated: These things arise from causes and conditions that are of a homogeneous nature.

original: yod pa nyid la skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid la skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise from existence,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa'i dngos po gnas pa'i dus nas ngo bo nyid du rdul phran tsam yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs tha dad pa'i dngos po gnas pa'i dus nas ngo bo nyid du rdul phran tsam yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because not even an atom‚Äôs worth of a nature is observed in the things that exist as a collection of causes and conditions, from the time they are present.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yod pa nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yod pa nyid las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they are unarisen and unceasing, devoid of entityness, and also devoid of existence.

original: dngos po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa'i bdag nyid las snang bar dmigs par snang ba gang yin pa de yang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang /
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa'i bdag nyid las snang bar dmigs par snang ba gang yin pa de yang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang /
translated: The nature of these things, their causes and conditions, and their concordant identity are observed to appear, and that which appears is earth, water, fire, wind, form, smell, taste, and tactility.üîΩ

original: reg pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas brgyad 'dus pa yin te /
translated: The nature of these things, their causes and conditions, and their own identity appear to be observed, but that appearance is the mere collection of the eight substances called earth, water, fire, wind, form, smell, taste, and texture.

original: de yang dmag dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de yang dmag dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: And that is not substantially existent, like an army, a forest, and so on. Therefore it should be understood that it is unarisen and unceasing, it is unreal, and it is essenceless.

original: 'dir gal te 'di snyam du khyed la dngos po med @220b pa'i phyir chos gdags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sems na 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir gal te 'di snyam du khyed la dngos po med @220b pa'i phyir chos gdags pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sems na 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, if you think, ‚ÄúFor you, the designation of phenomena is contradicted because things do not exist,‚Äù then in response to that, it is said:

original: gdags la skyon chags nyid med de //
analyzed: gdags la skyon chags nyid med de //
translated: There is no fault in designation.

original: rnam rig tsam du mtshungs phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam du mtshungs phyir ro //
translated: Because we are the same in being mere consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam du yang kho bo cag dang khyed du mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi rtog pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam du yang kho bo cag dang khyed du mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
translated: We are the same as you in that we are free of the concepts of self and entities connected to the self and are mere consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi don rnam par shes bas bskyed pa'i las kyis mngon bar 'dus byas pa rdzas su med pa la yang phyi nang gi chos 'dogs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rnam par shes bas bskyed pa'i las kyis mngon bar 'dus byas pa rdzas su med pa la yang phyi nang gi chos 'dogs pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la nyes pa med do //
translated: However, we do not have the faults that you attribute to us because we impute external and internal phenomena to the non-substantial karma that is generated by consciousness.

original: khyod kyi phyogs la ni spang ba dang byed yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs la ni spang ba dang byed yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But you have the faults of abandoning and creating.

original: yongs shes sogs yod gang gir 'dod //
analyzed: yongs shes sogs yod gang gir 'dod //
translated: You assert that perfect knowledge and so on exist.

original: ces bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa spang ba dang / spong bar byed pa lam skyes pa bsgom pa goms par byed pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs dag rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid du yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa spang ba dang / spong bar byed pa lam skyes pa bsgom pa goms par byed pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs dag rnam par shes pa'i cha nyid du yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the abandonment of suffering and so on, the path that creates that abandonment, and the formative predispositions that cultivate meditation exist as aspects of consciousness, then the abandonment of suffering and so on and the path that creates that abandonment would be the same.

original: ngo bo nyid la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnas 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa de gang gi yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnas 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa de gang gi yin par 'dod de /
translated: Because there is no transformation of the essence and because there is no transformation of the state, what is the essence of the dependent that is accepted as the object of the supramundane transcendent wisdom that fully understands suffering and so on?

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gang la ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gang la ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
translated: Because there is no transformation of the mundane and transcendent states, it is to be inferred that the sentence continues, ‚ÄúHow could it arise?‚Äù

original: gal te 'di skad ces 'o na khyed la yang rdzas su med pa'i phyir thar pa med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces 'o na khyed la yang rdzas su med pa'i phyir thar pa med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn that case, liberation would not exist for you because it does not exist substantially,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩde ni gang phyir rdzas med kyang //üîΩrnam rtog bral bas thar par 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / de ni gang phyir rdzas med kyang // rnam rtog bral bas thar par 'gyur //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩBecause liberation is the absence of conception,

original: rdzas yod nyid na'ang skye med phyir //
analyzed: rdzas yod nyid na'ang skye med phyir //
translated: it is liberation even though it does not exist substantially.üîΩIf it existed substantially,

original: 'di las gzhan du rtag mi 'dod //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du rtag mi 'dod //
translated: it would not be permanent in any other way.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos po rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'phags pa skye bas thar par
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos po rnams rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na yin pas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'phags pa skye bas thar par
translated: Therefore liberation is possible.

original: rigs kyi / rdzas su yod pa ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba rnams la mi rigs pas thar pa de ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams rdzas su med kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi / rdzas su yod pa ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba rnams la mi rigs pas thar pa de ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams rdzas su med kyang /
translated: But it is not possible for things that substantially exist and do not change by nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas thar par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas thar par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, although things do not substantially exist, liberation is possible because of being free from conceptualization.

original: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig @221a * //üîΩgis de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'gyur yang /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig @221a * // gis de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'gyur yang /
translated: If things were to exist substantially in some way,

original: de lta na'ang ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kho nas thar par rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na'ang ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kho nas thar par rigs so //
translated: even so, because they do not arise by their own intrinsic nature, it is logical that liberation is possible only through being free from conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'di las gzhan du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes yod par brtags pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'di las gzhan du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes yod par brtags pas ci bya ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of imagining that there is a pristine wisdom that perceives an intrinsically real reality that is other than this?üîΩPreviously, it was taught:

original: sngar yang / ngo bo nyid la dmigs yin na //
analyzed: sngar yang / ngo bo nyid la dmigs yin na //
translated: If it were an object of intrinsic reality,üîΩThe Teacher‚Äôs enlightenment would be imagined,üîΩIt would be an object, and

original: ston pa'i byang chub rtog can dang // dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba dang // rnam par mi rtog blor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ston pa'i byang chub rtog can dang // dmigs pa can du 'gyur ba dang // rnam par mi rtog blor mi 'gyur //
translated: It would not be a non-conceptual mind.

original: zhes bstan zin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bstan zin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Since this has already been taught, it is not accepted.

original: 'dir pha rol pos rang gi tshul nyes par smras pa'i gnad du bsnun pas shin tu 'khams nas gtun tshig rtsub mo smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol pos rang gi tshul nyes par smras pa'i gnad du bsnun pas shin tu 'khams nas gtun tshig rtsub mo smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent, having been severely wounded by the key point of the error in his own system, speaks very harshly:

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If things are essenceless,

original: gdags pa'ang yod par mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gdags pa'ang yod par mi 'gyur bas //
translated: Even imputation would not exist.üîΩThat view of nonexistence is not to be taught,üîΩIt is not to be discussed,üîΩIt leads to bad transmigrations,

original: de ni med phar lta ba dag / mi gleng bstan par bya min dang // rang yang ngan song gzhol ba dang // gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: de ni med phar lta ba dag / mi gleng bstan par bya min dang // rang yang ngan song gzhol ba dang // gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin //
translated: And it causes others to degenerate.üîΩThis is

original: zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: This is the explanation of the first part, the introduction.

original: / de dag na re /
analyzed: / de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: kho bo cag rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la ni phyi rol gyi yul med du zin kyang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid re zhig yod pas rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par phyi rol gyi yul yang dmigs su yod la /
analyzed: kho bo cag rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la ni phyi rol gyi yul med du zin kyang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid re zhig yod pas rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par phyi rol gyi yul yang dmigs su yod la /
translated: For us YogƒÅcƒÅras, even though external objects do not exist, consciousness alone does exist. Therefore, the transformation of consciousness, the appearance of external objects, is perceived.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba yang yod kyi /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de de bzhin gshegs pas so so rang rig par bya ba yang yod kyi /
translated: The nature of the consummate exists, and it is the domain of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äô individual self-awareness.

original: dbu ma smra ba la ni re zhig kun rdzob tu yang sgyu ma lta bu nyid du 'dogs pas 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / don dam par yang rnam par shes pa yang med la /
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba la ni re zhig kun rdzob tu yang sgyu ma lta bu nyid du 'dogs pas 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / don dam par yang rnam par shes pa yang med la /
translated: For the proponents of the Middle Way, even conventionally, things are like illusions. Therefore, they are accused of denigrating worldly phenomena and of nihilism.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba yang med pas ci yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba yang med pas ci yang med de /
translated: Ultimately, consciousness does not exist, nor does the object of consciousness. Therefore, nothing exists.

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir chos gdags pa yang yod par mi 'gyur bas de med pa'i phyir de med par lta ba nyid dang mthun pa dang / sus kyang mi gleng mi brjod pa dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa'i dngos pos brten par mi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir chos gdags pa yang yod par mi 'gyur bas de med pa'i phyir de med par lta ba nyid dang mthun pa dang / sus kyang mi gleng mi brjod pa dang / lhan cig 'grogs pa'i dngos pos brten par mi bya ba yin te /
translated: Because they deprecate things by saying that things lack entityness, the imputation of phenomena would not exist. Therefore, since they do not exist, they are similar to the view that nothing exists, no one can discuss or describe them, and they are not supported by any concomitant things.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag khyed kyis deng phyin chad 'jig rten rgyang phan pa gsang tshig sna tshogs kyi spobs pa can dang bsten par mi bya bsnyen par mi bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag khyed kyis deng phyin chad 'jig rten rgyang phan pa gsang tshig sna tshogs kyi spobs pa can dang bsten par mi bya bsnyen par mi bya /
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúMonks, from now on you should not rely on or serve the LokƒÅyatas, who are skilled in various incantations.

original: bsnyen bkur mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas khyed ni dam pa ma yin pas yongs su spang bar bya ba de'i @221b gnas su shin tu gyur pa dang / dam pa'i chos slong ba'i phyir rang yang ngan song la gzhol ba dang / lta ba 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khri la mngon par zhen pa la mos par byed pa'i phyir gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas khyed ni dam pa ma yin pas yongs su spang bar bya ba de'i @221b gnas su shin tu gyur pa dang / dam pa'i chos slong ba'i phyir rang yang ngan song la gzhol ba dang / lta ba 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khri la mngon par zhen pa la mos par byed pa'i phyir gzhan yang phung bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And since you are devoted to the crocodile of grasping views, you are also a ruin for others because you are devoted to the pursuit of your own downfall in order to obtain the holy Dharma.

original: de la slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: To this the Master replies:

original: zhe sdang sha rul sgregs pa de //
analyzed: zhe sdang sha rul sgregs pa de //
translated: Your angry words are like

original: nga rgyal ma zhu ston pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni khyod kyi khro tshig de ni dper na sha rul gyi sgregs pas ma zhu ba nyid ston par byed pa de bzhin du zhe sdang gi tshig gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid du ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: nga rgyal ma zhu ston pa yin // zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi khro tshig de ni dper na sha rul gyi sgregs pas ma zhu ba nyid ston par byed pa de bzhin du zhe sdang gi tshig gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid du ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: the belch that reveals indigestion.üîΩYour angry words are like the belch that reveals indigestion.

original: go / de la zhe sdang nyid sha rul yin te ;
analyzed: go / de la zhe sdang nyid sha rul yin te ;
translated: Your angry words are like the belch that reveals indigestion.

original: de'i sgregs pa lta bu ni khyod kyi tshig de yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgregs pa lta bu ni khyod kyi tshig de yin no //
translated: Your words are like the belch.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid ma zhu ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid ma zhu ba lta bu yin te /
translated: Arrogance is like indigestion.

original: sha rul gyi sgregs pas ma zhu ba nyid ston par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sha rul gyi sgregs pas ma zhu ba nyid ston par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the belch of rotten meat shows indigestion,

original: zhe sdang gi tshig kyang khyod nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid du ston pa yin gyi kho bo'i lta ba ni skyon ci yang med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi tshig kyang khyod nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nyid du ston pa yin gyi kho bo'i lta ba ni skyon ci yang med pa kho na yin no //
translated: so your angry words show your own arrogance, but my view is completely free of fault.

original: zhe sdang gi sha rul gyi sgregs pa des bdag nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma zhu ba nyid du ston par zad kyi /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sha rul gyi sgregs pa des bdag nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma zhu ba nyid du ston par zad kyi /
translated: That belch of rotten meat of anger shows your own indigestion of arrogance,

original: dbu ma pa la de lta bu'i skyon yang dag pa med par ji ltar nges par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dbu ma pa la de lta bu'i skyon yang dag pa med par ji ltar nges par bya zhe na /
translated: but how can you be certain that the Madhyamika has no such fault?üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / chos rnams sgyu ma bzhin 'dod de //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos rnams sgyu ma bzhin 'dod de //
translated: we assert that phenomena are like illusions,üîΩbecause they have no intrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid ni med phyir dang // byis pa rmongs pa'i rgyu phyir dang // ma byung ba las 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni med phyir dang // byis pa rmongs pa'i rgyu phyir dang // ma byung ba las 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the delusion of the childish,üîΩand because they appear from what is non-existent.

original: zhes bya ba ni kho bos dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid yin no zhes ma smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kho bos dngos po rnams rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid yin no zhes ma smras te /
translated: This is not saying that we say things do not exist in any way.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni kun rdzob tu chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa las 'byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa nyid du 'dod de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / skye bo byis pa lta bur rmongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag ni kun rdzob tu chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa las 'byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa nyid du 'dod de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / skye bo byis pa lta bur rmongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: We say that things exist conventionally, arising from causes and conditions of a concordant type, like an illusion, because they are essenceless, because they are the cause of the confusion of childish beings,üîΩand because they arise from what has not previously existed.

original: sngon ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i tshe ji ltar gdags pa yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i tshe ji ltar gdags pa yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When we say this, how could imputation not exist?

original: gdags pa yod pa kho na'i phyir kho bo la khyod kyis smras pa'i skyon gyis gnas mi thod do //
analyzed: gdags pa yod pa kho na'i phyir kho bo la khyod kyis smras pa'i skyon gyis gnas mi thod do //
translated: Because imputation exists, you cannot fault us with the error that you have stated.

original: chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis spongs ba'i phyir kho bo cag med par lta ba nyid dang mthun par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis spongs ba'i phyir kho bo cag med par lta ba nyid dang mthun par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the realitylessness of phenomena is the ultimate, and because of abandoning the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, how could we be in accord with the view of nonexistence?

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi tshig de ni zhe sdang gi sha rul gyi sgregs pa nyid yin no //üîΩkhyod kyi chos kyi de nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs @222a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi tshig de ni zhe sdang gi sha rul gyi sgregs pa nyid yin no // khyod kyi chos kyi de nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs @222a * //
translated: Therefore, your words are just the flatulence of the rotten meat of hatred.

original: pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'dod pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'dod pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Your reality of phenomena is asserted to be nonconceptual because of being like space, but that also is not correct.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rnam par mi rtog dngos po ni //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dngos po ni //
translated: A nonconceptual thing

original: mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid mi rigs //üîΩrnam rtog 'du shes sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: mkha' dang mtshungs pa nyid mi rigs // rnam rtog 'du shes sna tshogs kyi //
translated: Is not correct as being like space,üîΩBecause it is the complete opening

original: go skabs rab tu 'byed phyir ro //
analyzed: go skabs rab tu 'byed phyir ro //
translated: Of the opportunity of various conceptual discriminations.

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang sngon po dang yangs pa dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi go skabs rab tu 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang sngon po dang yangs pa dang / dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi go skabs rab tu 'byed par byed do //
translated: Even though space is endowed with nonconceptuality, it still provides the opportunity for the various discriminations of blue, yellow, long, short, pure, impure, and so on.

original: gal te chos rnams kyi de nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur na ni de yang dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi de nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar gyur na ni de yang dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thatness of phenomena were like that, then because it would be the domain of the various discriminations of pure, impure, and so on, nonconceptuality would be undermined.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod du med pa nyid yin par 'dod ces grags pa de la yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod du med pa nyid yin par 'dod ces grags pa de la yang /
translated: Moreover, it is well known that you assert the consummate nature to be inexpressible.

original: skyes pa brjod med nyid mi rigs //
analyzed: skyes pa brjod med nyid mi rigs //
translated: It is illogical for a person to be inexpressible.

original: dgag pa gong du bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gong du bstan phyir ro //
translated: Because it was refuted above.

original: brjod du med nyid yin gyur na'ang //
analyzed: brjod du med nyid yin gyur na'ang //
translated: Even if it were inexpressible,

original: kun rdzob la ni de nyid nor //
analyzed: kun rdzob la ni de nyid nor //
translated: It would be a mistake regarding reality in the conventional.

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid skyes pa la ni brjod du med pa nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid skyes pa la ni brjod du med pa nyid mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable that the nature of the perfected is inexpressible.

original: de'i dgag pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dgag pa ni /
translated: The refutation of that is:

original: brjod bya spyi ldan dngos po ste //
analyzed: brjod bya spyi ldan dngos po ste //
translated: The entity that possesses the universal of the expressible

original: der snang blo yi rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: der snang blo yi rgyu yin phyir //
translated: is the cause of the cognition that appears as that.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yod pas //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yod pas //
translated: Since it exists as the nature of that,

original: brjod med nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: brjod med nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is inexpressible.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught above.

original: ci ste yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis brjod du med pa nyid yin par gyur na yang de lta na yang de kun rdzob pa yin pas kun rdzob pa de la de nyid yin par nor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis brjod du med pa nyid yin par gyur na yang de lta na yang de kun rdzob pa yin pas kun rdzob pa de la de nyid yin par nor bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if it were inexpressible in some way, even so, since it is conventional, one should not err in regard to that conventionality as reality.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de la de nyid gzhan med phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la de nyid gzhan med phyir //
translated: Since there is no reality other than that,

original: gal te de nyid mthong 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid mthong 'dod na //
translated: if one wishes to see reality,

original: bum la'ang bum pa gzhan med pas //
analyzed: bum la'ang bum pa gzhan med pas //
translated: since there is no other pot in the pot,

original: ci phyir de nyid mthong mi 'dod //
analyzed: ci phyir de nyid mthong mi 'dod //
translated: why does one not wish to see that reality?

original: ces bya ba ni gal te don dam pa de la don dam pa'i de nyid gnyis pa gzhan med pa'i phyir gal te don dam pa stong pa nyid des de nyid mthong bar 'dod na de lta na bum pa la'ang bum pa gnyis pa gzhan med pas de
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te don dam pa de la don dam pa'i de nyid gnyis pa gzhan med pa'i phyir gal te don dam pa stong pa nyid des de nyid mthong bar 'dod na de lta na bum pa la'ang bum pa gnyis pa gzhan med pas de
translated: If you assert that the ultimate is seen by the emptiness of the ultimate, since there is no second ultimate reality, then since there is no second vase,

original: mthong bas kyang ci'i phyir don dam pa'i de nyid mthong bar brtag par mi 'dod //
analyzed: mthong bas kyang ci'i phyir don dam pa'i de nyid mthong bar brtag par mi 'dod //
translated: why don‚Äôt you assert that the vase is seen by the vase?

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rnam par mi rtog pa ni brjod du med pa nyid yin yang chos kyi @222b dbyings na chu'i khams dang / gser dang nam mkha' dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod pas de dag pas sems la yang dag pa yod pa kho nar sems na de la kho bos dgag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rnam par mi rtog pa ni brjod du med pa nyid yin yang chos kyi @222b dbyings na chu'i khams dang / gser dang nam mkha' dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod pas de dag pas sems la yang dag pa yod pa kho nar sems na de la kho bos dgag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: If you think that although the nonconceptual is inexpressible, since it is asserted that the dharmadhƒÅtu is pure like the water element, gold, and space, then if you think that since it is pure, the mind definitely exists in reality, I will explain the refutation of that.

original: khyod kyi tshul skyon sba phyir gyi //
analyzed: khyod kyi tshul skyon sba phyir gyi //
translated: Your system is to conceal faults.

original: de ni nyon mongs byang mi 'gyur //üîΩgser la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs byang mi 'gyur // gser la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: That will not purify the afflictions.üîΩBecause gold and so on

original: rjes su 'gyur ba yin phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gyur ba yin phyir ro //
translated: are transformed by conditions.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha' dag las rdul dang g-ya' dang sprin la sogs pa rkyen dag yod na dri ma dang bcas pa dag tu snang la /üîΩrkyen de dag med na dag pa dag tu snang zhing yang dri ma can du 'gyur pa dang / de nas yang dag pa dag tu 'gyur ba bzhin du gal te chos kyi dbyings kyang de kho na bzhin na lan 'ga' rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha' dag las rdul dang g-ya' dang sprin la sogs pa rkyen dag yod na dri ma dang bcas pa dag tu snang la / rkyen de dag med na dag pa dag tu snang zhing yang dri ma can du 'gyur pa dang / de nas yang dag pa dag tu 'gyur ba bzhin du gal te chos kyi dbyings kyang de kho na bzhin na lan 'ga' rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: This is like the water element, gold, and space, which appear to be contaminated when conditions such as dust, rust, and clouds are present,üîΩbut appear to be pure when those conditions are absent.üîΩIf the dharmadhatu is like that, it would sometimes be pure and sometimes impure, so this is just your attempt to hide the faults of your system.

original: lan 'ga' dri ma dang bcas par 'gyur bas de ni khyod kyi tshul gyi skyon de sba ba tsam de kho na'i phyir smras par zad kyi chos kyi dbyings de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: lan 'ga' dri ma dang bcas par 'gyur bas de ni khyod kyi tshul gyi skyon de sba ba tsam de kho na'i phyir smras par zad kyi chos kyi dbyings de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur la //
translated: But the dharmadhatu is not defiled or purified.

original: gser la sogs pa ni rkyen rnams kyi rjes su 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa ni rkyen rnams kyi rjes su 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Gold and so on change according to conditions.

original: gser la sogs pa'i dpe de dag gis chos kyi dbyings mtshon pa'i don mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i dpe de dag gis chos kyi dbyings mtshon pa'i don mi 'grub po //
translated: These examples of gold and so on do not establish the meaning of the illustration of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: 'di ltar na ni rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar na ni rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, it would be reasonable:

original: nam mkha' rtag tu rnam dag ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' rtag tu rnam dag ste //
translated: Space is always pure.

original: mig ni dag dang ma dag pas //
analyzed: mig ni dag dang ma dag pas //
translated: The eye is pure and impure.üîΩThe sky is accepted as stained and stainless,

original: dri bcas dri med mkha' 'dod dang // chos rnams chos nyid de bzhin no //
analyzed: dri bcas dri med mkha' 'dod dang // chos rnams chos nyid de bzhin no //
translated: and so it is with phenomena and dharmatƒÅ.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab rib can dbang po nyams pas nam mkha' kun du skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dra ba dag gis dkrigs pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab rib can dbang po nyams pas nam mkha' kun du skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dra ba dag gis dkrigs pa mthong zhing /
translated: Just as someone with cataracts, whose faculties are impaired, sees false webs of hair, flies, and bees covering the sky,

original: de nyid kyis kyang rab rib sel ba'i mig sman pa sten pas mig dag pas na nam mkha' skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu dang bral bar kun du mthong yang dbang po nyams pa dang nyams pas nam mkha' de ma dag pa dang dag par mthong ba'i tshe nam mkha' la ni 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la yang phyisüîΩpa blo gros kyi mig yongs su ma dag pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bcas par mthong zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang rab rib sel ba'i mig sman pa sten pas mig dag pas na nam mkha' skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang / sbrang bu dang bral bar kun du mthong yang dbang po nyams pa dang nyams pas nam mkha' de ma dag pa dang dag par mthong ba'i tshe nam mkha' la ni 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la yang phyis pa blo gros kyi mig yongs su ma dag pa rnams kyis dri ma dang bcas par mthong zhing /
translated: Similarly, those whose eyes of intelligence are completely impure see the nature of reality, which is pure by nature, as being sullied.

original: 'phags pa stong pa nyid la lta ba'i mig sman bsten pa blo gros kyi mig rnam par dag pa rnams kyis na dri ma med pa nyid @223a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa stong pa nyid la lta ba'i mig sman bsten pa blo gros kyi mig rnam par dag pa rnams kyis na dri ma med pa nyid @223a * //
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are completely pure, by relying on the eye medicine of the view of emptiness, realize it to be stainless.

original: du rtogs kyang blo dra mi dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pas chos nyid ma dag pa dang dag par mthong ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: du rtogs kyang blo dra mi dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pas chos nyid ma dag pa dang dag par mthong ba'i tshe na /
translated: When those with and without impaired vision see the nature of reality as impure and pure, respectively, the nature of reality is not altered by their perception of it as pure or impure.

original: chos nyid la ni 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid la ni 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is no change at all in reality,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: ma dag la sogs blo 'khrul te //
analyzed: ma dag la sogs blo 'khrul te //
translated: The mind is deluded about the impure and so on.

original: byed pa'i chos yin las kyi min //
analyzed: byed pa'i chos yin las kyi min //
translated: It is a phenomenon of the agent, not of karma.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ma dag pa dang dag par snang bas blo 'khrul pa de ni byed pa po lus dang dbang po rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i blo'i tshogs kyi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ma dag pa dang dag par snang bas blo 'khrul pa de ni byed pa po lus dang dbang po rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i blo'i tshogs kyi chos yin gyi /
translated: For example, the mind that is deluded by the appearance of space as impure or pure is a phenomenon of the agent, the collection of minds that are the body and the sense faculties together with consciousness.üîΩSpace is not a phenomenon of karma that is to be cognized.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnam par shes par bya ba'i las kyi chos ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma dag pa dang dag pa zhes bya ba ni yang byed pa po log pa'i shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnam par shes par bya ba'i las kyi chos ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma dag pa dang dag pa zhes bya ba ni yang byed pa po log pa'i shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, the so-called impure and pure dharmadhƒÅtu is a phenomenon of the agent, the mind that possesses distorted consciousness or correct consciousness.üîΩThe dharmadhƒÅtu is not a phenomenon that is to be cognized.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos ma yin pas khyed kyis /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos ma yin pas khyed kyis /
translated: Therefore your statement

original: de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
translated: That it is both stained and stainless

original: ces smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
