analyzed: ces smras pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: is illogical.

original: gzhan yang / de la dmigs pa dag ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de la dmigs pa dag ma yin //
translated: It is not a pure object of observation.

original: de nyid dmigs byar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs byar mi 'dod do //
translated: It is not asserted to be an object of observation.

original: zhes bya ba de ni chos kyi dbyings de la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni dag pa yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni chos kyi dbyings de la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni dag pa yin par mi rigs te /
translated: The wisdom that observes the dharmadhƒÅtu is not suitable to be pure.

original: de la dmigs na ye shes de rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs na ye shes de rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were observed, that wisdom would not be established as nonconceptual.

original: chos kyi dbyings de nyid kyang dmigs par bya ba yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de nyid kyang dmigs par bya ba yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Also, that dharmadhƒÅtu itself is not asserted to be an object of observation.

original: don dam par chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba de nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba de nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate, that which is called the dharmadhƒÅtu itself is not observed.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de nyid rdzas su yod yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de nyid rdzas su yod yin na //
translated: If it were substantially existent,

original: skyon ni snga ma bzhin du 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon ni snga ma bzhin du 'gyur //
translated: the faults would be the same as before.üîΩThe transcendent ones do not conceive it,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa rnams mi rtog / de blor mi 'dod 'jig phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa rnams mi rtog / de blor mi 'dod 'jig phyir ro //
translated: because it is not asserted to be mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de nyid rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na de la skyon /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs rnam byang las //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings de nyid rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na de la skyon / kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang las //
translated: If it is conceived that the dharmadhƒÅtu itself is substantially existent, the faultsüîΩof that are the same as before.

original: gal te sems ni rdzas 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te sems ni rdzas 'dod na //
translated: If mind is asserted to be substantial,

original: tshor sogs de bzhin skye bya'i phyir //
analyzed: tshor sogs de bzhin skye bya'i phyir //
translated: So too, feeling and so on arise.

original: de grub pas na gnod pa med //
analyzed: de grub pas na gnod pa med //
translated: Since they are established, they are not impaired.

original: ces bya ba dag 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba dag 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is also stated here in the same way as before.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi tshe na yang gang chos nyid la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa de skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi tshe na yang gang chos nyid la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa de skye'o zhe na /
translated: Even when supramundane wisdom arises, it is nonconceptual and focuses on reality.

original: de lta bu'i blo skye ba yod par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i blo skye ba yod par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that such a mind arises.

original: de skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i byir ro //
analyzed: de skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i byir ro //
translated: It is destroyed immediately after it arises.

original: des na 'jig rten pas 'das pa'i blo de ji ltar 'jig par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar @223b shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pas 'das pa'i blo de ji ltar 'jig par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar @223b shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, how could the mundane mind that is the object of supramundane wisdom be destroyed?üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / ji srid shes bya'i rjes 'jug pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ji srid shes bya'i rjes 'jug pa //
translated: As long as it follows the object of knowledge,

original: de srid blo ni rab rib can //
analyzed: de srid blo ni rab rib can //
translated: the mind is obscured.

original: gal te des skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩji srid shes pa dmigs yod pa //
analyzed: gal te des skyon cir 'gyur zhe na / ji srid shes pa dmigs yod pa //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the problem with that?‚ÄùüîΩAs long as consciousness has an object of apprehension,

original: de srid shes bya'i rjes 'jug nyid //
analyzed: de srid shes bya'i rjes 'jug nyid //
translated: it follows the object of knowledge.

original: ces bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the problem.

original: des na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i blo yang rab rib can nyid du yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i blo yang rab rib can nyid du yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the supramundane cognition that observes the consummate nature would be like someone with myodesopsia.

original: shes bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows after the consciousness of the object of cognition.

original: 'o na ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how would it be tenable?

original: blo rab dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i blo yang rab rib can nyid du ni 'khor ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: blo rab dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i blo yang rab rib can nyid du ni 'khor ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: The supramundane cognition that observes the consummate nature would be like someone with myodesopsia, and samsara would arise.

original: des gang gi tshe shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub par shes pas dmigs pa med pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: des gang gi tshe shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub par shes pas dmigs pa med pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When, through knowing the unestablished nature of the object of cognition, there is no observation,

original: 'khor bar mi 'gyur bas de ni chos rnams kyi de nyid yin par bsams so //
analyzed: 'khor bar mi 'gyur bas de ni chos rnams kyi de nyid yin par bsams so //
translated: then there is no samsara. Therefore that is the suchness of phenomena.

original: khyed rang byung gi ye shes skad cig gcig dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ltar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: khyed rang byung gi ye shes skad cig gcig dang ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ltar mi 'thad de /
translated: The instant of self-arisen gnosis that you assert is also untenable.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid cig car min //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid cig car min //
translated: Omniscience is not instantaneous.

original: shes pa rang la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa rang la 'jug pa ni //
translated: Cognition engaging itself

original: med phyir ral gri so bzhin dang // rang rig 'gog par byed phyir ro //
analyzed: med phyir ral gri so bzhin dang // rang rig 'gog par byed phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist, like the edge of a sword, and because it is refuted by autocognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar shes bya rnam pa tha dad pa du mas tha dad pa yin yang chos nyid ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa des skad cig gcig gis dbyer med pa'i sgo nas mkhyen par rung gi / gang la ye shes
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar shes bya rnam pa tha dad pa du mas tha dad pa yin yang chos nyid ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa des skad cig gcig gis dbyer med pa'i sgo nas mkhyen par rung gi / gang la ye shes
translated: Thus, although the objects of knowledge are differentiated by many aspects, because their reality is of one nature, it is possible for the Omniscient One to know them in one moment, by way of their nondifferentiation.

original: skad cig ma yin pa de la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid des shes bya rnam pa tha dad pa dag cig car yongs su mkhyen par mi rung ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa de la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid des shes bya rnam pa tha dad pa dag cig car yongs su mkhyen par mi rung ste /
translated: But for one whose gnosis is momentary, it is not possible for the Omniscient One to know simultaneously the different aspects of the objects of knowledge.

original: shes pa rang la 'jug pa 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de lta bu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa rang la 'jug pa 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de lta bu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the error of the contradiction of the engagement of consciousness in itself would ensue.

original: dper na ral gri rang gi so gang yin pa de nyid kyis de nyid la gcod par mi byed pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ral gri rang gi so gang yin pa de nyid kyis de nyid la gcod par mi byed pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the edge of a sword not cutting itself.

original: de'i phyir gal te de ye shes skad cig ma don dam par yod pa nyid yin na shes pa'i skad cig ma snga ma yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la ltos dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de ye shes skad cig ma don dam par yod pa nyid yin na shes pa'i skad cig ma snga ma yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la ltos dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if that wisdom were to exist ultimately as a moment, then in order to fully understand the previous moment of consciousness, it would have to rely on a second moment of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang chos nyid ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos nyid ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the nature of phenomena is nothing at all,

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pas rang rig pa yang 'gog par byed pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skad cig gcig dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nges par mi 'dzin pas rang rig pa yang 'gog par byed pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skad cig gcig dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: it does not apprehend the nature of things with certainty, and so it refutes reflexive awareness. Therefore it is not established that omniscience possesses a single moment.

original: kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar na de yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar na de yang 'grub ste /
translated: According to us, it is established.

original: @224a * // ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: @224a * // ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rnam par mi rtog 'phags blo'i gzung //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog 'phags blo'i gzung //
translated: It is held by the nonconceptual mind of ƒÅryas

original: rnam pa kun du brjod med nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du brjod med nyid //
translated: And is inexpressible in every way.

original: sngar bzhin skye ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar bzhin skye ba bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because arising is refuted as before,

original: skye med rdzas su yod min phyir //
analyzed: skye med rdzas su yod min phyir //
translated: Nonarising does not substantially exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa 'phags pa'i blo'i gzung ba ni 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa 'phags pa'i blo'i gzung ba ni 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gyis gzung ba yin te /
translated: The object of the nonconceptual noble mind is an object in the manner of nonapprehension.

original: sngar de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par bstan pa bzhin skye ba bkag pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa las 'byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par bstan pa bzhin skye ba bkag pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rigs mthun pa las 'byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As explained earlier in the chapter on the search for the knower of reality, because arising is refuted, there is no arising, and because it arises from causes and conditions that are concordant in type on the conventional level, it does not exist substantially.

original: de ni rnam pa kun du brjod du med pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun du brjod du med pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also completely inexpressible.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its nature is empty.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Such a nature is to be applied to the ultimate.

original: gzhan yang khyed 'dod pa ltar //üîΩyod dang med pa'i dngos nyid kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed 'dod pa ltar // yod dang med pa'i dngos nyid kyi //
translated: Moreover, according to youüîΩIf the nature of existent and nonexistent things

original: ngo bo don dam nyid yin na //üîΩsgro 'dogs pa dang skur mtha' las //
analyzed: ngo bo don dam nyid yin na // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur mtha' las //
translated: were the ultimate,üîΩhow could you be free

original: grol ba khyod la ji ltar yod //
analyzed: grol ba khyod la ji ltar yod //
translated: from the extremes of superimposition and denial?

original: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis las grol bar 'dod pas ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na khyod ni yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po nyid kyi ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don dam
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'di ltar sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis las grol bar 'dod pas ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin na khyod ni yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po nyid kyi ngo bo ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don dam
translated: Thus, if you assert freedom from the two extremes of superimposition and denial, you must completely abandon the two extremes of existence and nonexistence. But since you assert that the nature of things that exist and do not exist is the ultimate, which is the nature of the consummate,

original: pa nyid yin par 'dod pas de la yod pa nyid yin na sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' las mi 'grol la med pa nyid yin na skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las mi 'grol bas mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir grol ba khyod la ji ltar yod /
analyzed: pa nyid yin par 'dod pas de la yod pa nyid yin na sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' las mi 'grol la med pa nyid yin na skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las mi 'grol bas mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir grol ba khyod la ji ltar yod /
translated: if they exist, you will not be free from the extreme of superimposition, and if they do not exist, you will not be free from the extreme of denial. Therefore, how can you be free by abandoning the two extremes?

original: kho bo 'dod pa ltar /üîΩyod min de nyid skye med phyir //
analyzed: kho bo 'dod pa ltar / yod min de nyid skye med phyir //
translated: As we assert,üîΩThey are not existent because they do not arise as such.

original: med min de yod ma yin phyir //üîΩyod dang med pa gnyis spangs pas //
analyzed: med min de yod ma yin phyir // yod dang med pa gnyis spangs pas //
translated: They are not nonexistent because they exist as such.üîΩSince they are free from both existence and nonexistence,

original: der 'dod de phyir gnyis su med //
analyzed: der 'dod de phyir gnyis su med //
translated: They are asserted to be nondual.

original: ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: They are not existent.

original: don dam pa'i de nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i de nyid du dngos po thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in ultimate reality, all things are non-arisen.

original: med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not non-existent,

original: yod pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that existence does not exist.

original: yod pa yod na de las bzlog pas med par 'gyur ba yin na yod pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa yod na de las bzlog pas med par 'gyur ba yin na yod pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If existence existed, then through the reversal of that, non-existence would exist. But because that existence does not exist, non-existence does not exist either.

original: de ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa ni de nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir gnyis su med pa de ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa dang med pa gnyis spangs pas gnyis su med pa ni de nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir gnyis su med pa de ni rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since both existence and non-existence are rejected, non-duality is asserted to be reality. Therefore, non-duality is not in contradiction with logic.

original: khyod 'dod pa ltar na skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod 'dod pa ltar na skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: If it were as you assert, then another great error would ensue.

original: ston pa dmigs med mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: ston pa dmigs med mi 'gyur te //
translated: The Teacher would not be non-apprehensible,

original: de @224b bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de @224b bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because he would be apprehended in suchness.

original: byang chub mnyam nyid mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: byang chub mnyam nyid mi 'gyur te //
translated: Enlightenment would not be equality,

original: de nyid rang snang tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rang snang tha dad phyir //
translated: because suchness would appear differently to each.

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la dmigs pa yod na ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dmigs pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la dmigs pa yod na ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dmigs pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were an object of observation called the suchness of the thoroughly established nature, the Teacher, the Bhagavat Buddha, would not be non-observation.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he would observe suchness.üîΩTherefore, it contradicts the scriptures,

original: des na lung las /
analyzed: des na lung las /
translated: which say:

original: sangs rgyas nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The Buddha has the character of space.

original: nam mkha' la yang mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang mtshan nyid med //
translated: Space also has no character.

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid nges grol ba //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid nges grol ba //
translated: The basis of character is freed from character.

original: dmigs med khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'gal lo //üîΩston pa de'i byang chub kyang mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /üîΩgang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs med khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'gal lo // ston pa de'i byang chub kyang mnyam pa nyid du mi 'gyur te / gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Homage to you who are non-observation.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i de nyid gcig dang rab tu snang ba'i ye shes gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i de nyid gcig dang rab tu snang ba'i ye shes gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, the enlightenment of that Teacher would not be equality, because of the difference between the two, the so-called thoroughly established nature and the wisdom that appears.

original: de ltar gnyis yod na ngo bo nyid gnyis mngon par rtogs pa de ji srid mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis yod na ngo bo nyid gnyis mngon par rtogs pa de ji srid mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: occur?üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo //
translated: The mind that observes suchness

original: nus pa ma bzhag ga las byung //
analyzed: nus pa ma bzhag ga las byung //
translated: without depositing potential, from where does it arise?

original: nam mkha'i me tog snang ba'i blo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog snang ba'i blo //
translated: The mind that perceives a sky flower

original: nus pa ma bzhag mi rigs bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni khyed cag kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus dang ldan pa yin pa'i mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang nas yang
analyzed: nus pa ma bzhag mi rigs bzhin // zhes bya ba ni khyed cag kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus dang ldan pa yin pa'i mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang nas yang
translated: without depositing potential is illogical.

original: du rang rang gi nus pa 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: du rang rang gi nus pa 'jog par byed cing /
translated: You say that the foundation consciousness has existed since beginningless time, and when all the consciousnesses such as eye consciousness arise and cease, they repeatedly deposit their potentials in the foundation consciousness.

original: nus pa de dag yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pas yongs su smin par gyur pa ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las mngon par grub pa 'dod ces grags pas des na so so'i skye bo
analyzed: nus pa de dag yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pas yongs su smin par gyur pa ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i bar du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las mngon par grub pa 'dod ces grags pas des na so so'i skye bo
translated: It is renowned that the potential is fully matured by various objects, sense faculties and consciousnesses and that it is established from the foundation consciousness for as long as samsara lasts.

original: de nyid ma mthong ba la de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo nam yang ma skyes pa la de yang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ma mthong ba la de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo nam yang ma skyes pa la de yang skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the mind that observes suchness never arises in those who do not see suchness, it does not arise.

original: ma skyes pa la 'gag pa yang med na mi 'gag la gang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa gang bzhag pa yongs su smin par gyur pas de bzhin nyid mthong ba'i blor 'gyur ba'i nus pa gzhog pa yang med do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'gag pa yang med na mi 'gag la gang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa gang bzhag pa yongs su smin par gyur pas de bzhin nyid mthong ba'i blor 'gyur ba'i nus pa gzhog pa yang med do //
translated: If it does not arise, it does not cease. And if it does not cease, there is no potential that is deposited in the foundation consciousness that matures and becomes the mind that sees suchness.

original: de ltar nus pa ma bzhag par de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo rgyu med pa de dag ga las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar nus pa ma bzhag par de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo rgyu med pa de dag ga las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the potential is not deposited, how could the mind that observes suchness arise without a cause?

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog tu snang ba'i blo la nus pa skyes pa med pa'i phyir sngon nam yang @225a * //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog tu snang ba'i blo la nus pa skyes pa med pa'i phyir sngon nam yang @225a * //
translated: For example, the mind that appears as a sky flower has never produced any potential.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ma bzhag pa des phyis kyang nam mkha'i me tog mthong ba'i blo skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa ma bzhag pa des phyis kyang nam mkha'i me tog mthong ba'i blo skye bar mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the mind that sees a sky flower arises later without having deposited a potential in the foundation consciousness.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / rang tshul sbed pas khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rang tshul sbed pas khyod kyis ni //
translated: You conceal your own system,

original: de nyid gcig nyid gzhan mi 'grol //
analyzed: de nyid gcig nyid gzhan mi 'grol //
translated: and thus you do not liberate the suchness of one from another.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyod yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyod yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod cing /
translated: You assert that the nature of the consummate and the nature of the dependent exist.

original: de gnyis gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: You say that those two are neither the same nor different.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin par brjod pa yang rang gi tshul sbed pa tsam du zad pas des kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de nyid ces bya ba de gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid las mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin par brjod pa yang rang gi tshul sbed pa tsam du zad pas des kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de nyid ces bya ba de gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid las mi 'grol lo //
translated: Since that is merely concealing your own system, you do not liberate the so-called suchness of the consummate nature from being the same or different.

original: dbu ma shes pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'brang ba la ni /
analyzed: dbu ma shes pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'brang ba la ni /
translated: For those who follow the Madhyamaka through the method of knowledge,

original: rdzas med dmigs su med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rdzas med dmigs su med pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are not substantially existent and are not observed,

original: nged la ji skad smras de rigs //
analyzed: nged la ji skad smras de rigs //
translated: it is reasonable for us to say that

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzas su med pa kho nas ngo bo nyid las dmigs su med pa'i phyir nged la ni sngar ji skad smras pa'i gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzas su med pa kho nas ngo bo nyid las dmigs su med pa'i phyir nged la ni sngar ji skad smras pa'i gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: because they are not substantially existent, it is reasonable for us to say that they are not the same entity and

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin par rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin par rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: they are not different entities, as was said before.

original: kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dpe yang 'thad de /
analyzed: kho bo cag 'dod pa ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dpe yang 'thad de /
translated: Also, the examples of space and so on are tenable according to our assertions.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nam mkha' 'dra ba'ang skye med pas //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra ba'ang skye med pas //
translated: Because they are similar to space, they are unarisen,

original: khyad par med phyir mgos phyir //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir mgos phyir //
translated: because they are undifferentiated, because they are supreme,

original: shin tu brjod du med nyid kyang //
analyzed: shin tu brjod du med nyid kyang //
translated: and because they are utterly inexpressible,

original: blos ni rnam kun gzung med phyir //
analyzed: blos ni rnam kun gzung med phyir //
translated: because they are not apprehended by the mind in any way.

original: zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i de nyid ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i de nyid ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: The meaning of suchness is similar to space.

original: de'ang 'di ltar dngos po skyes pa la ni rnam pa'i khyad par las sna tshogs nyid du dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar dngos po skyes pa la ni rnam pa'i khyad par las sna tshogs nyid du dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is like this: a thing that has arisen is observed as various due to the difference of its aspects.

original: dngos po ma skyes pa la ni skye ba med pas khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / spros pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pas ma gos pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dngos po ma skyes pa la ni skye ba med pas khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / spros pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyis gos pa med pas ma gos pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
translated: But a thing that has not arisen is not different because it is non-arisen, and it is unsoiled because it is not soiled by any conceptual elaboration. Therefore, it is like space.

original: de ni shin tu brjod du med pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: de ni shin tu brjod du med pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also utterly inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar blos gzung pa'i dngos po la ni mngon par brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar blos gzung pa'i dngos po la ni mngon par brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: For, verbal expression occurs in regard to a thing that is apprehended by the intellect.

original: de ni blos rnam pa kun du gzung du med pa'i phyir shin tu brjod du med pa nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de ni blos rnam pa kun du gzung du med pa'i phyir shin tu brjod du med pa nyid du rigs so //
translated: But it is reasonable that it is utterly inexpressible because it is not apprehended by the intellect in any way.

original: gal te de shin tu gcig tu ma skyes pa nyid yin na de ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gal te de shin tu gcig tu ma skyes pa nyid yin na de ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If it is utterly non-arisen, how can it be called supramundane wisdom?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: skye ba rab rib bral ba'i blo //
analyzed: skye ba rab rib bral ba'i blo //
translated: The intellect free from the cataracts of arising

original: 'jig rten 'das pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa yin par 'dod //
translated: It is considered supramundane.

original: 'jig rten las sgrol don phyir dang // 'jig rten shin tu 'da' phyir ro //üîΩ@225b zhes bya ba ni skye ba nyid rab ring ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las sgrol don phyir dang // 'jig rten shin tu 'da' phyir ro // @225b zhes bya ba ni skye ba nyid rab ring ste /
translated: Because it liberates from the world and because it transcends the world.

original: de dang bral ba'i blo gang la yod pa de ni skye ba rab rib dang bral ba'i blo 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i blo gang la yod pa de ni skye ba rab rib dang bral ba'i blo 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: The intellect that is free from the cataract of birth is considered supramundane.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten las sgrol ba'i don gyi phyir dang 'jig rten las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las sgrol ba'i don gyi phyir dang 'jig rten las shin tu 'da' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it liberates from the world and because it transcends the world.

original: ji skad du de ni 'jig rten las g-yo ba dang bskyod pa dang 'da' ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du de ni 'jig rten las g-yo ba dang bskyod pa dang 'da' ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúIt is called supramundane because it moves, shakes, and transcends the world.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / de ni mi rtog dmigs med dang // mtshan ma med cing de yis ni //üîΩrang gzhan chos nyid cig car du //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de ni mi rtog dmigs med dang // mtshan ma med cing de yis ni // rang gzhan chos nyid cig car du //
translated: It is non-conceptual, non-apprehending, signless,üîΩAnd simultaneously realizes the equality

original: rtog med tshul gyis mnyam nyid rtogs //
analyzed: rtog med tshul gyis mnyam nyid rtogs //
translated: Of itself and others through the mode of non-conceptuality.

original: zhes bya ba la blo de ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la blo de ni rnam par mi rtog pa yin te /
translated: The mind is nonconceptual,

original: ma skyes pa kho nas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa kho nas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nonarisen, free from all conceptualization.

original: dmigs pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is nonapprehending,

original: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend any thing.

original: mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is signless,

original: yul la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not grasp the object as a sign.

original: blo des shes pa rang gi chos nyid dang shes bya gzhan gyi chos nyid cig car du rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: blo des shes pa rang gi chos nyid dang shes bya gzhan gyi chos nyid cig car du rtog pa med pa'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is the realization of the equality of the intrinsic reality of the cognition and the intrinsic reality of the other object of cognition, by the method of nonconceptualization.

original: kho bo cag ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we posit the complete enlightenment in one moment.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi shes bya brtag pa'i phyir /üîΩchos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi shes bya brtag pa'i phyir / chos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
translated: In order to demonstrate the cognition of the supramundane wisdom, he says:üîΩThe nonarising of things

original: chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya //
translated: is called the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la rtog dri'i mtshan ma dag /'byung ba med pa snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: de la rtog dri'i mtshan ma dag /'byung ba med pa snga ma bzhin //
translated: The signs of the stains of conceptuality do not arise, as before.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: chos rnams skye ba med pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams skye ba med pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The absence of production of phenomena is called the absence of a self of phenomena.

original: de la rtog pa'i dri ma'i mtshan ma dag 'byung ba med pa ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i le'ur bstan pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i dri ma'i mtshan ma dag 'byung ba med pa ni de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i le'ur bstan pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The non-arising of the signs of the stains of conceptuality is as taught in the chapter on the search for the knowledge of thatness.

original: rtog pa nyid dri ma yin te snang ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa nyid dri ma yin te snang ba'o //
translated: Conceptualization itself is the stain, the appearance.

original: de nyid mtshan ma de mngon rtogs so //
analyzed: de nyid mtshan ma de mngon rtogs so //
translated: That is the sign, the realization.

original: de la de dag rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de la de dag rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ba med do //
translated: They do not arise in any way in that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: ‚ÄúSince a s≈´tra says,

original: don dam pa ni rtag tu med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes gsungs pas mngon sum gyi yul yin par gsungs pa yin na khyed kyis ni don dam par rtogs par bya ba ma yin par bstan pas rtog ge'i spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni rtag tu med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes gsungs pas mngon sum gyi yul yin par gsungs pa yin na khyed kyis ni don dam par rtogs par bya ba ma yin par bstan pas rtog ge'i spyod yul yin te /
translated: ‚ÄòThe ultimate is always non-existent and is not the domain of sophistry,‚Äô it is taught to be the object of direct perception. Since you teach that the ultimate is not to be realized, it is the domain of sophistry.

original: mtho ris la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pas lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pas lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that this contradicts scripture,

original: pha rol po dag gi bsam pa de @226a * //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi bsam pa de @226a * //
translated: in order to refute the opponent‚Äôs

original: bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgal te de nyid rtog ge yi //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa / gal te de nyid rtog ge yi //
translated: position, it is said:üîΩIf that is not the domain of

original: spyod yul min phyir rjes dpag pas //üîΩde mi rtogs pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: spyod yul min phyir rjes dpag pas // de mi rtogs pa de yi phyir //
translated: speculative thought,üîΩit is not cognized by inference.

original: chos rnams chos nyid brtag min na //
analyzed: chos rnams chos nyid brtag min na //
translated: Therefore, if phenomena are not to beüîΩspeculated about,üîΩif the opponent thinks that way,

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de ltar sems na'o //üîΩ'di la rjes dpag skyon med pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de ltar sems na'o // 'di la rjes dpag skyon med pa //
translated: in this regard, the BhagavƒÅnüîΩestablishes inference

original: lung gi rjes su sgrub byed pas //
analyzed: lung gi rjes su sgrub byed pas //
translated: by means of scripture.üîΩHaving cleared away all the various

original: brtags pa'i rnam rtog chu bo dag / sna tshogs ma lus bsal mdzad nas //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnam rtog chu bo dag / sna tshogs ma lus bsal mdzad nas //
translated: streams of conceptual thoughts,üîΩin this regard, the BhagavƒÅn first establishes inference by means ofüîΩscripture. Having cleared away all the various streams of conceptualüîΩthoughts that are imputed by our own and other schools, he taught theüîΩultimate truth, which is beyond the domain of speculative thought, by

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyon med pa lung gi rjes su sgrub bar byed pas rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo sna tshogs ma lus pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyon med pa lung gi rjes su sgrub bar byed pas rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo sna tshogs ma lus pa
translated: means of the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: dag bsal bar mdzad nas de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: dag bsal bar mdzad nas de'i 'og tu /
translated: Having purified them,

original: sangs rgyas rnam rtog mi mnga' ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam rtog mi mnga' ba //
translated: the Buddhas, who are free from conceptualization,

original: dgongs pa mkha' mnyam ye shes kyis //
analyzed: dgongs pa mkha' mnyam ye shes kyis //
translated: with the wisdom of the sky-like intention,üîΩrealize the way things are

original: shes bya mtha' dag ji bzhin du //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' dag ji bzhin du //
translated: of all objects of knowledge.

original: chos rnams gzhag pa nyid rtogs shing //
analyzed: chos rnams gzhag pa nyid rtogs shing //
translated: They realize the way things are

original: ming la sogs pa thob pa nyid //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa thob pa nyid //
translated: of all objects of knowledge.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba shes bya rnam pa lnga po mi dmigs pa ni nam mkha' mnyam pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba shes bya rnam pa lnga po mi dmigs pa ni nam mkha' mnyam pa'i sems so //
translated: The non-apprehension of the five kinds of objects of knowledge, namely, past, future, present, inexpressible, and unconditioned, is the sky-like mind.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon sum gyi ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon sum gyi ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
translated: It is the moment of non-conceptual direct wisdom.

original: nye bar brtags nas gzigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar brtags nas gzigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called seeing after thorough investigation,

original: gzigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: in the manner of non-seeing.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i yul //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i yul //
translated: Therefore, the object of inference

original: de nyid yin par sgrub mi nus //üîΩde nyid shes pa'i mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: de nyid yin par sgrub mi nus // de nyid shes pa'i mi mthun phyogs //
translated: cannot be established as thatness.üîΩWhatever is the opposite of the knowledge of thatness

original: gang yin de ni des zlog byed //
analyzed: gang yin de ni des zlog byed //
translated: is what is to be eliminated by that.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid kyi shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags pa zhes bya ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'dis zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid kyi shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags pa zhes bya ba de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'dis zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúexamination of the counteragent to the knowledge of reality free from conceptual differentiation‚Äù is to be refuted by this inferential cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul du de kho na nyid sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul du de kho na nyid sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: But it is not to be construed as establishing reality as the domain of inference.

original: yang gal te rjes su dpag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar bzlog par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te rjes su dpag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar bzlog par bya zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if one asks how the counteragent is to be refuted by inference,

original: smras pa / lung gi khyad par tha dad pas //
analyzed: smras pa / lung gi khyad par tha dad pas //
translated: we reply:

original: tha dad gyur ba'i blo la ci //
analyzed: tha dad gyur ba'i blo la ci //
translated: What difference is there in the cognition of those who differ

original: lung gi dbye ba med pa la //
analyzed: lung gi dbye ba med pa la //
translated: because of the difference of scriptural authority?

original: rtogs par gyur pas gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur pas gzhan ci yod //
translated: What other difference can there beüîΩwhen one realizes that there is no division of scriptural authority?

original: lung las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gi khyad par te /
analyzed: lung las gzhan pa'i lung ni lung gi khyad par te /
translated: Another scriptural authority is a difference of scriptural authority.

original: de ni rgol ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas shes @226b pa'i bye brag skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rgol ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas shes @226b pa'i bye brag skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is, the difference of the cognition arises because of the division of the three hundred and sixty-three disputants.

original: gang dag tha mi dad par 'dod pa de dag la ni thabs gzhan gyis brtag par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag tha mi dad par 'dod pa de dag la ni thabs gzhan gyis brtag par rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But for those who maintain that the two are not different, it is not proper to examine them by other means.

original: gzhan du phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pas yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pas yin no //
translated: Rather, it is by inference based on the position, the reason, and the example.üîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: mi mthun phyogs ni spang bya ba //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs ni spang bya ba //
translated: the opponent‚Äôs position is to be refuted.

original: dam bcas tsam gyis ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: dam bcas tsam gyis ji ltar 'dod //
translated: How can one get what one wants just by a thesis?

original: rnam par rtog pa ma spangs par //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma spangs par //
translated: As long as conceptualization is not abandoned,

original: rnam par mi rtog blo ji ltar //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog blo ji ltar //
translated: how can there be a nonconceptual mind?

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gegs par byed pa na dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig gis byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gegs par byed pa na dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig gis byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: When one is blocking all conceptualization, one cannot do so just by a thesis.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags pa zhes bya ba ma spangs kyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas dam bca' ba smras nas gtan tshigs brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags pa zhes bya ba ma spangs kyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas dam bca' ba smras nas gtan tshigs brjod par bya'o //
translated: As long as one has not refuted the position called ‚Äúthe opponent‚Äôs position,‚Äù the nonconceptual mind does not arise. Therefore, after stating the thesis, one should state the reason.

original: dpe yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should also state the example.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshang ba yin pas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshang ba yin pas so //
translated: The accomplishment of the desired goal is the completion of the inference that accomplishes it.

original: thub pa bden pa gzigs pa yis /
analyzed: thub pa bden pa gzigs pa yis /
translated: The Sage, having seen the truths,

original: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis su gsungs //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis su gsungs //
translated: taught thus the two truths.

original: tha snyad la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni brten nas su //
translated: In dependence on the conventional,

original: de nyid don ni rtogs 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de nyid don ni rtogs 'gyur phyir //
translated: the meaning of the ultimate is taught.

original: rjes su dpag pa gang gis rnam par brtags pa 'gog par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu tha snyad kyi bden pa zhes bya ba la brten nas byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gang gis rnam par brtags pa 'gog par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu tha snyad kyi bden pa zhes bya ba la brten nas byed pa yin no //
translated: The inference that refutes the imagined is done in dependence on the conventional truth, which is called the conventional truth of expressions.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa de la brten nas de ni rim gyis rnam par mi rtog pa brjod du med pa'i don dam pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa de la brten nas de ni rim gyis rnam par mi rtog pa brjod du med pa'i don dam pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on that conventional truth, one gradually realizes the non-conceptual, inexpressible ultimate.

original: ji ltar kun rdzob kyi chos la ma brten par don dam pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar kun rdzob kyi chos la ma brten par don dam pa rtogs par mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúWithout depending on conventional phenomena, the ultimate cannot be realized.‚Äù

original: dbu ma pa'i lugs la rab tu grags pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par bzhag cing rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i de kho na nyid la skyon dang bcas pa nyid du smras pa /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i lugs la rab tu grags pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par bzhag cing rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i de kho na nyid la skyon dang bcas pa nyid du smras pa /
translated: In the Madhyamaka system, the reality that is well known is presented, and the reality of the YogƒÅcƒÅra is said to be faulty.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i blo //
translated: The cognition that observes suchness

original: dmigs dang bcas phyir brdzun yin te //
analyzed: dmigs dang bcas phyir brdzun yin te //
translated: is false because it has an object.

original: rmi lam sogs yin de shes bya //
analyzed: rmi lam sogs yin de shes bya //
translated: It is like a dream, and so on.

original: des na de nyid yin mi rigs //
analyzed: des na de nyid yin mi rigs //
translated: Therefore it is not suitable to be suchness.

original: de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni chos  can no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la dmigs pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni chos  can no //
translated: The subject is called ‚Äúthe cognition that observes suchness.‚Äù

original: de ni brdzun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni brdzun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The predicate is ‚Äúit is false.‚Äù

original: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
translated: The combination of the subject and predicate is the position.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it has an object.‚Äù

original: gang dang gang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa de dang de ni brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa de dang de ni brdzun pa yin te /
translated: Whatever has an object is false.

original: dper na @227a * //
analyzed: dper na @227a * //
translated: For example,

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: a dream consciousness is the example.

original: gang gi phyir de brdzun yin pa de'i phyir des gzung ba de ni de kho na nyid do zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de brdzun yin pa de'i phyir des gzung ba de ni de kho na nyid do zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is false, therefore it is not tenable to say that what is apprehended by it is reality.

original: de yang brdzun nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang brdzun nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that that also is false.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gzung du med pa brjod med pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzung du med pa brjod med pa //
translated: It is not apprehended, it is inexpressible,

original: shes ba'i spyod pa rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: shes ba'i spyod pa rnam spangs pa //
translated: It is free from the activity of consciousness,

original: thub pa'i dbang pos gsungs pa'i chos //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang pos gsungs pa'i chos //
translated: The Dharma taught by the Lord of Sages

original: de yis 'di ltar 'di la gnod //
analyzed: de yis 'di ltar 'di la gnod //
translated: Is harmed in this way.

original: blo'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung du med pa nyid dang / brjod du med pa nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: blo'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung du med pa nyid dang / brjod du med pa nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Because it is the object of the mind, it is not tenable that it is not apprehended and inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar chos nyid de ni gzung du med pa dang brjod du med pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la shes pa 'jug pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos nyid de ni gzung du med pa dang brjod du med pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la shes pa 'jug pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts such statements as, ‚ÄúThat reality is not apprehended and is inexpressible,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe ultimate truth is that in which consciousness does not engage.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs nas shin tu spangs pa'i don dang reg par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa yongs su rdzogs nas shin tu spangs pa'i don dang reg par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having completed the chapter, in order to touch upon the meaning of thorough relinquishment,

original: de ltar lung rigs ldan pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar lung rigs ldan pa yi //
translated: Thus, endowed with scripture and reasoning,

original: de nyid gang zhig sngar bstan pa //
analyzed: de nyid gang zhig sngar bstan pa //
translated: Whatever reality was taught before,

original: rigs pas yongs su brtags na yang //
analyzed: rigs pas yongs su brtags na yang //
translated: When examined with reasoning,

original: de las nyams pa med par gnas //
analyzed: de las nyams pa med par gnas //
translated: It remains without decline.

original: gang rnal 'byor spyod pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i de kho na nyid ni rnam par brtags pa na dpyad bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rnal 'byor spyod pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i de kho na nyid ni rnam par brtags pa na dpyad bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: When the reality that is examined by the yogƒÅcƒÅras is analyzed, it cannot withstand scrutiny.üîΩSome say the aggregates are the tree trunk,

original: kha cig phung po'i ldon shing cha / kha cig rnam shes rgyal thogs //üîΩyang dag mtha' yi g-yang sar yang //
analyzed: kha cig phung po'i ldon shing cha / kha cig rnam shes rgyal thogs // yang dag mtha' yi g-yang sar yang //
translated: Some say consciousness is the king,

original: ma lhung rgyal ba'i thugs sras rol //
analyzed: ma lhung rgyal ba'i thugs sras rol //
translated: But the Victor's heart sons do not fallüîΩInto the abyss of the limit of reality.

original: de ltar na de kho na nyid gang de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par lung dang rigs pa dang ldan par bdag gis 'di skad du /üîΩshes bya rnam kun ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de ltar na de kho na nyid gang de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par lung dang rigs pa dang ldan par bdag gis 'di skad du / shes bya rnam kun ma grub phyir //
translated: Thus, in this chapter on the search for the knowledge of reality, I have presented it in this way, endowed with scripture and reasoning.üîΩBecause objects of knowledge are not established in any way,

original: gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i //
translated: The non-conceptual

original: blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur la //
translated: And the mind would not arise.

original: de nyid mnyam med de mkhyen gsungs //
analyzed: de nyid mnyam med de mkhyen gsungs //
translated: That is the unexcelled knowledge of reality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bdag dang gzhan gyi rtog ge pa rnams kyi rjes su dpag pas kyang bskyod par nus pa ma yin par yang dag par rab tu gnas pa yin no //üîΩdbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bdag dang gzhan gyi rtog ge pa rnams kyi rjes su dpag pas kyang bskyod par nus pa ma yin par yang dag par rab tu gnas pa yin no // dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba las /
translated: Thus, by these and other passages, he is well established as not being shaken by the inferences of the logicians of our own and other schools.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pa ste le'u lnga pa'o /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pa ste le'u lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter, the chapter on the YogƒÅcƒÅra‚Äôs ascertainment of reality, in this Ornament of the Middle Way, a commentary on the treatise that teaches the definitive meaning.

original: // / de nas da ni grangs can pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas rab tu byed pa drug pa ba rtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas da ni grangs can pa'i de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas rab tu byed pa drug pa ba rtsam par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to enter into the ascertainment of reality of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the sixth chapter will be composed.

original: de la thub pa ser skyas bstan pa'i don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la thub pa ser skyas bstan pa'i don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In that regard, regarding the ultimate truth that was taught by Kapila, the Sage,üîΩit is said:

original: rang @227b bzhin gang zhig rtog pa med //
analyzed: rang @227b bzhin gang zhig rtog pa med //
translated: The nature that is nonconceptual,

original: yon tan gsum dang bskyed bdag nyid //
analyzed: yon tan gsum dang bskyed bdag nyid //
translated: the nature of the three qualities,

original: de las zlog pas skyes bu nyid //
analyzed: de las zlog pas skyes bu nyid //
translated: and the opposite of that is the person.

original: 'di dag rtag tu goms par bya //
analyzed: 'di dag rtag tu goms par bya //
translated: One should always cultivate these.

original: rang bzhin ni yod de sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni yod de sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Nature exists, but it is not endowed with mind.

original: de yang ma skyes pa /
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa /
translated: It is unborn,

original: rtag pa / byed pa pos longs spyad par bya ba gcig bu khyab pa yon tan gsum la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa / byed pa pos longs spyad par bya ba gcig bu khyab pa yon tan gsum la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: permanent, and the sole object of experience of the creator, who is all-pervading and endowed with the three qualities.

original: de nyid ni mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mi gsal ba ste /
translated: It is not manifest,

original: kha dog dang / tshad dang / dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum dum gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang / tshad dang / dbyibs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum dum gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not directly perceived by any of the gods, demigods, humans, and so on, due to its distinctions of color, size, shape, and so on.

original: de yang rtsa ba'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba //
translated: Moreover, the fundamental nature is unchanging.

original: chen po la sogs rnam pa bdun //
analyzed: chen po la sogs rnam pa bdun //
translated: The seven, such as Mahat,

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba bden nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba bden nyid do //
translated: are the transformation of nature, which is reality.

original: 'gyur ba rnam pa bcu drug kyang //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rnam pa bcu drug kyang //
translated: The sixteen transformations

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba min skyes bu //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba min skyes bu //
translated: are also born from the unchanging nature.

original: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin te //
translated: This is the tenet:

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fundamental nature is unchanging because it is characterized by immutability.

original: gang gi phyir blo rab tu bskyed pa de'i phyir na rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo rab tu bskyed pa de'i phyir na rang bzhin no //
translated: Because it generates the intellect, therefore it is the nature.

original: blo nyid ni chen po'o //
analyzed: blo nyid ni chen po'o //
translated: The intellect itself is the great one.

original: blo yin na yang gang gi phyir ngar 'dzin pa rab tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: blo yin na yang gang gi phyir ngar 'dzin pa rab tu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And because it is the nature that generates the sense of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rtsa ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsa ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because it arises from the fundamental nature, therefore it is the transformation.

original: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa yang de tsam lnga rab tu skyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa yang de tsam lnga rab tu skyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Similarly, the sense of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the nature because it generates the five subtle elements,

original: blos byas pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: blos byas pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and it is the transformation because it is created by the intellect.

original: de tsam rnams kyang chen por gyur pa dbang po rnams skyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de tsam rnams kyang chen por gyur pa dbang po rnams skyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And because those subtle elements generate the great elements, the sense faculties, therefore they are the nature.

original: ngar 'dzin pa las byung ba'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa las byung ba'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And because they arise from the sense of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù therefore they are the transformations.

original: de ltar de dag gi chen po dang / nga rgyal dang / de tsam lnga zhes bya bas rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bdun dang / rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni brgyad pa'o //üîΩde tsam gyis bskyed pa ni yang 'gyur ba bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi chen po dang / nga rgyal dang / de tsam lnga zhes bya bas rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bdun dang / rtsa ba'i rang bzhin ni brgyad pa'o // de tsam gyis bskyed pa ni yang 'gyur ba bcu drug ste /
translated: Thus, the seven are called the ‚Äúseven transformations of the fundamental nature‚Äù by the terms ‚Äúgreatness,‚Äù ‚Äúpride,‚Äù and ‚Äúfive such-and-such.‚ÄùüîΩThe fundamental nature is the eighth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The sixteen transformations generated by these are as follows:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dam /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dam /
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, space, ear, skin, eye,üîΩtongue, nose, hand, foot, anus, penis, and speech.

original: lce dang / sna dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang / mdoms dang / ngag dang bcu drug po 'di dag ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba yang sred pas 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lce dang / sna dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang / mdoms dang / ngag dang bcu drug po 'di dag ni rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba yang sred pas 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These sixteen are transformations of craving, which are also degenerations.

original: skyes bu ni rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The person is not the fundamental nature,

original: mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not generated.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a transformation,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not generated.

original: @228a * // yang na 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid la yon tan cha mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: @228a * // yang na 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid la yon tan cha mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Or else, the characteristic of these is as follows: The characteristic of the quality of equal parts is indistinctness.

original: chen po ni rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don thams cad la khyad par thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chen po ni rtog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don thams cad la khyad par thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the great one is the characteristic of imagination and the characteristic of all meanings and all distinctions.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu brgyal gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu brgyal gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the apprehension of the self is the characteristic of deep sleep.

original: blo dang yid dang ngar 'dzin pa //
analyzed: blo dang yid dang ngar 'dzin pa //
translated: The intellect, the mind, and the apprehension of the self

original: zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ni nang gi byed pa po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum ni nang gi byed pa po'o //
translated: These three are the inner agents.

original: zhi ba dang drag po dang rmongs pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par las grol ba ni sgra'i spyi ste sgra'i de tsam nyid do //
analyzed: zhi ba dang drag po dang rmongs pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i khyad par las grol ba ni sgra'i spyi ste sgra'i de tsam nyid do //
translated: The general sound, which is liberated from the distinctions of sound such as peace, violence, and delusion, is the mere sound, the sound-itself.

original: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa dang / dkar ba dang nag pa la sogs pa dang / mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dang / dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dus pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa dang / dkar ba dang nag pa la sogs pa dang / mngar ba dang skyur ba la sogs pa dang / dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dus pa ni /
translated: The collection of distinctions such as smoothness and roughness, white and black, sweet and sour, fragrant and foul-smelling,

original: sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri'i de tsam mo //
analyzed: sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri'i de tsam mo //
translated: The elements are the ultimate reality of sound, touch, taste, form, and smell.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'o //
translated: Sound is the characteristic of space.

original: reg pa'i mchan nyid ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa'i mchan nyid ni rlung ngo //
translated: Touch is the characteristic of wind.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni me'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni me'o //
translated: Form is the characteristic of fire.

original: ro'i mtshan nyid ni chu'o ;
analyzed: ro'i mtshan nyid ni chu'o ;
translated: Taste is the characteristic of water.

original: / dri'i mtshan nyid ni sa'o //
analyzed: / dri'i mtshan nyid ni sa'o //
translated: Smell is the characteristic of earth.

original: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna zhes bya ba lnga ni blo'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna zhes bya ba lnga ni blo'i dbang po ste /
translated: The five faculties of the ear, skin, eye, tongue, and nose are called the intellectual faculties.

original: rang rang gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rang rang gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because they understand their respective objects,

original: blo sngon du btang nas 'jug pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang nas 'jug pa'i phyir ram /
translated: or because they engage in their objects after the intellect has operated on them,

original: sgor gyur pa de nas skyes bus don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir blo'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgor gyur pa de nas skyes bus don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir blo'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: or because the intellect understands the object through the door that is the faculty, they are called the intellectual faculties.

original: ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang / mdoms zhes bya ba ni bya ba sngon du song nas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang / mdoms zhes bya ba ni bya ba sngon du song nas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The faculties of speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals are called the action faculties because they engage in their objects after the intellect has operated on them.

original: skyes bu'i bya ba la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir las kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i bya ba la nye bar gnas pa'i phyir las kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are the basis of the person‚Äôs actions, they are called the action faculties.

original: yid ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: yid ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The mental faculty is the master of both.

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir blo'i dbang po yin la /
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir blo'i dbang po yin la /
translated: It is a faculty of understanding because it is associated with thought.

original: bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir las kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir las kyi dbang po'o //
translated: It is a faculty of action because it is associated with activity.

original: sa la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang drag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos de tsam dag las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir khyad par ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang drag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos de tsam dag las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir khyad par ro //
translated: Earth, etc., are the specificities of these, since they are distinguished from them by their nature of solidity, etc.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin 'gyur ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin 'gyur ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni lnga bcu ste /
translated: Thus, the specificities are fifty in number.

original: 'di lta ste mgu ba ni dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mgu ba ni dgu'o //
translated: Nine are the specificities of satisfaction.

original: grub pa ni brgyad do //
analyzed: grub pa ni brgyad do //
translated: Eight are the specificities of accomplishment.

original: nus pa ni nyi shu tsa brgyad do //
analyzed: nus pa ni nyi shu tsa brgyad do //
translated: Twenty-eight are the specificities of power.

original: phyin ci log pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa ni lnga ste /
translated: Five are the specificities of error.

original: de ltar na lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na lnga bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are fifty.

original: de la chu dang / chu rgyun dang / chu bo dang / char 'bab pa dang / legs par rgal ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / mig bzang ba dang / 'od can dang // lus mchog ces bya ba ni mgu ba dgu yin te /
analyzed: de la chu dang / chu rgyun dang / chu bo dang / char 'bab pa dang / legs par rgal ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / mig bzang ba dang / 'od can dang // lus mchog ces bya ba ni mgu ba dgu yin te /
translated: Among them, the nine specificities of satisfaction are: water, stream, river, rain, good crossing, not other, good eye, light, and supreme body.

original: @228b yongs su mnyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @228b yongs su mnyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúto please completely.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de la rang bzhin las 'bras bu thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin las 'bras bu thob pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, one sees that the result is obtained from the nature,üîΩand not from human effort. One who sees in this way will be born in the realm of liberation and so forth, which is called the ‚Äúwater.

original: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar gang gis mthong ba de ni yongs su dga' ba thar pa la sogs pa'i yul la skye bar 'gyur ba ni chu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar gang gis mthong ba de ni yongs su dga' ba thar pa la sogs pa'i yul la skye bar 'gyur ba ni chu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not created by a person.üîΩOne who sees it in this way will be born in the realm of the utterly joyful gods and so on. This is called water.

original: nye bar len pa las 'bras bu 'thob kyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa las 'bras bu 'thob kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe result is obtained from appropriation,

original: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chu rgyun no //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chu rgyun no //
translated: and not from human effort,‚Äù is the ‚Äústream.üîΩ‚Äù

original: dus kyis 'bras bu 'thob kyi skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chu bo'o //
analyzed: dus kyis 'bras bu 'thob kyi skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chu bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe result is obtained from time, and not from human effort,‚Äù is the ‚Äúriver.üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe result is obtained from fate,‚Äù is the ‚Äúrain.

original: skal bas 'bras bu 'thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: skal bas 'bras bu 'thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'o //
translated: The fruit is obtained by good fortune.üîΩ This is the rain.üîΩ

original: yul la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa'i skyon mthong nas gang thar pa la sogs pa la yongs su dga' ba de ni legs par rgal ba'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa'i skyon mthong nas gang thar pa la sogs pa la yongs su dga' ba de ni legs par rgal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen the faults of accomplishing the object and so forth, one who delights in liberation and so forth is the ‚Äògood crossing.üîΩ‚Äô

original: kun du bsrung ba'i skyon mthong ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i skyon mthong ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen the faults of guarding, there is the ‚Äòother.üîΩ‚Äô‚Äù

original: thar pa mthong ba ni mig bzang ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa mthong ba ni mig bzang ba'o //
translated: The eye of liberation is the eye of good vision.

original: dbang po mthong ba ni 'od can no //
analyzed: dbang po mthong ba ni 'od can no //
translated: The eye of power is the eye of light.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba mthong na thar pa la sogs pa la yongs su dga' ba de ni lus mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba mthong na thar pa la sogs pa la yongs su dga' ba de ni lus mchog ces bya ste /
translated: The body of liberation, etc., is the supreme body.

original: de dag ni mgu ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mgu ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: These are the nine kinds of satisfaction.

original: de bzhin du ye shes las skye ba'i grub pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes las skye ba'i grub pa ni brgyad de /
translated: Similarly, there are eight kinds of success born of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sgrol ba po dang / legs par sgrol ba po dang / sgrol ba'i mthar phyin pa dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu bar gyur pa dang / nyams dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' bzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrol ba po dang / legs par sgrol ba po dang / sgrol ba'i mthar phyin pa dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu bar gyur pa dang / nyams dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' bzhes bya ba ste /
translated: the liberator, the good liberator, the one who has completed liberation, the one who is satisfied, the one who is very satisfied, the one who is delighted, the one who is pleased, and the one who is supremely pleased.

original: grub pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa'i phyir na grub pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir dang / sgrub pa'i phyir na grub pa'o //
translated: They are called successes because they are the causes of success and the means of success.

original: de la shes pa gang dpyad pa byas nas skye ba de ni sgrol ba po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa gang dpyad pa byas nas skye ba de ni sgrol ba po zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the knowledge that arises from analysis is called the liberator.

original: thos pa la sogs pa dag gi shes pa ni legs par sgrol ba po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa dag gi shes pa ni legs par sgrol ba po zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of learning, etc., is called the good liberator.

original: brjod bya dang rjod byed sngon du seng ba'i bla mas bstan pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni sgrol ba'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod bya dang rjod byed sngon du seng ba'i bla mas bstan pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni sgrol ba'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises from the teaching of the guru who has previously mastered the expressed and the expresser is called ‚Äúthe culmination of liberation.‚Äù

original: grang ba dang tshab bzlog pa'i thams shes pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang tshab bzlog pa'i thams shes pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the remedy for cold and heat is joy.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan la sogs pa'i nad gang bdag nyid dam bla ma las skyes pa'i bzlog pa'i thabs shes pa grub pa de ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan la sogs pa'i nad gang bdag nyid dam bla ma las skyes pa'i bzlog pa'i thabs shes pa grub pa de ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the means of curing the diseases of wind, bile, phlegm, and so on, in oneself or others, which arises from the guru or oneself, is called ‚Äúsupreme joy.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang dang por byung ba las gyur pa mi dang / byol song dang / ri dags dang / sbrul la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung zhing skyes pas 'jig pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bla ma'am /üîΩbdag nyid las skyes pa @229a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang por byung ba las gyur pa mi dang / byol song dang / ri dags dang / sbrul la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung zhing skyes pas 'jig pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bla ma'am /üîΩbdag nyid las skyes pa @229a * //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of the means of curing the sufferings of fear, conflict, beating, and so on, which arise from the signs of humans, animals, deer, snakes, and so on, which arise from the guru or oneself, is called ‚Äúspecial joy.‚Äù

original: na ; bcos pa'i thabs byas pa las shes pa grub pa de ni mgu bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na ; bcos pa'i thabs byas pa las shes pa grub pa de ni mgu bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cognition that is established by the means of treatment is called ‚Äúsatisfaction.‚Äù

original: de bzhin g-yas phyogs su 'jug pa'i rgyus sam /
analyzed: de bzhin g-yas phyogs su 'jug pa'i rgyus sam /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of the pure life, etc., that is caused by the right side,
