original: skal ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu can gyi bde ba la dmigs pa la sogs pas tshangs par spyod pa'i shes pa de ni nyams dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu can gyi bde ba la dmigs pa la sogs pas tshangs par spyod pa'i shes pa de ni nyams dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or that is caused by the condition of good fortune, is called ‚Äúdelight.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / skra dang / kha spu bregs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni rtag tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / skra dang / kha spu bregs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni rtag tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the same way, the cognition that is established by the performance of rising, saluting, shaving the head and beard, etc., is called ‚Äúconstant delight.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni grub pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni grub pa brgyad yin no //
translated: These are the eight accomplishments.

original: yang dbang po la gnod pas 'on pa dang / mdze nad dang / dmus long gi ngo bo dang / bems po nyid dang / dri mi zhim pa nyid dang / grum po nyid dang / rtug skam can dang / ma ning dang / lag pa nyams pa dang /
analyzed: yang dbang po la gnod pas 'on pa dang / mdze nad dang / dmus long gi ngo bo dang / bems po nyid dang / dri mi zhim pa nyid dang / grum po nyid dang / rtug skam can dang / ma ning dang / lag pa nyams pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the deaf, the leper, the blind, the mute, the foul-smelling, the lame, the constipated, the eunuch, the one-handed,

original: lkugs pa dang / shes pa nyams pa zhes bya ba 'di dag gi grangs ji lta ba bzhin dpags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna la sogs pa dang / ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang /
analyzed: lkugs pa dang / shes pa nyams pa zhes bya ba 'di dag gi grangs ji lta ba bzhin dpags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna la sogs pa dang / ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / 'phongs dang /
translated: The eleven faculties that are mentioned in the above verse are the two sexual faculties, the eye faculty, etc., the five faculties of action, and the faculty of final and complete freedom.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are not mentioned in the above verse are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, the five faculties beginning with faith, and the faculty of coming to know what is not yet known.

original: mdoms zhes bya ba'i dbang po la gnod pa 'di dag ni nus pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: mdoms zhes bya ba'i dbang po la gnod pa 'di dag ni nus pa bcu gcig go //
translated: The eleven faculties that are mentioned in the above verse are the two sexual faculties, the eye faculty, etc., the five faculties of action, and the faculty of final and complete freedom.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are not mentioned in the above verse are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, the five faculties beginning with faith, and the faculty of coming to know what is not yet known.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are mentioned in the above verse are the two sexual faculties, the eye faculty, etc., the five faculties of action, and the faculty of final and complete freedom.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are not mentioned in the above verse are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, the five faculties beginning with faith, and the faculty of coming to know what is not yet known.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are mentioned in the above verse are the two sexual faculties, the eye faculty, etc., the five faculties of action, and the faculty of final and complete freedom.

original: de bzhin du chu ma yin pa dang / chu rgyun ma yin pa dang / chu bo ma yin pa dang / char pa 'bab pa ma yin pa dang / legs par rgal ba ma yin pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu ma yin pa dang / chu rgyun ma yin pa dang / chu bo ma yin pa dang / char pa 'bab pa ma yin pa dang / legs par rgal ba ma yin pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: The eleven faculties that are not mentioned in the above verse are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, the five faculties beginning with faith, and the faculty of coming to know what is not yet known.üîΩThe eleven faculties that are mentioned in the above verse are the two sexual faculties, the eye faculty, etc., the five faculties of action, and the faculty of final and complete freedom.

original: bzang po ma yin pa dang / 'od can ma yin pa dang / lus mchog ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po ma yin pa dang / 'od can ma yin pa dang / lus mchog ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The eleven faculties that are not mentioned in the above verse are the life faculty, the five faculties of feeling, the five faculties beginning

original: de la rang bzhin rtag tu yod du zin kyang thar pa la sogs pa la dga' ba mi skye ba ni chu ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas 'tshe ba mthong yang thar pa la sogs pa la dga' ba mi skye ba ni lus mchog ma yin paüîΩzhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin rtag tu yod du zin kyang thar pa la sogs pa la dga' ba mi skye ba ni chu ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas 'tshe ba mthong yang thar pa la sogs pa la dga' ba mi skye ba ni lus mchog ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: One does not generate delight in liberation, etc., even though one sees the harm.

original: de bzhin du sgrol ba po ma yin pa dang / legs par sgrol ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa brgyad la gnod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrol ba po ma yin pa dang / legs par sgrol ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa grub pa brgyad la gnod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, there are eight faults in the eight accomplishments, such as ‚Äúnot being a liberator‚Äù and ‚Äúnot being a good liberator,‚Äù etc.

original: shes pa gang dpyad pa byas nas skye ba ma yin pa de ni sgrol ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: shes pa gang dpyad pa byas nas skye ba ma yin pa de ni sgrol ba po ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That cognition which is not generated after analysis is ‚Äúnot a liberator,‚Äù etc.

original: ji srid g-yo sgyu dang las su rung ba dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i don mi dmigs pa na rtag tu dga' ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: ji srid g-yo sgyu dang las su rung ba dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i don mi dmigs pa na rtag tu dga' ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: As long as one does not observe the meaning of deceit, craftiness, unserviceability, miserliness, etc., one is not always delighted.

original: 'di dag ni nus pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nus pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called ‚Äúnot being able.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five kinds of error are as follows:

original: mun pa dang / rmongs @229b pa dang / rmongs pa chen po dang / shin tu mun par gyur ba dang / shin tu smag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mun pa dang / rmongs @229b pa dang / rmongs pa chen po dang / shin tu mun par gyur ba dang / shin tu smag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log ces bya ba ste /
translated: Darkness, delusion, great delusion, complete darkness, and utter darkness are called ‚Äúperversions.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log gi don ston par byed pa 'di lta ste /üîΩgzhan ma yin pa la gzhan gyi blo dang / legs pa ma yin pa la legs par yang dag par sgrub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar mngon par nga rgyal ba dang / mi nus pa la nus par mngon pa rang rgyal ba dang /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi don ston par byed pa 'di lta ste / gzhan ma yin pa la gzhan gyi blo dang / legs pa ma yin pa la legs par yang dag par sgrub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar mngon par nga rgyal ba dang / mi nus pa la nus par mngon pa rang rgyal ba dang /
translated: The meaning of perversion is taught as follows:

original: mi bzod pa la bzod par yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa la bzod par yid ches pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not other but thinks it is other, the correct establishment of what is not good, the manifest pride in what is not happiness as happiness, the manifest pride in what is not possible as possible, and the confidence in what is not forbearance as forbearance.üîΩThese are called the five perversions.

original: 'di dag ni phyin ci log lnga yin par mtshan nyid lnga bcu pa las bstan te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyin ci log lnga yin par mtshan nyid lnga bcu pa las bstan te /
translated: These five perversions are taught in the Fifty Characteristics.

original: rang bzhin 'gyur ba las byung ba 'di dag thams cad kyang 'gyur ba ma yin pas zhing zhes bya ba la zhing de shes pa'i phyir skyes bu ni zhing shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gyur ba las byung ba 'di dag thams cad kyang 'gyur ba ma yin pas zhing zhes bya ba la zhing de shes pa'i phyir skyes bu ni zhing shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because he knows that field, the person is called ‚Äúone who knows the field.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is free from the characteristics of nature and transformation.

original: de dag ni bdag ste shes pa yod pa las tha dad du ma gyur pa /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag ste shes pa yod pa las tha dad du ma gyur pa /
translated: They are the self, not different from the existent consciousness.

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: They are unborn,

original: rtag pa / ma byas pa /
analyzed: rtag pa / ma byas pa /
translated: permanent, uncreated,

original: zab po // gtso bo /
analyzed: zab po // gtso bo /
translated: profound, primary,

original: khyab pa / byed pa med pa /
analyzed: khyab pa / byed pa med pa /
translated: pervading, inactive,

original: yon tan gsum las bzlog pa mi skyed pa'i chos can rkyen nye bar rnyed nas shes pa bskyed pa snying stobs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yon tan gsum las bzlog pa mi skyed pa'i chos can rkyen nye bar rnyed nas shes pa bskyed pa snying stobs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: and opposite from the three qualities. Because they are not characterized by courage, etc., which produce consciousness when conditions are obtained, they are not the qualities.

original: yon tan ma yin pa rtsom pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos can spyod pa'i phyir na yul can no //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa rtsom pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos can spyod pa'i phyir na yul can no //
translated: Because they are not the beginning of non-qualities, they are not the unborn qualities. Because they are the objects of the one who engages in them,

original: skye ba dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: they are permanent because they do not arise or decline.

original: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir rtags med pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'gyur ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir rtags med pa /
translated: because it is different from nature and modification.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir cha shas dang bral ba dang po dang tha ma med pa'i phyir mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir cha shas dang bral ba dang po dang tha ma med pa'i phyir mtha' med pa ste /
translated: It is without parts because it is one, and it is without end because it has no beginning or end.

original: 'di dag ni skyes bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skyes bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: These are the characteristics of the person.

original: yang grub pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: yang grub pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The characteristics of the philosophical schools are as follows: Perception is the engagement of the ear and so on.

original: thob par byed pa ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty is that which obtains.

original: mthong ba ni yul can no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni yul can no //
translated: Seeing is the subject.

original: lta ba po ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: lta ba po ni skyes bu'o //
translated: The seer is the person.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rdzas las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rdzas las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Form and so on are not different from substance.

original: cha shas dang // cha shas can dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dag dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid can dag ni gcig go //
analyzed: cha shas dang // cha shas can dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dag dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid can dag ni gcig go //
translated: Parts and wholes, causes and effects, characteristics and the characterized are one.üîΩThe person is the seer, the hearer, the feeler, the understander, and the knower.

original: byed pa la ni bya ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smras pa'i de kho na nyid 'di dag rim gyis goms par byas pa las /
analyzed: byed pa la ni bya ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad smras pa'i de kho na nyid 'di dag rim gyis goms par byas pa las /
translated: This reality that has been described, such as ‚ÄúAction exists for the agent,‚Äù is gradually cultivated.

original: yid las snying stobs skyes pa can //
analyzed: yid las snying stobs skyes pa can //
translated: From the mind, sattva is born.

original: skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'gyur ba'am //
translated: The reflection of the person changes,

original: de bzhin yongs su gyur nas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin yongs su gyur nas ni //
translated: or else it is transformed,

original: blo 'jug pa yi rjes su byed /
analyzed: blo 'jug pa yi rjes su byed /
translated: and the mind follows its activity.

original: @230a * // snying stobs ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid can du bstan pa'o //üîΩskyes pa ni lhag par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: @230a * // snying stobs ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid can du bstan pa'o // skyes pa ni lhag par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The nature of sattva is clarity.üîΩThe person is born, that is, it is active.

original: gang la snying stobs de skyes pa yod pa de ni yid las snying stobs skyes pa can no //
analyzed: gang la snying stobs de skyes pa yod pa de ni yid las snying stobs skyes pa can no //
translated: The person is born, that is, it is active.

original: yid kyis don rtogs par 'jug pa na rtogs pa'i gzugs brnyan skyes bu la 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ji ltar chu mi g-yo ba la zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mthong bar gyur kyang 'gyur ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du skyes bu las 'gyur ba med kyang blos yongs su shes pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan yang 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid kyis don rtogs par 'jug pa na rtogs pa'i gzugs brnyan skyes bu la 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ji ltar chu mi g-yo ba la zla ba'i gzugs brnyan mthong bar gyur kyang 'gyur ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin no // de bzhin du skyes bu las 'gyur ba med kyang blos yongs su shes pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan yang 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: When the mind is active in the understanding of an object, the reflection of the object understood appears in the person, just as the reflection of the moon appears in a pool of water that is not agitated, but never if the water is agitated.

original: gyur pa nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the reflection of the object understood appears in the person, without the person changing, but never if the person changes.

original: yang na blos don rtogs pa'i rjes su yang byed pas me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na blos don rtogs pa'i rjes su yang byed pas me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du yongs su 'gyur ba yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, it is a transformation because it is produced after the object is cognized by the mind, like a reflection in a mirror. It is not a transformation because it is not a change.

original: blo des ci zhig rtogs nas skyes bu gang zhig zla ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rjes su mthun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: blo des ci zhig rtogs nas skyes bu gang zhig zla ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rjes su mthun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: What is it that is cognized by that mind, and what person is transformed in accordance with the reflection of the moon, or in accordance with what?

original: gang gi rjes su byed par skyes bu yongs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi rjes su byed par skyes bu yongs su 'gyur ba yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: bdag kyang gzhan zhing rang bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: bdag kyang gzhan zhing rang bzhin gzhan //
translated: The self is different, and the nature is different.

original: 'di ltar de nyid mthong ba yi //üîΩbyed dang bya ba ldog pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid mthong ba yi // byed dang bya ba ldog pa yi //
translated: Thus, one who sees realityüîΩIs said to be a liberated person,

original: skyes bu grol ba yin zhes brjod //
analyzed: skyes bu grol ba yin zhes brjod //
translated: Because the doer and the deed are stopped.

original: skyes bu bcing ba gsum gyis bcings pa las thar pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni thar ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu bcing ba gsum gyis bcings pa las thar pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba ni thar ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The arising of the three kinds of liberation from the bondage of the three kinds of bondage of the person is called liberation.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i tshig gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary verses.

original: 'ching ba rnam pa gsum ni //
analyzed: 'ching ba rnam pa gsum ni //
translated: The three kinds of bondage are:

original: rang bzhin gyi 'ching ba dang / 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba dang / nor gyi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'ching ba dang / 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba dang / nor gyi 'ching ba'o //
translated: the bondage of nature, the bondage of change, and the bondage of wealth.

original: de la re zhig nor gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'am /
analyzed: de la re zhig nor gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'am /
translated: First, the fetter of wealth refers to householders,

original: tshangs par spyod pa'am /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'am /
translated: celibate practitioners,

original: nags la gnas pa la sogs pa rnams ni nor rnyed pas 'ching ba yin te /
analyzed: nags la gnas pa la sogs pa rnams ni nor rnyed pas 'ching ba yin te /
translated: and forest dwellers, who are fettered by the wealth they acquire.

original: nor brgya rnyed dam stong rnyed ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nor brgya rnyed dam stong rnyed ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: This is stated in the line, ‚ÄúWealth is acquired, whether a hundred or a thousand times.‚Äù

original: 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams blta bar 'dod pas sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri rnams kyis dbang po'i 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams blta bar 'dod pas sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang / dri rnams kyis dbang po'i 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The fetter of change refers to the fetters of those who have gone forth, because they are fettered by the changes in their faculties that occur when they desire to see, hear, smell, taste, or touch something.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi dang / dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams kyi lus gang dag gzhan dang gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi dang / dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams kyi lus gang dag gzhan dang gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The fetter of intrinsic nature refers to the bodies of gods, demigods, humans, animals, and so on, which arise with a nature that is different from one another.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / de tsam dang / dbang po'i khyad par gyi @230b mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / de tsam dang / dbang po'i khyad par gyi @230b mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, and because it has the characteristics of self-grasping, equanimity, and the sense faculties.

original: 'khor ba na yul la sred pa nyid kyis skyes bu dang rang bzhin la gcig pa nyid du rmongs pa yod la /
analyzed: 'khor ba na yul la sred pa nyid kyis skyes bu dang rang bzhin la gcig pa nyid du rmongs pa yod la /
translated: In cyclic existence, because of craving objects, there is delusion that the person and intrinsic reality are the same.

original: shes pa lhag par skyes bar gyur pa na don thams cad la yongs su ngoms par gyur pa'i phyir rang bzhin yang gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan no zhes de kho na nyid mthong ba nas la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / mig la sogs pa'i byed pa rnams ldog par 'gyur bas rang bzhin la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las skyes bu thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can ba kha cig gi yin no //
analyzed: shes pa lhag par skyes bar gyur pa na don thams cad la yongs su ngoms par gyur pa'i phyir rang bzhin yang gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan no zhes de kho na nyid mthong ba nas la sogs pa'i bya ba dang / mig la sogs pa'i byed pa rnams ldog par 'gyur bas rang bzhin la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las skyes bu thar pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can ba kha cig gi yin no //
translated: When consciousness is generated in excess, because of complete satisfaction with all objects, one sees reality, thinking, ‚ÄúIntrinsic reality is one thing and the self is another.‚Äù From that time on, the activities of such things as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the functions of the eyes and so on are stopped. Thus the person is liberated from the bondage of intrinsic reality and so on. This is the assertion of some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: yang kha cig ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i dbye ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi med rtogs pa'am //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i dbye ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi med rtogs pa'am //
translated: Some say: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya system is divided into three: the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the Yoga, and the PƒÅ≈õupata.

original: don byas pa na rjes bzung ba //
analyzed: don byas pa na rjes bzung ba //
translated: When the purpose is accomplished, it is accepted.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni grol yin phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni grol yin phyir //
translated: Because it is liberated by nature,

original: de nyid yin par grangs can smra //
analyzed: de nyid yin par grangs can smra //
translated: it is said to be reality.

original: 'di las dang po srid pa na //
analyzed: 'di las dang po srid pa na //
translated: From this, in the beginning,

original: rang bzhin gcig las skyes bus spyad par bya ba'i don rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig las skyes bus spyad par bya ba'i don rnam pa sna tshogs pa gzhan ma yin pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro ;
translated: the one nature arises. The various objects to be used by the person do not become different.

original: / grol ba'i dus na ni bdag kyang skyes bu 'di'i ma yin la /
analyzed: / grol ba'i dus na ni bdag kyang skyes bu 'di'i ma yin la /
translated: At the time of liberation, the self is not the person's,

original: skyes bu 'di yang bdag gi ma yin no zhes 'di'i de kho na nyid mthong ba skyes pa na yul gyi longs spyod ji snyed cig skyes bu la sbyin par bya ba de bdag gis byin pas des na bdag gi don byas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang bdag gi ma yin no zhes 'di'i de kho na nyid mthong ba skyes pa na yul gyi longs spyod ji snyed cig skyes bu la sbyin par bya ba de bdag gis byin pas des na bdag gi don byas pa yin zhing /
translated: and the person is not the self's. When the vision of its reality arises, the self gives to the person as much enjoyment of objects as is appropriate. Thus the purpose of the self is accomplished.

original: skyes bu la thams cad kyis rjes su bzung ba'i phyir skyes bu las rang bzhin grol ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu la thams cad kyis rjes su bzung ba'i phyir skyes bu las rang bzhin grol ba yin no //
translated: Because the person accepts everything, the person is liberated by nature from the self.

original: grangs kyi 'jug pa'am grangs yongs su shes pas grol bar 'dod pas grangs can te /
analyzed: grangs kyi 'jug pa'am grangs yongs su shes pas grol bar 'dod pas grangs can te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya are so called because they assert that one is liberated by the knowledge of the number of the twenty-five principles.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dag don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dag don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They say that such a kind of nature is ultimate.

original: 'di lta bu ni 'dir de dag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni 'dir de dag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position that they set forth.

original: de nas gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa'i phyogs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa'i phyogs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then the reply of the opponent should be stated.

original: de la gtso bo skyes bu ni //
analyzed: de la gtso bo skyes bu ni //
translated: What is the principal, the person?

original: ci ltar mi rigs las sngar bstan //
analyzed: ci ltar mi rigs las sngar bstan //
translated: How is it taught in the scriptures?

original: de yang yang 'dir brtag bya ste //
analyzed: de yang yang 'dir brtag bya ste //
translated: That also should be examined here.

original: bdag ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: I am not a knower of reality.

original: de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed bar dbang phyug dgag pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / mngon par brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed bar dbang phyug dgag pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / mngon par brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In the chapter ‚ÄúSeeking the Knowledge of Reality,‚Äù the refutation of ƒ™≈õvara is presented in terms of the refutation of his creation of the world and in terms of the refutation of his creation of the world through his mere wish.

original: gtso bo dang skyes bu dag mdor bsdus nas mi rigs par rab tu bsgrubs pa yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu dag mdor bsdus nas mi rigs par rab tu bsgrubs pa yin la /
translated: The principal and the person are briefly established as illogical.

original: rab tu byed pa 'dir ni de dag mi rigs par rgyas par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'dir ni de dag mi rigs par rgyas par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: In this chapter, they should be extensively analyzed as illogical.

original: grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the tenet of the Samkhyas.

original: rtogs pa ni @231a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni @231a * //
translated: The realization

original: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: is the nature of the person.

original: ci ltar me'i cha pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar me'i cha pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the heat of fire.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called realization?

original: shes bya rtogs pa rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: shes bya rtogs pa rtogs pa yin //
translated: Realization is the realization of the object of knowledge.

original: gang de ltar yin na skyes bu'i rtogs pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang de ltar yin na skyes bu'i rtogs pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: If it is like that, it is not tenable to call it the realization of the person.

original: rigs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what reasoning?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We say:

original: shes bya rtogs pas rtogs yin na //
analyzed: shes bya rtogs pas rtogs yin na //
translated: If realization is the realization of the object of knowledge,

original: shes bya med pas de yang med //
analyzed: shes bya med pas de yang med //
translated: then since the object of knowledge does not exist, it too does not exist.

original: rtogs pa can nam rtogs med pa //
analyzed: rtogs pa can nam rtogs med pa //
translated: Whether it has realization or is without realization,

original: 'dir ni bdag tu gang gis 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag tu gang gis 'gyur //
translated: how could it be the self in this context?

original: gal te bya ba dang byed pa la brten pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba la ltos nas yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon par rtogs pa yin pas de'i bya ba dang / byed pa ldog pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba dang byed pa la brten pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba la ltos nas yul gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon par rtogs pa yin pas de'i bya ba dang / byed pa ldog pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the realization of the nature of the object exists in dependence on the engagement of the mind that depends on the object and the agent, then the activity of the object and the agent would exist.

original: blo'i 'jug pa med pas ci zhig rtogs na rtogs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: blo'i 'jug pa med pas ci zhig rtogs na rtogs pa zhes bya /
translated: But since the engagement of the mind does not exist, what is realized? What is called realization?

original: des na thar pa'i dus na rtogs pa dang bcas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: des na thar pa'i dus na rtogs pa dang bcas pa zhig gam /
translated: Therefore, is the person at the time of liberation endowed with realization or

original: rtogs pa med pa'i skyes bu zhig yin /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'i skyes bu zhig yin /
translated: not?

original: gal te de rtogs pa can zhig yin na ni ci'i phyir shes bya mi rtogs /
analyzed: gal te de rtogs pa can zhig yin na ni ci'i phyir shes bya mi rtogs /
translated: If he is endowed with realization, why does he not realize objects of knowledge?

original: 'on te rtogs pa med pa cig yin na ni grub pa'i mtha' yang gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa med pa cig yin na ni grub pa'i mtha' yang gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: But if he is not endowed with realization, then his philosophical position would be different,

original: rang gi ngo bo yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: and his own nature would be impaired.

original: gal te yang ci ltar mes shing bsregs nas /
analyzed: gal te yang ci ltar mes shing bsregs nas /
translated: Moreover, just as fire, having burned the wood,

original: 'bar bzad cing sol bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na yang me'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ba ltar /
analyzed: 'bar bzad cing sol bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na yang me'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ba ltar /
translated: does not discard its nature of burning even in the state of being extinguished and having become embers,

original: de bzhin du skyes bu yang bya ba dang byed pa log tu zin kyang rtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dor ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu yang bya ba dang byed pa log tu zin kyang rtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dor ro zhe na /
translated: in the same way, even though the activity and agent have ceased, the person does not discard the nature of realization.

original: mi 'dra ba nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: This is a poor analogy.

original: ma bsregs sreg par mi rigs te //
analyzed: ma bsregs sreg par mi rigs te //
translated: It is illogical that what is not burned is burned,

original: bsregs pa med phyir de sngon bzhin //
analyzed: bsregs pa med phyir de sngon bzhin //
translated: because without burning it would be as it was before.

original: des na sreg byed dpe yis ni //
analyzed: des na sreg byed dpe yis ni //
translated: Therefore, the example of the burner

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid grub ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid grub ma yin //
translated: does not establish the nature of realization.

original: ci ltar du ba dang 'bar ba dang bral du zin kyang mes shing gi cha nyid kyi sol ba la sreg par byed kyi phyis thal bar gyur pa'i dus na ni sred pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang mi thob pa ltar /
analyzed: ci ltar du ba dang 'bar ba dang bral du zin kyang mes shing gi cha nyid kyi sol ba la sreg par byed kyi phyis thal bar gyur pa'i dus na ni sred pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang mi thob pa ltar /
translated: Just as when fire is separated from smoke and burning, it burns the charcoal of the wood, but when it becomes ash later, it does not obtain the name ‚Äúburning.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du skyes bu yang ji srid du shes pa yod pa de srid du rtogs pa can du rigs kyi 'dir bya ba dang byed pa gtan log par gyur ba na me nam thal bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du rtogs pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu yang ji srid du shes pa yod pa de srid du rtogs pa can du rigs kyi 'dir bya ba dang byed pa gtan log par gyur ba na me nam thal bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du rtogs pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: So too, as long as a person has consciousness, he is called ‚Äúa cognizer.‚Äù But when action and agent are completely stopped, he is not a cognizer, just as when fire becomes ash.

original: des na dpe'i sgo nas dpes bstan pa'i don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dpe'i sgo nas dpes bstan pa'i don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning indicated by the example cannot be established by the example.

original: de'i phyir re zhig grol ba'i dus na ni skyes bu rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang nyams pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig grol ba'i dus na ni skyes bu rtogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang nyams pa yin no /
translated: So the nature of a person who is liberated is also undermined.

original: @231b 'khor ba'i dus na ni /üîΩshes bya'i rnam pa 'dzin byed pas //
analyzed: @231b 'khor ba'i dus na ni / shes bya'i rnam pa 'dzin byed pas //
translated: But when he is in cyclic existence,üîΩhe is called ‚Äúa cognizer‚Äù

original: shes la rtogs pa zhes 'dod de //
analyzed: shes la rtogs pa zhes 'dod de //
translated: because he apprehends the aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: dngos po byed pa la brten phyir //
analyzed: dngos po byed pa la brten phyir //
translated: because it is based on the activity of the thing.

original: de yang skyes bu 'di la brten //
analyzed: de yang skyes bu 'di la brten //
translated: And that is based on the person.

original: grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the tenet of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya:

original: dbang po yul dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa las dbang pos don rtogs pa'i rjes su yid kyis kyang rtogs la /
analyzed: dbang po yul dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa las dbang pos don rtogs pa'i rjes su yid kyis kyang rtogs la /
translated: From the simultaneous conjunction of the sense faculty and the object, the sense faculty cognizes the object, and after that, the mind also cognizes it.

original: yid kyis rtogs pa'i don ni blos kyang nges par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis rtogs pa'i don ni blos kyang nges par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The object cognized by the mind is also ascertained by the intellect.

original: de shes bya'i rnam pas rjes su 'brang ba la rtogs pa zhes rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de shes bya'i rnam pas rjes su 'brang ba la rtogs pa zhes rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: They call that which follows the aspect of the object of cognition ‚Äúcognition.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa'i dngos po ni blo zhes bya ba'i rdzas la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dngos po ni blo zhes bya ba'i rdzas la brten pa yin te /
translated: The thing cognized is based on the substance called ‚Äúintellect.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: It is like a cloth with color.

original: des na de ni nye bar gnas ba tsam las phan ba byed pa'i skyes bu la brten pa yin par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni nye bar gnas ba tsam las phan ba byed pa'i skyes bu la brten pa yin par brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is imagined that it is based on the person who benefits it merely by its presence.

original: brtags pa byas pa yin na ni //
analyzed: brtags pa byas pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is imagined,

original: skyes bu 'gyur med rang gi yul //
analyzed: skyes bu 'gyur med rang gi yul //
translated: the person would be unchanging and its own object.

original: de dang de ni lugs 'dis 'gal //
analyzed: de dang de ni lugs 'dis 'gal //
translated: That is contradicted by this system.

original: shes las rtogs pa gzhan min pas //
analyzed: shes las rtogs pa gzhan min pas //
translated: And since there is no cognition other than consciousness,

original: ci zhig gzhan du brtag par bya //
analyzed: ci zhig gzhan du brtag par bya //
translated: What else can be imagined?

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can gzhan gyi gzugs kyi rjes su byed pa la 'dir shes pa zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can gzhan gyi gzugs kyi rjes su byed pa la 'dir shes pa zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable to call that which is a transformation of the form of another ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: skyes bu ni rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba med pa yin pas gzhan gyi gzugs su 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni rtag pa yongs su 'gyur ba med pa yin pas gzhan gyi gzugs su 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But since the person is permanent and unchanging, it does not arise as the form of another.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i tshul 'dir 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i tshul 'dir 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to establish it as having the character of consciousness.

original: des na shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming can las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba med pas shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan pa skyes bu'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming can las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba med pas shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan pa skyes bu'i rtogs pa zhes bya ba brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Thus, since there is no so-called ‚Äúcognition‚Äù other than consciousness, what is the point of imagining a so-called ‚Äúcognition of the person‚Äù that is other than consciousness?

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa nye bar bkod cing dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa nye bar bkod cing dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to set forth and refute the views of others,

original: rtogs pa blo gros ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa blo gros ma yin te /
translated: Cognition is not intelligence,

original: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan phyir bum pa bzhin //
translated: Because it has causes, like a pot.

original: des na rtogs pa shes pa min //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa shes pa min //
translated: Therefore, cognition is not consciousness.

original: gal te blo la de snyam na //
analyzed: gal te blo la de snyam na //
translated: If you think that intelligence is consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: skyes bu ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin par rigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin par rigs so //
translated: Since a person is not born and does not possess a cause, it is reasonable that the realization is not common.

original: shes pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid la sags  pa'i chos thun mong ba yin pas shes pas ni rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid la sags  pa'i chos thun mong ba yin pas shes pas ni rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Since consciousness possesses a cause, the qualities of being produced, etc., are common. Therefore, consciousness is not the realization,üîΩbecause it follows that even a pot, etc., would be the realization.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur pas so zhes gal te gzhan de snyam du sems par gyur na //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur pas so zhes gal te gzhan de snyam du sems par gyur na //
translated: If you think this,

original: de la 'di skad du /üîΩrtogs las shes pa gzhan yin par //
analyzed: de la 'di skad du / rtogs las shes pa gzhan yin par //
translated: then this is said:

original: sgrub byed ce @232a * //
analyzed: sgrub byed ce @232a * //
translated: If you prove that consciousness is different from the realization,

original: na dpe yang med //
analyzed: na dpe yang med //
translated: then there is no example.

original: shes pa'ang de dngos med ce na //
analyzed: shes pa'ang de dngos med ce na //
translated: If you say that consciousness is not that entity,

original: khas blangs pa yis gnod pa yin //
analyzed: khas blangs pa yis gnod pa yin //
translated: then you are undermined by your own assertion.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa shes pa las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa shes pa las gzhan yin te /

original: dpe ci lta bu zhig yod /
analyzed: dpe ci lta bu zhig yod /

analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir gzhan yin par mi 'grub bo //

original: skyes bu ni rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'jug par bya ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par yongs su 'gyur ba'i shes pa 'jug pa'i dbye ba med par spyod pa la nye bar brtags nas rtogs pa yod do zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'jug par bya ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par yongs su 'gyur ba'i shes pa 'jug pa'i dbye ba med par spyod pa la nye bar brtags nas rtogs pa yod do zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you think that the cognition that is the transformation of the aspect of the object to be engaged is understood through the examination of engagement without the differentiation of the engagement of cognition, then that is not so.üîΩThe difference in the engagement of cognition

original: blo yi 'jug pa'i khyad par ni //üîΩgang phyir shes la 'jug 'dod na'ang //
analyzed: blo yi 'jug pa'i khyad par ni // gang phyir shes la 'jug 'dod na'ang //
translated: is not established by the cognition of one thing.üîΩIf you think that the difference in the engagement of cognition is established by the cognition of one thing, then that is not so.
