original: skyes bu ni nye bar brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba shes pa gcig la khyad par yod par gang las ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes bu ni nye bar brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba shes pa gcig la khyad par yod par gang las ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you think that the difference in the engagement of cognition is established by the cognition of one thing, then that is not so.

original: gal te bdag gi blo gang yang //üîΩla lar ji bzhin don du 'dod //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi blo gang yang //üîΩla lar ji bzhin don du 'dod //
translated: If you think that the difference in the engagement of cognition is established by the cognition of one thing

original: la lar de las bzlog nyid de //
analyzed: la lar de las bzlog nyid de //
translated: For some, it is just the opposite.

original: mtho la mtho yi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mtho la mtho yi blo bzhin no //
translated: Like the idea of height in relation to height.

original: ji ltar mtho yor rdo dang shing la sogs pa la 'khrul bas phyin ci log tu skyes bu'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar mtho yor rdo dang shing la sogs pa la 'khrul bas phyin ci log tu skyes bu'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Just as, in relation to a post, a rock, a tree, etc., the idea of a person arises mistakenly, in an erroneous way,

original: 'khrul pa dang bral bar gyur pa na mtho yor nyid yin gyi 'di ni skyes bu ma yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par @232b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang bral bar gyur pa na mtho yor nyid yin gyi 'di ni skyes bu ma yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par @232b 'gyur ro //
translated: and when one is free from error, one understands correctly, just as it is, that it is a post, not a person.

original: de bzhin du blo la sogs pa la 'khrul pas shes pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo la sogs pa la 'khrul pas shes pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs par byed la /
translated: In the same way, through error, one understands consciousness, etc., in relation to the intellect, etc.

original: de kho na nyid mthong na ni skyes bu ji lta ba bzhin gyi don ni rtogs pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong na ni skyes bu ji lta ba bzhin gyi don ni rtogs pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But when one sees reality, one understands that the object is just as it is, like the person.

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we reply:

original: la lar ji ltar ji bzhin don //
analyzed: la lar ji ltar ji bzhin don //
translated: If it is just as it is in some cases,

original: zhe na kun rdzob grub pa sgrub /
analyzed: zhe na kun rdzob grub pa sgrub /
translated: then the establishment of the conventional is established.

original: ji bzhin don gyi sems kyi yul //
analyzed: ji bzhin don gyi sems kyi yul //
translated: The object of the mind that is just as it is

original: bdag ces bya bar bdag cag 'dod //
analyzed: bdag ces bya bar bdag cag 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the self.

original: sems kyi yul gyi blo la bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar tha snyad kyi bden pa'i tshul du kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi yul gyi blo la bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar tha snyad kyi bden pa'i tshul du kho bo cag gis kyang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: We also assert that the mind that is the object of the mind is called the self in the manner of conventional truth.

original: khyad par med pa'i blos don ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sgrub na ni grub pa sgrub pa yin no //üîΩci ste kun la khyab sogs kyi //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i blos don ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sgrub na ni grub pa sgrub pa yin no // ci ste kun la khyab sogs kyi //
translated: If the mind that is not distinguished establishes the object as it is, then it would be the establishment of what is already established.üîΩIf the mind that is characterized by pervading all,

original: mtshan nyid can blo don bzhin na //üîΩde nyid du'am kun rdzob tu'ang //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can blo don bzhin na // de nyid du'am kun rdzob tu'ang //
translated: and so on, is as the object is,üîΩthen there is no example

original: dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: of that in reality or in the conventional.

original: blo gang la rtag pa khyab pa byed pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba de ni don dam pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: blo gang la rtag pa khyab pa byed pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba de ni don dam pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The mind that is characterized by being permanent, pervasive, and devoid of activity is the ultimate object as it is,

original: blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is a mind.

original: dper na ji lta bu zhig ces byas na /üîΩdpe med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dam /
analyzed: dper na ji lta bu zhig ces byas na / dpe med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid dam /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù

original: kun rdzob tu yang sems las ma gtogs pa'i bdag sgrub tu med pas blo de bsgrib par byed pa'i dpe ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang sems las ma gtogs pa'i bdag sgrub tu med pas blo de bsgrib par byed pa'i dpe ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because there is no example, there is no example that obscures that mind, whether in reality or in the conventional, because a self that is not included in the mind is not established.

original: des na rna ba gnyis ka ltar yang bdag gi blo grub pa med pas rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rna ba gnyis ka ltar yang bdag gi blo grub pa med pas rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of the self is not established in either of the two ears, its own nature is impaired.

original: gang yang rang bzhin dang skyes bu tha dad du mthong na thar pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang /üîΩrtogs pa med pas rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin dang skyes bu tha dad du mthong na thar pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang / rtogs pa med pas rtogs pa ni //
translated: Now, for one who asserts that liberation is the seeing of the difference between the nature and the person,üîΩsince the nature is not cognized,

original: rang bzhin rtogs pa med pa'am //
analyzed: rang bzhin rtogs pa med pa'am //
translated: the nature is not cognized.

original: gang gis de nyid shes skye bas //
analyzed: gang gis de nyid shes skye bas //
translated: By what is the knowledge of reality produced?

original: gang zhig grol bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gang zhig grol bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: By whom is one liberated?

original: re zhig rang bzhin ni rtogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan mthong ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rang bzhin ni rtogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan mthong ba med pa yin no //
translated: First, since the nature is not cognized, it is not seen by another.

original: skyes bu yang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa la sngar gcig nyid du mngon bar zhen pa las tha dad nyid du mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: skyes bu yang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa la sngar gcig nyid du mngon bar zhen pa las tha dad nyid du mthong bar gyur na /
translated: Also, the person is not liberated, because if the person is an unchanging phenomenon, and if, having previously conceived of it as one, one sees it as different,

original: 'gyur ba dbyung ba yin pas blo gzhan yang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dbyung ba yin pas blo gzhan yang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then it would be changeable. Therefore, since another cognition does not arise,

original: skyes bu las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du brjod pa'i de kho na nyid 'ga' zhig la shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang la thar pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan du brjod pa'i de kho na nyid 'ga' zhig la shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang la thar pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: apart from the person, there is no other reality that is said to be the object of cognition, and there is no such thing as ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar skyes bu ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir blo gzhan dag ji lta ba de ltar 'byung yod pa ma yin no //üîΩrang bzhin ni rtogs pa @233a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir blo gzhan dag ji lta ba de ltar 'byung yod pa ma yin no // rang bzhin ni rtogs pa @233a * //
translated: Thus, the person is the nature of cognition, and it is not like other cognitions.

original: med pa'i phyir gzhan pa'i blo ye med pa yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir gzhan pa'i blo ye med pa yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Since the nature is not cognition, it is said that other cognitions do not exist at all.

original: rtogs pas 'dzin par byed pa na //
analyzed: rtogs pas 'dzin par byed pa na //
translated: Since cognition apprehends,

original: bdag ni 'di ltar zhes sogs nges //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di ltar zhes sogs nges //
translated: it is ascertained as ‚ÄúI am like this.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa med phyir gzhan mi rigs //
analyzed: rtogs pa med phyir gzhan mi rigs //
translated: Since there is no cognition, it is not reasonable for there to be another.

original: de med gyur na yang ci zhig / gang yang re zhig rang bzhin dang // skyes bu dag longs spyod dang spyod pa po'i ngo bor gcig pa nyid du yod pa de'i tshe yang rang bzhin ni bdag go zhes bya ba'i shes par skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de med gyur na yang ci zhig / gang yang re zhig rang bzhin dang // skyes bu dag longs spyod dang spyod pa po'i ngo bor gcig pa nyid du yod pa de'i tshe yang rang bzhin ni bdag go zhes bya ba'i shes par skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: Even if the self and the person were to exist as identical with the nature of the enjoyer and the experiencer, it would still be illogical to generate the cognition ‚Äúthe nature is the self.‚Äù

original: shin tu rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang tha dad du mthong ba na ni skyes bus 'dzin pa'i ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // yang tha dad du mthong ba na ni skyes bus 'dzin pa'i ldog pa yin te /
translated: Because it is not at all understood.üîΩMoreover, when they are seen to be different, the cognition ‚Äúthe person is not the self‚Äù and ‚Äúthe self is not the person‚Äù would arise, because the person is the opposite of the self.

original: bdag kyang skyes bus ma yin la skyes bu yang bdag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag kyang skyes bus ma yin la skyes bu yang bdag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: What cognition would arise?

original: des na 'di ni shin tu mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni shin tu mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore this is completely illogical.

original: 'di yi ldog pa'ang rigs min te //
analyzed: 'di yi ldog pa'ang rigs min te //
translated: It is also illogical that they are not different.

original: mang po dag dang thun mong phyir //
analyzed: mang po dag dang thun mong phyir //
translated: Because they are common to many.

original: ji ltar rje gcig shi gyur kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar rje gcig shi gyur kyang //
translated: Just as when one master dies,

original: tshogs pa dag gi bran bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: tshogs pa dag gi bran bzhin 'dod //
translated: the servants are still considered to belong to the master.

original: longs spyod nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i rang bzhin ni dang po srid pa'i tshu rol du skyes bus nye bar spyad pas bdag gi don byas zin to zhes ldog par 'gyur ba na rang bzhin ni gcig cig yin la /
analyzed: longs spyod nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i rang bzhin ni dang po srid pa'i tshu rol du skyes bus nye bar spyad pas bdag gi don byas zin to zhes ldog par 'gyur ba na rang bzhin ni gcig cig yin la /
translated: The nature that is said to be the enjoyer has already fulfilled its purpose for the self by being used by the person in this life.

original: skyes bu ni mang po yin pas des na 'dir skyes bu gcig las grol du zin kyang thams cad du grol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni mang po yin pas des na 'dir skyes bu gcig las grol du zin kyang thams cad du grol ba ma yin te /
translated: When it is reversed, the nature is one, but the persons are many. Therefore, even if one person is liberated here, all are not liberated,

original: skyes bu mang pos thun mong du bcings pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu mang pos thun mong du bcings pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are bound in common by many persons.

original: skyes bu gcig shi bas de la brtse pa dang bral du zin kyang de las gzhan pa 'tsho ba'i skyes bu dag las grol ba med do //
analyzed: skyes bu gcig shi bas de la brtse pa dang bral du zin kyang de las gzhan pa 'tsho ba'i skyes bu dag las grol ba med do //
translated: Even if one person dies and is separated from affection for that person, there is no liberation from the other living persons.

original: skyes bu grol ba la yang skyon 'di yod de /
analyzed: skyes bu grol ba la yang skyon 'di yod de /
translated: This fault also applies to the liberation of the person.

original: tha dad yul la ma bsgribs phyir //üîΩji ltar bdag gis dbye ba las //
analyzed: tha dad yul la ma bsgribs phyir // ji ltar bdag gis dbye ba las //
translated: Because the objects are not obscured by the different ones,üîΩhow is it that the person sees reality

original: skyes bu'i yid la snying stobs dag / lhag pas de nyid mthong bar 'dod //
analyzed: skyes bu'i yid la snying stobs dag / lhag pas de nyid mthong bar 'dod //
translated: by the predominance of the sattva in the mind?

original: grangs can pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di yin te /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i grub pa'i mtha' 'di yin te /
translated: This is the tenet of the Samkhyas.

original: lha dang lha ma yin dang / mi dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba rnams kyi so so'i lus re re la yang skyes bu gnas shing skyes bu de thams cad kyang thams cad la khyab pa yin no zhes zer la /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin dang / mi dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba rnams kyi so so'i lus re re la yang skyes bu gnas shing skyes bu de thams cad kyang thams cad la khyab pa yin no zhes zer la /
translated: They say that in the body of each being of the various realms of gods, demigods, humans, and animals, a purusha resides, and that purusha pervades all.

original: skyes bu de dag grol bar 'gyur ba na phyogs gcig tsam las ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu de dag grol bar 'gyur ba na phyogs gcig tsam las ji ltar yin te /
translated: If those purushas were liberated, how could it be that only one is liberated?

original: gang gi phyir snying stobs lhag par gyur pa'i yid sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur nas de @233b dag las skyes bu gcig grol bar gyur pa na skyes bu thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying stobs lhag par gyur pa'i yid sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur nas de @233b dag las skyes bu gcig grol bar gyur pa na skyes bu thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because when the mind, which is predominant in sattva, becomes free from obscuration, then all purushas would be liberated.

original: skyes bu gzhan thams cad ni bcings nas gnas la /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan thams cad ni bcings nas gnas la /
translated: All other purushas would remain bound.

original: gcig cig grol bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig cig grol bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could one be liberated?

original: yul tha mi dad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul tha mi dad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is not different.

original: skyes bu grol bar mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skyes bu grol bar mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it illogical that a purusha is liberated,

original: gzhan yang / sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa dang // de bzhin chos dang chos min dag / skyon ni rjes su mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sgra la sogs pa rtogs pa dang // de bzhin chos dang chos min dag / skyon ni rjes su mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: would be the same for all,

original: ma mthong nges pa med pa'ang yin //
analyzed: ma mthong nges pa med pa'ang yin //
translated: and liberation would be uncertain.

original: sgra la sogs pa la rna pa la sogs pa 'jug pa de dag kyang skyes bu thams cad kyi gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur la //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la rna pa la sogs pa 'jug pa de dag kyang skyes bu thams cad kyi gcig pa nyid thob par 'gyur la //
translated: The engagement of the ear and so on in sound and so on would be the same for all persons.

original: gcig gis chos spyad par gyur pa na skyes bu thams cad kyang chos la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gcig gis chos spyad par gyur pa na skyes bu thams cad kyang chos la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When one person engages in Dharma, all persons would abide in Dharma.

original: gcig chos ma yin pa la zhugs pa na thams cad kyang chos ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig chos ma yin pa la zhugs pa na thams cad kyang chos ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one person engages in non-Dharma, all would possess non-Dharma.

original: des na nam mthong ba'i thar ba la yang nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na nam mthong ba'i thar ba la yang nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, liberation would be uncertain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yul la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnam mkha'i phyogs gcig la mun pa dang snang ba gnyis sam /
analyzed: yul la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro // nam mkha'i phyogs gcig la mun pa dang snang ba gnyis sam /
translated: Because there is no division of objects.üîΩIt is illogical for both darkness and light to exist in one part of space,

original: char 'bab pa dang tshas gnyis mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: char 'bab pa dang tshas gnyis mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: or for both rain and frost to exist at the same time.

original: skyes bus thams cad du khyab pa yin na skyon 'di yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bus thams cad du khyab pa yin na skyon 'di yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the person pervades all, this error would arise:

original: thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyang 'gro ba thams cad kyi ngo bor gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyang 'gro ba thams cad kyi ngo bor gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: because it pervades all, everything would be the nature of all transmigrators.

original: bdag rnams kyang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rnams kyang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the selves would be mixed.

original: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo rnams kyang thun mong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo rnams kyang thun mong du 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodies, faculties, and cognitions would be common.

original: gcig gis bya ba byas pa de gzhan gyis kyang byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gis bya ba byas pa de gzhan gyis kyang byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one performs an action, the other would also perform it.

original: gcig gis bya ba thams cad spangs pa na thams cad kyis kyang bya ba spang par 'gyur ro //üîΩbram ze rnams kyi las ni 'di'o //
analyzed: gcig gis bya ba thams cad spangs pa na thams cad kyis kyang bya ba spang par 'gyur ro // bram ze rnams kyi las ni 'di'o //
translated: When one abandons all actions, all would abandon them.

original: dmangs ris kyi las ni 'di'o zhes bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmangs ris kyi las ni 'di'o zhes bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no such distinctions as ‚Äúthis is the work of a Brahmin,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúthis is the work of a warrior,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is the work of a merchant,‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is the work of a laborer.‚Äù

original: rigs bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The classification of the four castes would not exist.

original: pha dang / bu dang / dgra dang / pha mar gnas pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: pha dang / bu dang / dgra dang / pha mar gnas pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: There would be no such distinctions as ‚Äúfather,‚Äù ‚Äúson,‚Äù ‚Äúenemy,‚Äù and ‚Äúfriend.‚Äù

original: gang yang skyes bu ni blo 'jug pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu ni blo 'jug pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not established that the person is the substratum of the mind‚Äôs activity, as you maintain.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why?

original: gal te skyes bu 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you say that the person changes,

original: skyes bu rtogs pa med pa dang // rgyu med khyab pa ma yin te //
analyzed: skyes bu rtogs pa med pa dang // rgyu med khyab pa ma yin te //
translated: then the person would be without understanding, without a cause, and not all-pervading,

original: skyes bu 'gyur phyir 'o ma bzhin //üîΩskyes bu ni @234a * //
analyzed: skyes bu 'gyur phyir 'o ma bzhin // skyes bu ni @234a * //
translated: because of changing, like milk.

original: rtogs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa can ma yin te /
translated: The person is not endowed with understanding,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: because it changes, like milk.

original: skyes bu ni rgyu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni rgyu med pa ma yin te /
translated: The person is not without a cause,

original: 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: because it changes, like milk.

original: skyes bu ni thams cad la khyab ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni thams cad la khyab ba ma yin te /
translated: The person is not all-pervading,

original: 'o ma bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o ma bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it changes, like milk.

original: gang rnams skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung bas grol bar 'dod pa de la yang /
analyzed: gang rnams skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung bas grol bar 'dod pa de la yang /
translated: Those who maintain that the person is liberated because it is the substratum of the arising of the reflection of the person,

original: sems ni 'gyur ba med na yang //
analyzed: sems ni 'gyur ba med na yang //
translated: even though the mind does not change,

original: gzugs brnyan gyi ni rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi ni rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of the reflection,

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldan par //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldan par //
translated: are subject to the fault stated above,

original: 'byung ste gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: 'byung ste gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: like the reflection of a face.

original: ji ltar gdong gi gzugs chu la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyur nye bar gnas kyang yongs su 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar gdong gi gzugs chu la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyur nye bar gnas kyang yongs su 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the face, the cause of the arising of a reflection in water, etc., does not change at all,

original: sems kyi rtogs pa yang shes pas bltas pa'i don gyis gzugs brnyan nye bar gnas pa tsam phan par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nye bar gnas na yang yongs su gyur pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni pha rol po'i 'dod pa yin
analyzed: sems kyi rtogs pa yang shes pas bltas pa'i don gyis gzugs brnyan nye bar gnas pa tsam phan par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nye bar gnas na yang yongs su gyur pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni pha rol po'i 'dod pa yin
translated: so too, the object of the mind, the cause of the arising of the cognition, is present as the nature of the cause of the benefit of the mere presence of the reflection, but it does not change at all. This is what the opponent asserts.

original: no // 'dir yang gzugs brnyan bzhin du rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyi skyes bu ni gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du rtogs pa med pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid dang / khyab pa ma yin pas chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i don du gnas pa nyid yin no 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: no // 'dir yang gzugs brnyan bzhin du rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyi skyes bu ni gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du rtogs pa med pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid dang / khyab pa ma yin pas chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i don du gnas pa nyid yin no 'di ltar yang /
translated: Here too, just like a reflection, the person who is the cause of the arising of the cognition is not the cognition, is not the cause, and is not pervasive. Therefore, because it is the opposite of the nature of the subject, it is the opposite of the cause of the arising of the reflection.

original: skyes bu rtog pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyes bu rtog pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the person is not a concept,

original: bdag dang gzhan zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan zhes mi rigs so //
translated: it is not tenable to say ‚Äúself‚Äù or ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: brtags na skyon med ce na yang //
analyzed: brtags na skyon med ce na yang //
translated: Even if there were no error in conceptualizing,

original: grol ba btags pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: grol ba btags pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: liberation would be a mere designation.

original: bya ba dang byed pa log pa yin pas 'di'i yul nye bar gnas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa log pa yin pas 'di'i yul nye bar gnas pa ma yin na /
translated: Since the object of the person is not present, because the action and agent are negated,

original: ci zhig la rtog par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci zhig la rtog par byed par 'gyur //
translated: what is it that conceptualizes?

original: rtog pa med pa'i skyes bu yang ji ltar na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i skyes bu yang ji ltar na /
translated: How could the person who is not a concept

original: bdag dang gzhan zhes rtog pa 'jug pa nyid yin /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan zhes rtog pa 'jug pa nyid yin /
translated: engage in conceptualizing ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúother‚Äù?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa med du zin na yang blo la rnam par rtog pas bdag tu btags pa nyid kyis nye bar btags pa dang btags pa pa yin no zhe na /üîΩgrol ba yang nye bar btags pa dang btags pa pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa med du zin na yang blo la rnam par rtog pas bdag tu btags pa nyid kyis nye bar btags pa dang btags pa pa yin no zhe na / grol ba yang nye bar btags pa dang btags pa pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Even if there were no conceptualization, the person would be a mere designation as self by conceptual thought, and would be a mere designation.üîΩIf liberation were a mere designation,

original: grol ba ni dngos nyid du 'dod kyi nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grol ba ni dngos nyid du 'dod kyi nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
translated: liberation would be a mere designation, but liberation is asserted to be real, not a mere designation.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin yang ma yin la skyes bu yang ma yin pas grol bar btags pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin yang ma yin la skyes bu yang ma yin pas grol bar btags pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is neither intrinsic nature nor person, it is not correct to designate it as liberated.

original: kho bo ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du yang mi 'dod pas re zhig de brtag par bya ba yin na bcings pa dang thar ba lta ga la @234b yod ces brjod pa na gzhan gyis de yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nye barüîΩbkod pa ni /üîΩgtso bo yod de sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: kho bo ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du yang mi 'dod pas re zhig de brtag par bya ba yin na bcings pa dang thar ba lta ga la @234b yod ces brjod pa na gzhan gyis de yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bkod pa ni / gtso bo yod de sna tshogs kyi //
translated: When we say that since we do not assert intrinsic nature to exist, then how could there be bondage and liberation, then the opponent presents a proof that it does exist:üîΩThe primal substance exists becauseüîΩof the conformity of diversity,

original: rjes su 'gro phyir yongs gyur phyir //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro phyir yongs gyur phyir //
translated: because of transformation,

original: bya dang byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: bya dang byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: because of the nature of agent and action,

original: nus phyir sna tshogs ngo bo'i phyir //üîΩji skad smras pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: nus phyir sna tshogs ngo bo'i phyir // ji skad smras pa de bzhin te //
translated: because of potentiality, and because of diversity.

original: snod chag pa yi du ma sogs ltar ;
analyzed: snod chag pa yi du ma sogs ltar ;
translated: Just as a broken pot does not exist as a pot,

original: / de bzhin dbye ba de dang ldan //
analyzed: / de bzhin dbye ba de dang ldan //
translated: so too it has that distinction.

original: des na dbye ba rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: des na dbye ba rgyu dang bcas //
translated: Therefore the distinction has a cause.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa rnams cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba ni gtso bo ste chos can no //
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa rnams cha mnyam pa mi gsal ba ni gtso bo ste chos can no //
translated: The primal substance is the subject. Sattva, rajas, and tamas in equal proportion is the unmanifest, the primal substance.

original: de yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i chos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The existence of that is the property of that, which is the probandum.

original: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
translated: The combination of the property and the subject is the position.

original: sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa lnga ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa lnga ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The five, such as the pervasion of diversity, are the reason.

original: aa bi ta zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: aa bi ta zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: It is called the avita.

original: de la sna tshogs thams cad la rang bzhin gyis rjes su khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la sna tshogs thams cad la rang bzhin gyis rjes su khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Therein, the pervasion of all diversity by nature is the pervasion.

original: sna tshogs kun kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kun kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all diversity is of the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: yang yongs su 'gyur ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin na yang rang bzhin las chen po byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang yongs su 'gyur ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin na yang rang bzhin las chen po byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, although the transformation is not a property of transformation, the great one arises from nature.

original: chen po las ngar 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po las ngar 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: From the great one, the nature of the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù arises.

original: ngar 'dzin ba las de tsam gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin ba las de tsam gyi rnam par ro //
translated: From the grasping of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the form of that much arises.

original: de tsam las dbang po'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de tsam las dbang po'i rnam par ro //
translated: From that much, the form of the sense faculties arises.

original: dbang po las 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the sense faculties, the nature of the great elements arises.

original: gtso bo ni rtsa ba'i byed pa po'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni rtsa ba'i byed pa po'o //
translated: The principal is the primary agent.

original: chen po dang ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni bya ba yang yin byed pa yang yin te yongs su 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po dang ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni bya ba yang yin byed pa yang yin te yongs su 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great one, the I-maker, etc., are both action and agent, because they are of the nature of transformation.

original: yang nus pa ni rang bzhin ni skyes pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs thams cad bskyed par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: yang nus pa ni rang bzhin ni skyes pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs thams cad bskyed par nus pa yin la /
translated: Or, the nature of the potential is the quality of being born, and so it is capable of producing all the variety.

original: chen po la sogs pa rnams la ni so so'i bya ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas yin no //
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa rnams la ni so so'i bya ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yod pas yin no //
translated: The great one, etc., have the potential to produce their respective actions.

original: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ni chen po dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / de tsam dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par rnam pa du ma nyid do //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ni chen po dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / de tsam dang / dbang po dang / 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par rnam pa du ma nyid do //
translated: The nature of the variety is the many forms of the great one, the I-maker, the just so, the sense organs, and the special great elements.

original: ji ltar sa bon las myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phre'u dang / lo ma dang / me tog la sogs pa du ma zhig kun du 'byung la /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon las myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phre'u dang / lo ma dang / me tog la sogs pa du ma zhig kun du 'byung la /
translated: From the seed, many things such as the sprout, the stem, the branches, the twigs, the leaves, the flowers, etc., come into being.

original: de rnams kyi byed pa po ni sa bon gcig yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byed pa po ni sa bon gcig yin no //
translated: The seed is the single agent of all of them.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo mi gsal ba gcig la dbye ba du ma yin pas des na byed pa po gcig yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo mi gsal ba gcig la dbye ba du ma yin pas des na byed pa po gcig yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, since there are many divisions in the single, unmanifest primal substance, it should be understood that there is a single agent.

original: ji skad smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyab pa nges pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyab pa nges pa ston pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The words ‚Äújust as you have stated‚Äù and so on indicate the certainty of the pervasion.

original: gang dang gang @235a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang @235a * //
translated: Whatever is

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dang / bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo dang / nus pa dang / sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yod pa de dang de ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dang / bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo dang / nus pa dang / sna tshogs kyi ngo bo yod pa de dang de ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: pervasive, mutable, functional, active, capable, and of various natures has a cause.

original: dper na / snod chag pa'i dum bu bzhin no //üîΩbum pa chag pa'i dum bu thams cad kyi rjes su sa nyid 'gro ba yod la /
analyzed: dper na / snod chag pa'i dum bu bzhin no // bum pa chag pa'i dum bu thams cad kyi rjes su sa nyid 'gro ba yod la /
translated: For example, it is like the fragments of a broken pot.üîΩThe nature of earth pervades all the fragments of a broken pot.

original: tsandan gyi dum bu la yang dri nyid rjes su 'gro ba lta bu ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: tsandan gyi dum bu la yang dri nyid rjes su 'gro ba lta bu ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'o //
translated: The nature of fragrance pervades all fragments of sandalwood. This is the certainty of pervasion.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ni bum pa gyo dum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid dang / tsandan dum bur gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ni bum pa gyo dum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid dang / tsandan dum bur gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: Transformation is the transformation of a pot into the state of potsherds, and the transformation of sandalwood into pieces.

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo ni bum pa ni gyo dum gyi byed pa po yin la tsandan yang dum bu'i yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i ngo bo ni bum pa ni gyo dum gyi byed pa po yin la tsandan yang dum bu'i yin no //
translated: The nature of action and agent is that a pot is the agent of potsherds, and sandalwood is the agent of pieces.

original: nus pa yang bum pas gyo dum skyed pa dang / tsandan gyis dum bu mngon bar sgrub par nus pa'o //üîΩyang sna tshogs kyi ngo bo ni bum pa'am /
analyzed: nus pa yang bum pas gyo dum skyed pa dang / tsandan gyis dum bu mngon bar sgrub par nus pa'o // yang sna tshogs kyi ngo bo ni bum pa'am /
translated: Potency is the ability of a pot to produce potsherds and the ability of sandalwood to manifest pieces.

original: tsandan gyi sdong po gcig las du ma dang du ma'i rnam pa can gyi gyo du ma dang / tsandan gyi dum bu la sogs par 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba bzhin du bsgrub bya rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tsandan gyi sdong po gcig las du ma dang du ma'i rnam pa can gyi gyo du ma dang / tsandan gyi dum bu la sogs par 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba bzhin du bsgrub bya rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
translated: Again, the nature of variety is that from a single pot or sandalwood trunk, many potsherds and pieces of various kinds arise.üîΩThus, the pervasion is ascertained.

original: de bzhin du dbye ba de dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbye ba de dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the pervasion, etc. are stated in the phrase endowed with that division, etc.

original: 'di ni nye bar sbyor ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar sbyor ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of application.

original: de lta bas na dbye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the divisions are with cause.

original: 'di ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the summary.

original: 'di lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi cha lnga po 'di ni grangs can gyis nye bar bkod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi cha lnga po 'di ni grangs can gyis nye bar bkod pa yin la /
translated: These five parts of the proof statement are set forth by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: 'di dag sun dbyung ba smras pa ni /üîΩdbye rnams rgyu dang cas nyid du //
analyzed: 'di dag sun dbyung ba smras pa ni / dbye rnams rgyu dang cas nyid du //
translated: The refutation of these is stated:üîΩIf you prove the divisions

original: sgrub byed ce na grub pa sgrub //
analyzed: sgrub byed ce na grub pa sgrub //
translated: are with cause, you prove what is already established.

original: kun la chags par ma grub ste //
analyzed: kun la chags par ma grub ste //
translated: It is not established for all,

original: 'di ni gtan tshig ma grub phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshig ma grub phyir //
translated: because this reason is not established.

original: gal te khyod kyi bsam pas chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi bsam pas chen po la sogs pa'i dbye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If you think that the divisions of Mahat and so on are with cause,

original: gang rgyu 'ga' zhig las yin no zhe na grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyu 'ga' zhig las yin no zhe na grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: because they are from some cause, you prove what is already established.

original: kho bo cag kyang dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las yang dag par 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: We also say that all things arise from causes and conditions,

original: dngos po rgyu med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu med par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that things are without cause.

original: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni yang sangs rgyas pa la grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni yang sangs rgyas pa la grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The reasonings of ‚Äúhaving a common locus‚Äù and so on are also not established for the Buddhist.

original: rang bzhin gcig grub par gyur na ni de dang ldan pa yang 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig grub par gyur na ni de dang ldan pa yang 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If a single nature were established, then that which possesses it would also be established.

original: kho bo cag la ni rang bzhin de ma grub par shes te /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni rang bzhin de ma grub par shes te /
translated: But for us, that nature is not established.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: Because it is unclear, it is like the horns of a rabbit and so on.

original: gang @235b zhig gang dang ji ltar ldan par 'gyur zhes gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang @235b zhig gang dang ji ltar ldan par 'gyur zhes gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: So how could it be said that something possesses something else?

original: yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la yang skyon 'di nyid kyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la yang skyon 'di nyid kyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: The reasonings of ‚Äútransformation‚Äù and so on are also refuted by this very fault.

original: de nas yang gal te spyi sngon du song ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas yang gal te spyi sngon du song ba yod pa yin te /
translated: If you say that a prior universal exists,

original: spyi dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it possesses a universal,

original: spyi la khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar gyi gtso bo'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: spyi la khyad par med pa'i phyir sngar gyi gtso bo'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: or because there is no difference between a universal and a particular, like the prior state of prakriti,

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: then we will respond to that.

original: spyi ni sngon du song 'dod de //
analyzed: spyi ni sngon du song 'dod de //
translated: You assert that the universal precedes,

original: spyi dang ldan pa'i phyir zhe na //üîΩspyi nyid dam ni khyad par la //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa'i phyir zhe na // spyi nyid dam ni khyad par la //
translated: because it possesses the particular.üîΩBut the universal itself is not an example,

original: snga ma bzhin du dpe yang med //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dpe yang med //
translated: just like the particular.

original: 'dir khyod kyi sgrub pa 'di la dpe med de /
analyzed: 'dir khyod kyi sgrub pa 'di la dpe med de /
translated: Here, your proof has no example.

original: gtso bo bde ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa gzhan pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa la dpe bsten par mi nus pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gtso bo bde ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa gzhan pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa la dpe bsten par mi nus pa nyid dam /
translated: It is not possible to cite an example for the proof of the existence of something else, such as the primal substance, which is the nature of all things such as pleasure.üîΩOr, it is not established for the other party.

original: gzhan la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu byed pa'i phyed phyogs snga mar byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu byed pa'i phyed phyogs snga mar byas nas /
translated: The first half of the chapter is the opponent‚Äôs position,

original: phyed phyi mas lan rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyed phyi mas lan rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: and the second half is the reply.

original: thun mong la thun mong zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi dbye ba med pas snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: thun mong la thun mong zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi dbye ba med pas snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Just like the primal substance, the universal is not a distinct category that is shared by many, because it does not exist.

original: gtso bo bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Just like the primal substance, it does not exist as something that is shared.

original: gang khyod spyi sngon du song ba'i sgrub par nus pa'i dpe yang cung zhig kyang med do //
analyzed: gang khyod spyi sngon du song ba'i sgrub par nus pa'i dpe yang cung zhig kyang med do //
translated: You have not provided the slightest example of a proof that the universal precedes.

original: snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Even the fragments of a broken pot, etc., are not different from it, since they have the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: khyod dpe med do zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i tshig ma smra cig / bdag cag gi phyogs la gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpe yod do //
analyzed: khyod dpe med do zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i tshig ma smra cig / bdag cag gi phyogs la gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpe yod do //
translated: Therefore, do not say, ‚ÄúYour example does not exist,‚Äù because we have an example that is established for both parties.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi ngo bo'i phung po ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi ngo bo'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregates that have the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhe na /
translated: They are aggregates because they are like the aggregate of feeling.

original: 'di la yang brjod par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩbde la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod par bya ba'i phyir / bde la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin mi 'dod //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin mi 'dod //
translated: We do not accept that they are like the aggregate of feelingüîΩbecause they have the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: phung po yin phyir bde sdug sogs //
analyzed: phung po yin phyir bde sdug sogs //
translated: Because they are aggregates, pleasure, pain, etc.,

original: so sor ma nges pa nyid yin //
analyzed: so sor ma nges pa nyid yin //
translated: are not ascertained individually.

original: bde ba'i ngo bo'i phung po ni //
analyzed: bde ba'i ngo bo'i phung po ni //
translated: The aggregates that have the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yin no //
translated: because it is a formation, like the feeling aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this reason inconclusive?

original: tshor ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of feeling:üîΩpleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: de la phung po yin pa'i phyir ci tshor ba bde pa bzhin du phung po bde ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur ram /üîΩ'on te yang phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba sdug bsngal @236a * //
analyzed: de la phung po yin pa'i phyir ci tshor ba bde pa bzhin du phung po bde ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur ram / 'on te yang phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba sdug bsngal @236a * //
translated: Is the aggregate pleasant by nature, like pleasant feeling,

original: bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur ram /üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo zhig tu 'gyur ram / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: or is it unpleasant by nature, like unpleasant feeling,

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa nyid gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa nyid gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: or is it neither unpleasant nor pleasant, like neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling?üîΩThis reason is inconclusive.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du sgrub na yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du sgrub na yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di nyid yin te /
translated: If you prove that it is unpleasant by nature, the same reductio follows.

original: phung po ni gti mug gi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: phung po ni gti mug gi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The aggregate is of the nature of delusion,

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is an aggregate, like the feeling aggregate.

original: tshor ba ni gti mug ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bsgrub byas stong pa nyid yin pas na dpe'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni gti mug ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir bsgrub byas stong pa nyid yin pas na dpe'i skyon yin no //
translated: Feeling is not the nature of delusion, so it is empty of the probandum. Therefore, it is a faulty example.

original: gal te yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di skad du /
translated: If you say,

original: gti mug kyang tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gti mug kyang tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDelusion is the nature of feeling,üîΩbecause it has a cause, like pleasant and painful feelings,‚ÄùüîΩthen it is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,

original: ma nges pa yi spangs pas na //üîΩde ltar don byed bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: ma nges pa yi spangs pas na // de ltar don byed bdag nyid yin //
translated: because it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir //üîΩci gti mug tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir // ci gti mug tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur ram /
translated: because it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,

original: 'on te rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: because it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,

original: des 'di ltar ma nges pa nyid kyis yongs su spangs pa nyid yin pas na yang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des 'di ltar ma nges pa nyid kyis yongs su spangs pa nyid yin pas na yang ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the example.üîΩThe example is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-establishment of the meaning.üîΩThe meaning is not established,üîΩbecause it is refuted by the non-

original: gzhan yang / rjes 'gro sogs kyi rjes dpag gi / dam bcas skyon gyis gnod pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rjes 'gro sogs kyi rjes dpag gi / dam bcas skyon gyis gnod pa yin //
translated: of the pervasion and so forth.

original: gtso bo ni yod do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo ni yod do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe principal exists‚Äù is a thesis.

original: rjes su dpog par byed pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed pas rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: It is damaged by the contradiction of the pervasion and so forth because it is inferred.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas ni rtag pa ma yin pa dang / khyab pa ma yin pa la sogs par rjes su dpog pas rtag pa dang kun la khyab pa la sogs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo yang spangs ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pas ni rtag pa ma yin pa dang / khyab pa ma yin pa la sogs par rjes su dpog pas rtag pa dang kun la khyab pa la sogs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo yang spangs ba yin no //
translated: Since the pervasion and so forth infer that it is not permanent, not all-pervading, and so forth, it is abandoned that it is permanent, all-pervading, and so forth. Therefore the intrinsic reality of the subject is also abandoned.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / skye med mtha' med nyid sogs kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / skye med mtha' med nyid sogs kyi //
translated: The non-arisen, the infinite, and so forth

original: de yis khyad par spangs pas na //
analyzed: de yis khyad par spangs pas na //
translated: are abandoned by that.

original: gtso bo'i yon tan 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: gtso bo'i yon tan 'dod pa yi //
translated: The reason of one who asserts the qualities of the principal

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin //
translated: is just indeterminate.

original: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis kyang ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa yod pa'i snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa yod ba bzhin gtso bo yang sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis kyang ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa yod pa'i snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa yod ba bzhin gtso bo yang sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: The reasonings of concomitance and so on also prove that since the pot is a product, it is impermanent, just as a pot that is broken into pieces exists when it is a pot.üîΩIn the same way, since it is proven that it is produced and has an end, the primal substance is not unproduced and not without an end.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa nyid dang / mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du yang sgrub par byed pas gtso bo ni ma skyes pa dang / mtha' @236b med pa yin no zhes zer ba des na de'i khyad par spangs pas chos can gyi khyad par yang spangs pa yin pa'i phyir don dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa nyid dang / mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du yang sgrub par byed pas gtso bo ni ma skyes pa dang / mtha' @236b med pa yin no zhes zer ba des na de'i khyad par spangs pas chos can gyi khyad par yang spangs pa yin pa'i phyir don dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the qualifier of the subject is abandoned by abandoning its particularities, it is contradictory to the meaning.

original: gtso bo'i ngo bo ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i ngo bo ni gtso bo'o //
translated: The nature of the primal substance is the primal substance.

original: yon tan ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams te gtso bo la brten pa rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams te gtso bo la brten pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities are sattva, rajas, and tamas, which are based on the primal substance.

original: gtso bo'i yon tan de rnams ni byed pa rgyu med pa'i phyir byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i yon tan de rnams ni byed pa rgyu med pa'i phyir byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: Those qualities of the primal substance are without activity because they are causeless.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang dbye ba la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang 'dir brtag dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang dbye ba la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang 'dir brtag dgos pa yin te /
translated: Also, this statement that these such as following and transformation exist in the classification must be investigated here.

original: ci rjes su 'gro ba 'di snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa bzhin du dbye ba rgyu dang bcas pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci rjes su 'gro ba 'di snod chag pa'i dum bu la sogs pa bzhin du dbye ba rgyu dang bcas pa zhig yin nam /
translated: Is this following like the shards of a broken pot, a classification that has a cause?
